Title: Data Analyst Working Student
Description:
Lovehoney Group is the worldâ€™s leading sexual wellbeing company. We offer exciting brands with innovative, high-quality sex toys, lingerie, and accessories in a smooth online shopping experience.

Lovehoney employs over 900 awesome, diverse & driven people throughout our 9 offices across the globe, celebrating a broad spectrum of talents in engineering, industrial design, sales, and marketing.

We are proud to be a company that thrives by doing things differently, challenging expectations and stereotypes while making a positive impact on our customersâ€™ lives.

We are currently recruiting a Working Student Data Analyst who will be integral to driving high-level performance across Lovehoney Group. Your focus will be on leveraging our technology stack to derive insights and support various teams within the business.

What You Will Do


Utilize tools like Google Analytics, Big Query, Airflow, Tableau, and Superset to analyse data from our group data warehouse
Collaborate with finance, marketing, and product teams to produce reporting capabilities and insights
Develop visualizations and storytelling to communicate complex data analysis in an understandable manner
Understand and apply core e-commerce KPIs in your analysis
Utilize your analytical and problem-solving skills to identify trends and insights



What You Should Bring


Currently enrolled in a degree in business, mathematics, science, or engineering
Experience in writing and reviewing SQL queries
Proficiency in building visualizations and data storytelling
Understanding of core e-commerce KPIs
Strong analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills



What We Can Offer You


A welcoming workplace full of drinks, snacks, and friendly faces, as well as a range of benefits that make working with us an unforgettable experience.
Fun team-building events, including dinners, barbecues, and games, that bring our team together and foster a sense of community
Discount Shopping Portal: Access to unique discounts at high street retailers, hotels, and service providers through Perks at Work.
A hybrid work model that allows for flexibility and work-life balance, with three days a week in-office
25 holiday days a year, plus an extra day for every year you are with Lovehoney, giving you plenty of time to rest, recharge, and explore



Lovehoney Group is an equal opportunities employer. We promise that every qualified person will be evaluated according to skills regardless of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage and civil partnership, pregnancy and maternity, race, religion or belief, sex, or sexual orientation.

If you require accommodations during the interview process due to a disability, please inform your Talent Acquisition Specialist so that we can ensure a smooth and inclusive experience for all candidates.

At Lovehoney Group, we leverage artificial intelligence as part of our screening interview process, for note-taking purposes. Rest assured, we prioritize transparency and respect candidates' preferences. You'll have the option to opt out while still receiving fair consideration for the role.

We currently have a hybrid work model supporting a blend of in-office and remote work (3 days per week in-office)

If we sparked your interest and you are open to embarking on your professional path with us, please visit our Lovehoney careers page to apply: https://jobs.eu.lever.co/lovehoneygroup

Our privacy policy is available here: https://www.lovehoneygroup.com/privacy-policy/

Title: Data Analyst (m/f/d)
Description:
Job Description

Data Analyst (m/f/d)

THIS IS US

At Oetker Digital, we partner with the Oetker Group companies to define what digital business transformation means and to create business value and impact based on data, technology and talents, so that they can unlock their digital future. We support many beloved brands such as Dr. Oetker, Radeberger and Coppenrath & Wiese.

With our team of about 100 talented individuals from diverse backgrounds, based in our Berlin headquarters, we foster an open, positive learning culture, driven by our shared values and the spirit of a family-run company.

THE ROLE We are looking for a talented Data Analyst to join our innovative and international Data & Insights team. By understanding the data needs of our stakeholders, you'll provide valuable insights and clear recommendations to support our data-driven decision-making process.

What You'll Do


Dive into complex marketing data sets to uncover trends and insights that drive key business decisions. Your work will have a direct impact on the strategy and growth of our group companies
Collaborate with a forward-thinking team that embraces the latest technologies and methodologies. We believe in continuous learning and innovation
Partner closely with team members and external business stakeholders to understand their data needs and objectives
Act as a consultant, using probing questions to gain deep insights into the business domain and processes
Communicate insights in a compelling and accessible manner to support data-driven decision-making



Requirements

WHAT YOU'LL BRING


At least 3 years of experience in data analysis or data consulting, preferably within a business context, preferably in Consulting
A Bachelorâ€™s or Masterâ€™s degree in a related field (e.g., Economics, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science)
Proficient in SQL and/or Python for data analysis and modeling
Experiences with Marketing Data and Analytics, as well as Retail Media and Customer Analytics would be a big plus
Familiarity with Cloud platforms for data storage and processing, having worked with BigQuery is a plus
Strong abilities in generating reports using data visualization tools such as Power BI or Tableau
A proactive and collaborative mindset, with the ability to work effectively in cross-functional teams
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to communicate complex ideas clearly
A passion for learning, hands-on work, taking ownership, and making an impact
Fluent in German and English



What We Offer


Modern and dog friendly office located at the heart of Berlin
Hybrid working model with flexible working hours for a healthy work-life balance
We work in cross-functional and international teams and have regular company/team events
28 days of paid vacation, plus Christmas and New Yearâ€™s Eve off, as well as the possibility to take a sabbatical or additional unpaid leave
10 paid childâ€™s sick days per year
Annual learning and development budget purchase educational resources up to â‚¬1.500
Equipment of your choice: Macbook or Lenovo, plus additional devices for your home office set up
In house conversational German classes for beginners
Subsidized Urban Sports Club Membership or BVG Deutschland Ticket
Mental well-being support, including individual sessions, through our partner Likeminded
Premium relocation support for colleagues outside of Germany: visa application support, assistance with searching temporary accommodation, payment of the first monthly rent
Company pension scheme and personal accident insurance
Corporate discounts from a wide range of external partners

Title: Data Analyst (m/f/x)
Description:
Carhartt WIP is part of the WIP Trading AG. Our family-owned business group started as a licensee and European distributor of the US workwear manufacturer Carhartt in the early 1990s. Since then, it develops its own collections based on workwear originals.




Carhartt Work In Progress aims to continuously progress and evolve, without ever losing sight of its origins. Over the course of the past two decades, our business has developed organically, along with its customers, the culture that surrounds the brand, and its employees who have helped shape what Carhartt WIP is today.




Your Responsibilities:

Management of and participation in Ecom&ERP projects in the BI environment
Implementation of change requests from the Ecom/CRM Team in the BI environment
Close cooperation with external service providers and partners
Ensuring operation & support for the BI systems of the Carhartt WIP Ecom&APP
Technical contact for the BI architecture in the ERP/Ecom environment




Your Profile:

Very good technical understanding of ERP, Commercetools and DWH architecture
At least 5 years of professional experience in a comparable function
Experience in working with Power BI is a plus
Entrepreneurial mindset and high customer orientation
Hands on and agile Mindset
Very good process understanding in the ecom&retail landscape
Very good technological understanding in the reporting area
Good analytical and logical thinking skills
Very good communication skills




Your Benefits:

Be part of the progress - find your place in our unique WIP culture
As part of the WIP crew you have the opportunity to connect at our events or just have fun
Your closet benefits from our staff discounts
Your future, our upgrade - we subsidise your company pension scheme by 100%
Your well-being is important to us - we contribute to this with free beverages




Your Location:

Berlin (Kreuzberg) / Germany

Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Are you a skilled Python and SQL user with a strong analytical background? Are you passionate about uncovering insights within data and applying them to real-world financial challenges? Then you might just be the Data Analyst we're looking for!

Your Primary Responsibilities Will Be


Manage the end-to-end process of data-driven knowledge gathering (connect, mine, simulate, predict, illustrate, and deploy)
Create data-based solutions to address complex business challenges


What We're Looking For


Solid analytical skills (you're a natural problem solver)
Proficiency in Python and SQL (you can write advanced queries with ease)
Focus on quality (you strive for excellence in everything you do)
Strong communication skills (you can explain complex ideas in simple terms)


It Would Be Great If You Also Have


Knowledge of financial markets (options, futures, etc.)
Familiarity with financial products


If it seems like a match, don't wait! Apply now and show us what you've got ðŸ”¥

What we offer;

At LYNX, we value your growth and development; we'll provide you with a supportive work environment and opportunities for your professional development.


Competitive Salary, depending on your educational level and work experience;
Pension scheme that is fully paid by LYNX;
Free lunch from our cook or lunch ticket, fresh juices & fruit;
Travel allowance;
Continuous growth potential and a training budget of â‚¬ 2,000 per year;
Trips & activities with your colleagues;
Relaxed and informal working environment.


About Us

"LYNX helps you invest in yourself"

"Working at LYNX means joining the LYNX family"

"The development opportunities make LYNX the best place to work"

This is what the employees say about LYNX and it is exactly what we want to offer: a work environment where you can get the best out of yourself. At our office in the heart of Amsterdam, Ghent, Berlin and Prague, we work every day to offer both private and professional clients the best trading opportunities, with a fast, user-friendly and reliable trading platform.

The Best Choice For Anyone Who Takes Investing Seriously

LYNX is an international FinTech that offers you a relaxed and informal work environment, where you can get the best out of yourself and where 300 people contribute together to the success of our customers since 2006.

In 2006 LYNX entered the investor market with two spearheads: very low rates and an extensive product range. This makes the online broker not only successful in the Netherlands, but also abroad. After opening offices in Belgium, Germany and the Czech Republic, LYNX now offers its services in ten different countries, making it a European broker of size.

In 2019 the product of LYNX, and therefore the offer for investors, has been greatly improved. For example, a highly advanced mobile and tablet app is available, the LYNX Masterclass webinars can be watched weekly via the Knowledge Portal, and thanks to the Morning Call, investors are quickly daily informed about the latest news on the financial markets.

Title: BI Analyst (all genders)
Description:
We drive decisions in Zalandoâ€™s Logistics and Customer Care divisions and are looking for a BI Analyst (all genders) to translate complex business requests into data products. You will help our stakeholders by creating reports, automating data, and implementing new KPIs. Furthermore, you will contribute to data projects by providing solution designs and data consulting. You will be part of a very supportive 20-person BI team with high seniority.


INCLUSIVE BY DESIGN


At Zalando, our vision is to be inclusive by design. And this vision starts with our hiring - we do not discriminate on the basis of gender identity, sexual orientation, personal expression, ethnicity, religious belief, or disability status. You are welcome to leave out your picture, age, or marital status from your application. We only assess candidates on their qualifications and merit.

We want to provide you with a great candidate experience. Feel free to inform us of any accommodations you may need, so we can best support you throughout the hiring process.

do.BETTER - our diversity & inclusion strategy https //corporate.zalando.com/en/our-impact/dobetter-our-diversity-and-inclusion-strategy

Our employee resource groups https //corporate.zalando.com/en/our-impact/our-employee-resource-groups


WHAT WEâ€™D LOVE YOU TO DO (AND LOVE DOING)




You gather business requirements, analyse them, connect the dots using data, and drive the implementation. You also perform data source analyses to understand our processes and provide curated data across platforms to our stakeholders.
You solve ad-hoc KPI requests and create reports in MicroStrategy
You help extend and optimise our data model.
You use Redshift, PostgreSQL, Airflow, and Databricks.
You provide meaningful insights across different levels of audiences and communicate effectively, translating complex topics into manageable, simple, plain language.
You collaborate with our engineers and project managers to create and implement new self-service reporting initiatives in an agile environment. You also build a strong, trust-based network with stakeholders, peers, and others.
You get a tailored BI Analytics development plan and training to foster growth.




WEâ€™D LOVE TO MEET YOU IF




You obtained an academic degree in Information Systems, Analytics, Economics, Computer Science, Statistics, or other similar quantitative fields.
You have experience in working with big piles of data.
You are a quick learner, analytical, solution-driven, pragmatic, and stakeholder-focused.
You are passionate about reading and writing complex statements and modelling data structures on relational databases.
You challenge the status quo, drive innovation, and are keen to identify and apply best practices.
Fluent in English is a must. Experience in Logistics or Customer Care is a plus.




OUR OFFER


Zalando provides a range of benefits, hereâ€™s an overview of what you can expect. Ask your Talent Acquisition Partner to learn more about what we offer.



Employee shares program
40% off fashion and beauty products sold and shipped by Zalando, 30% off Zalando Lounge, discounts from external partners
2 paid volunteering days a year
Hybrid working model, with flexible hours and up to 60% remote
Work from abroad for up to 30 working days a year
27 days of vacation a year to start
Relocation assistance available (subject to prior agreement)
Family services, including counseling and support
Health and wellbeing options (including Gympass)
Mental health support and coaching available
Drive your development through our training platform and biannual peer-to-peer review




ABOUT ZALANDO


Itâ€™s the perfect time to join Zalandoâ€™s journey, from being a pioneer in the world of e-commerce, to becoming the Starting Point for Fashion in Europe. We connect customers, brands, and partners across 25 markets.

Help us drive digital and sustainable solutions for fashion, logistics, advertising and research, bringing head-to-toe fashion to more than 49 million active customers.

Our values https //jobs.zalando.com/en/our-founding-mindset

do.More - our sustainability strategy https //corporate.zalando.com/en/our-impact/domore-our-sustainability-strategy

Follow us on Instagram instagram.com/insidezalando

Please note that all applications must be completed using the online form - we do not accept applications via email.

Title: Data Analyst / Decision Scientist, Help Experience
Description:
Brief info about Vinted

Vinted Marketplace is the largest online international C2C marketplace in Europe dedicated to second-hand fashion, with millions of registered members spanning 22 markets in Europe and North America. With a mission to make second-hand the first choice worldwide, Vinted enables people to sell and buy second-hand clothes and lifestyle items from each other, helping give those items a second or even third life.

Vinted Go launched in 2022, with a focus on developing products and solutions for more seamless shipping and delivery across Europe. Vinted Go has connected more than 40 carriers and more than 200,000 PUDO points across Europe to support the delivery of millions of parcels per year.

The Vinted Group, composed of Vinted Marketplace and Vinted Go, is headquartered in Vilnius, with workplaces in Germany, Lithuania, France, the United Kingdom, the Netherlands and over 2,000 employees. It is backed by six leading venture capital firms: Accel, Burda Principal Investments, EQT Growth, Insight Partners, Lightspeed Venture Partners, and Sprints Capital.

Information about the position

As our new Decision Scientist, youâ€™ll become part of a cross-functional team in the Help Experience domain with a mission to enable an effortless, scalable and cost effective support experience for our Vinted members. Your teamâ€™s focus will be on supporting our Member Support function and enabling quality and efficiency improvements through automation, self-service, and operational excellence.

Weâ€™re looking for someone who is a strategic thinker, a problem solver, with a strong data background, who aims high. You like to work in a fast-changing environment, and you are passionate about the product weâ€™re building together.

Next to the product team you will be part of the cross-domain Data Science & Analytics (DSA) guild where you will interact and learn from all data people in Vinted. Within Data Science & Analytics (DSA) we have three distinct roles. To understand your role within DSA context better, here are brief descriptions of each role we have in the department:


Decision Scientists are responsible for actionable insights, identifying and sizing opportunities, and automated tools that increase the quality of product and business decisions by applying statistical methods and data-driven decision making.
Analytics Engineers are responsible for data curation â€“ translating data needs from stakeholders into architecting, building and maintaining efficient & reliable data models and pipelines.
Data Scientists are responsible for identification of algorithmic opportunities, ensuring those opportunities are addressed in an optimal fashion and design, development and maintenance of production-grade statistical and machine learning algorithms.


You will report to the Director of data science & analytics in Help Experience and work closely with other leaders in the domain, particularly in the data science & analytics and product functions.

In this position, youâ€™ll


Collaborate with your team and direct stakeholders to identify strategic opportunities and answer key business questions
Ensure these questions are answered in an optimal fashion (e.g. in the form of an ad hoc deep-dive, experiment, dashboard, or automatically recurring analysis)
Analyze identified opportunities to understand their scope and impact (i.e. size opportunities)
Own the key performance indicators for a team, including selection, tracking, forecasting, and proactively flagging issues
Enable your team and direct stakeholders to independently leverage data for business insights via self-serving and dashboarding tools (Looker)
Define the requirements for (A/B) testing and analyze the results of (A/B) tests
Help to create a backlog with prioritized hypotheses and analyses


About You


Demonstratable experience as a Decision Scientist, Data Analyst, Product Analyst or a Strategic role with a strong data component.
BSc or MSc in Applied Mathematics, Data Science, Computer Science, Economics, Statistics, Econometrics, or another related field (equivalent working experience is also acceptable)
Highly business-oriented and comfortable with iterative processes
A good communicator who can present complex topics clearly and persuasively to different audiences
Excellent written and spoken English
Are able to balance between analyses depth (time needed) and business impact
Ability to deal with uncertainty and to combine data insights with strategic thinking
Statistical proficiency (e.g. A/B testing, regression analysis)
Advanced knowledge of at least one statistical programming language (Python, R, etc.)
Fluency with SQL and experience with dashboarding tools (e.g. Looker, Tableau, etc.)


Work perks


The opportunity to benefit from our share options programme
30 days of paid annual leave
Newest MacBook models
Mental and emotional health support through the Mindletic app
Home office support: we provide IT workstation equipment and a personal budget of up to â‚¬540 for home workplace furniture
A daily lunch allowance
Frequent team-building events
A personal monthly budget for shopping on Vinted
A subsidised gym membership with ClassPass or Urban Sports Card
A subsidised pension plan provided by Vinted
Hallesche Supplemental health insurance
Life and disability insurance provided
A subsidised Deutschlandticket
The opportunity to spend up to 90 days per year - 21 of which can be spent working outside of the EU - on workation
A dog-friendly office


Working at Vinted

Individual Learning Budget

Vinted will set aside a yearly sum equal to 10-13.2% of your annual salary to be invested in your continuous professional development. Youâ€™ll be able to take the initiative to use it for covering relevant learning activities that benefit your role.

Hybrid Work

Weâ€™ve adopted a hybrid workplace model where 2 days in the office are recommended but not enforced. Itâ€™s up to you and your team to decide on the exact days youâ€™ll spend working together in person.

Equal Opportunity

The Vinted Group is committed to building an inclusive workplace where people from all walks of life feel a sense of belonging. We welcome applications from people of all backgrounds, identities and life experiences. At Vinted, all applicants are treated fairly without regard to their race, age, religion or belief, sex, national origin, citizenship, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, or any other protected characteristic.

The salary range for this position is â‚¬69,000 - â‚¬93,400 gross per year.
Show more
HTML:
Brief info about Vinted

Vinted Marketplace is the largest online international C2C marketplace in Europe dedicated to second-hand fashion, with millions of registered members spanning 22 markets in Europe and North America. With a mission to make second-hand the first choice worldwide, Vinted enables people to sell and buy second-hand clothes and lifestyle items from each other, helping give those items a second or even third life.

Vinted Go launched in 2022, with a focus on developing products and solutions for more seamless shipping and delivery across Europe. Vinted Go has connected more than 40 carriers and more than 200,000 PUDO points across Europe to support the delivery of millions of parcels per year.

The Vinted Group, composed of Vinted Marketplace and Vinted Go, is headquartered in Vilnius, with workplaces in Germany, Lithuania, France, the United Kingdom, the Netherlands and over 2,000 employees. It is backed by six leading venture capital firms: Accel, Burda Principal Investments, EQT Growth, Insight Partners, Lightspeed Venture Partners, and Sprints Capital.

Information about the position

As our new Decision Scientist, youâ€™ll become part of a cross-functional team in the Help Experience domain with a mission to enable an effortless, scalable and cost effective support experience for our Vinted members. Your teamâ€™s focus will be on supporting our Member Support function and enabling quality and efficiency improvements through automation, self-service, and operational excellence.

Weâ€™re looking for someone who is a strategic thinker, a problem solver, with a strong data background, who aims high. You like to work in a fast-changing environment, and you are passionate about the product weâ€™re building together.

Next to the product team you will be part of the cross-domain Data Science & Analytics (DSA) guild where you will interact and learn from all data people in Vinted. Within Data Science & Analytics (DSA) we have three distinct roles. To understand your role within DSA context better, here are brief descriptions of each role we have in the department:

  • Decision Scientists are responsible for actionable insights, identifying and sizing opportunities, and automated tools that increase the quality of product and business decisions by applying statistical methods and data-driven decision making.
  • Analytics Engineers are responsible for data curation â€“ translating data needs from stakeholders into architecting, building and maintaining efficient & reliable data models and pipelines.
  • Data Scientists are responsible for identification of algorithmic opportunities, ensuring those opportunities are addressed in an optimal fashion and design, development and maintenance of production-grade statistical and machine learning algorithms.

You will report to the Director of data science & analytics in Help Experience and work closely with other leaders in the domain, particularly in the data science & analytics and product functions.

In this position, youâ€™ll

  • Collaborate with your team and direct stakeholders to identify strategic opportunities and answer key business questions
  • Ensure these questions are answered in an optimal fashion (e.g. in the form of an ad hoc deep-dive, experiment, dashboard, or automatically recurring analysis)
  • Analyze identified opportunities to understand their scope and impact (i.e. size opportunities)
  • Own the key performance indicators for a team, including selection, tracking, forecasting, and proactively flagging issues
  • Enable your team and direct stakeholders to independently leverage data for business insights via self-serving and dashboarding tools (Looker)
  • Define the requirements for (A/B) testing and analyze the results of (A/B) tests
  • Help to create a backlog with prioritized hypotheses and analyses

About You

  • Demonstratable experience as a Decision Scientist, Data Analyst, Product Analyst or a Strategic role with a strong data component.
  • BSc or MSc in Applied Mathematics, Data Science, Computer Science, Economics, Statistics, Econometrics, or another related field (equivalent working experience is also acceptable)
  • Highly business-oriented and comfortable with iterative processes
  • A good communicator who can present complex topics clearly and persuasively to different audiences
  • Excellent written and spoken English
  • Are able to balance between analyses depth (time needed) and business impact
  • Ability to deal with uncertainty and to combine data insights with strategic thinking
  • Statistical proficiency (e.g. A/B testing, regression analysis)
  • Advanced knowledge of at least one statistical programming language (Python, R, etc.)
  • Fluency with SQL and experience with dashboarding tools (e.g. Looker, Tableau, etc.)

Work perks

  • The opportunity to benefit from our share options programme
  • 30 days of paid annual leave
  • Newest MacBook models
  • Mental and emotional health support through the Mindletic app
  • Home office support: we provide IT workstation equipment and a personal budget of up to â‚¬540 for home workplace furniture
  • A daily lunch allowance
  • Frequent team-building events
  • A personal monthly budget for shopping on Vinted
  • A subsidised gym membership with ClassPass or Urban Sports Card
  • A subsidised pension plan provided by Vinted
  • Hallesche Supplemental health insurance
  • Life and disability insurance provided
  • A subsidised Deutschlandticket
  • The opportunity to spend up to 90 days per year - 21 of which can be spent working outside of the EU - on workation
  • A dog-friendly office

Working at Vinted

Individual Learning Budget

Vinted will set aside a yearly sum equal to 10-13.2% of your annual salary to be invested in your continuous professional development. Youâ€™ll be able to take the initiative to use it for covering relevant learning activities that benefit your role.

Hybrid Work

Weâ€™ve adopted a hybrid workplace model where 2 days in the office are recommended but not enforced. Itâ€™s up to you and your team to decide on the exact days youâ€™ll spend working together in person.

Equal Opportunity

The Vinted Group is committed to building an inclusive workplace where people from all walks of life feel a sense of belonging. We welcome applications from people of all backgrounds, identities and life experiences. At Vinted, all applicants are treated fairly without regard to their race, age, religion or belief, sex, national origin, citizenship, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, or any other protected characteristic.

The salary range for this position is â‚¬69,000 - â‚¬93,400 gross per year.

Title: Growth Data Analyst Intern (all genders)
Description:
As Europe's fastest-growing unicorn, we revolutionize eCommerce globally. Through strategic acquisitions, scaling initiatives, and cutting-edge technology, we're the top player in the industry. Following our recent acquisition of Perch - the leading US aggregator - and a successful Series D funding round led by Presight Captial, we're aimed toward a $1 billion top-line business!

Your Role

As a Growth Data Analyst Intern on our Organic Growth & Automation Team, you will play a pivotal role in supporting the Team Lead in both strategic and operational development efforts aimed at enhancing the organic growth of our product portfolio. You will be involved in collaborations with external stakeholders to optimize and expand our reach. A great opportunity to develop and refine your skills in a supportive and innovative environment with a talented team that is building Europe's next-generation consumer goods giant!

Your responsibilities will include:


Assisting in the strategic planning and execution of organic growth initiatives to enhance marketplace performance
Utilizing AI and advanced automation tools to ensure product listings for over 40,000 products are optimized to deliver maximum value to consumers, driving sales growth
Leveraging your technical skills to process and analyze data using Excel, SQL, and/or Python, ensuring listings meet the highest standards
Collaborating closely with internal teams and external partners to drive strategic collaborations and partnerships
Maintaining a keen eye for detail to ensure all product listings are accurate, comprehensive, and compelling


Your Profile

To succeed in this role you:


Are currently pursuing or recently completed a Bachelor's or Master's degree from a top-ranking university
Hold strong skills in Excel, SQL, and/or Python
Possess the ability to process and analyze data effectively to drive insights and actions
Pay exceptional attention to detail, ensuring high standards are maintained across all tasks
Are Comfortable working with AI tools and advanced automation technologies
Thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment and is eager to contribute to the growth of a leading e-commerce company
Have excellent interpersonal and communication skills, with the ability to work effectively in cross-functional teams


About Razor Group

We are revolutionizing the e-commerce world, reaching over $1 billion in value and over $700 million in revenue, with the backing of top investors like Black Rock, VPC, and Fortress, Apollo, 468 Capital, Rocket Internet. Along with Perch and our previous acquisitions of Factory14 in Spain, Valoreo in Latin America, and our German competitor Stryze, we now operate a catalogue of over 40,000 products across 3 continents and 10+ countries. Headquartered in Berlin, we are also present in Austin, Boston, Delhi NCR, Hangzhou, and Mexico City!
Show more

Title: Data Analyst, Finance & Strategy
Description:
About Gelato

Gelato has built the world's largest and most global network for on-demand production of customized items e.g. t-shirts, wall art, mugs, books, hoodies, and cards. We support a new wave of e-commerce entrepreneurs to sell their creativity globally, with a more local and sustainable production. With local production and exact matching of supply and demand, there is no waste, and carbon emissions are reduced.

We own no assets - we build the software that connects world-class production facilities all across the world. We have more than 130 production partners in 32 countries. In 72 hours we can reach more than 5 billion people with customized products in a smarter, faster, and greener way.

Gelato is changing the way that customized products can be produced on-demand. We are already empowering thousands of e-commerce entrepreneurs to grow and scale their businesses. With local production, and exact matching of supply and demand, there is no waste and carbon emissions are reduced.

Gelato consists of three different business units:

Optimalprint - our B2C e-commerce business, offering beautiful high-quality personalized products to consumers all over the world. The products are produced on-demand by Gelatoâ€™s local production network.

GelatoCreate - giving creators across the world instant access to a global market of customers. Simple integrations to webshops such as Shopify, Etsy and TikTok allow creators to connect and personalize their designs for a wide range of quality products, and Gelato takes care of the production and fulfillment through our local production.

GelatoConnect - the backbone of Gelato is enterprise software that powers the world's most advanced production on demand facilities, providing unmatched production workflow, logistics and procurement efficiency, quality management and cost savings.




What we are looking for

We are seeking analytics professionals with a passion for business impact to join our world class Finance & Strategy team. As a Data Analyst, you will help build strategic reports for investor and leadership teams and carry out analysis that will inform important financial and strategic decisions for Gelato. You will guide the finance team using data and insights by not simply presenting data, but telling data-driven stories. You will convince and influence your finance and strategy team members using clear insights and recommendations.

The position is based in Gelatoâ€™s offices in London (UK), Oslo (Norway), Stockholm (Sweden), and Madrid (Spain)

What you will be doing

Own the design, development, and maintenance of metrics, reports and dashboards to drive key business performance visibility for finance and strategy teams.
Identify trends & patterns using internal and external data sources powered with analytic models to provide actionable insights to business decision-makers.
Generate forecasts, recommendations, and strategic/tactical plans necessary to drive and influence business decision-making.
Share your knowledge and build creative solutions while helping the team evolve best practices.

Who you are

4 years+ of data analytics experience.
Strong attention to detail, ensuring accuracy and integrity in all your analyses
Good time management. You can handle multiple tasks, meeting deadlines without compromising quality.
Collaborative. You work well in a team environment, collaborating effectively with cross-functional teams.
Strong project and stakeholder management skills. You keep all stakeholders informed and manage expectations effectively.
Extensive hands-on experience in SQL.
Experience with data visualization and BI tools like Looker/Tableau/PowerBI.
Good knowledge of statistical analysis.
Excellent communication and presentation skills.

Preferred Qualifications

Experience with finance data or in finance related roles.
Advanced experience with Looker.
Experience in management consulting would be a plus.

What we offer

We offer you a chance to be part of a truly amazing journey in a company that sets very high targets and works hard to achieve them. You will be able to work with smart, motivated, and engaged co-workers from all over the world, in an intense and very energetic environment. This leads to you having a tangible impact on the way that we operate and expand our business.

Some of the highlights of the package include:

Strong technical culture of continuous innovation and improvement
Chance to become a shareholder of Gelato!
Flexible festive holidays, swap days off according to your values and beliefs.
Work at one of our hub city offices or even remotely
And much much more!

What itâ€™s like to work at Gelato

We are a customer-obsessed team with the ambition to change the world by connecting technology to the printing industry and making it much more sustainable. Everyone who joins our team must feel genuinely intrigued and motivated by our mission. We expect a lot. We are a driven team with big goals, so we seek individuals who are genuinely passionate about their work and possess an entrepreneurial spirit. Our culture is unique and we live by our values, so it's worth learning more about our culture and how we work before presenting your application.

At Gelato, we pride ourselves on our global presence with 14 offices worldwide, fostering a dynamic and diverse work environment. Rooted in a culture that values collaboration, creativity, and camaraderie, we actively cultivate a company culture that thrives on shared experiences. We encourage team members to embrace this culture by working from our inspiring office spaces at least three days a week, allowing for meaningful connections and collective growth.

Lastly, we ask that you please upload your CV in English, regardless of which country you are applying from.

The position is based in Gelatoâ€™s offices in London (UK), Oslo (Norway), Stockholm (Sweden), and Madrid (Spain)

What you will be doing

  • Own the design, development, and maintenance of metrics, reports and dashboards to drive key business performance visibility for finance and strategy teams.
  • Identify trends & patterns using internal and external data sources powered with analytic models to provide actionable insights to business decision-makers.
  • Generate forecasts, recommendations, and strategic/tactical plans necessary to drive and influence business decision-making.
  • Share your knowledge and build creative solutions while helping the team evolve best practices.

Who you are

  • 4 years+ of data analytics experience.
  • Strong attention to detail, ensuring accuracy and integrity in all your analyses
  • Good time management. You can handle multiple tasks, meeting deadlines without compromising quality.
  • Collaborative. You work well in a team environment, collaborating effectively with cross-functional teams.
  • Strong project and stakeholder management skills. You keep all stakeholders informed and manage expectations effectively.
  • Extensive hands-on experience in SQL.
  • Experience with data visualization and BI tools like Looker/Tableau/PowerBI.
  • Good knowledge of statistical analysis.
  • Excellent communication and presentation skills.

Preferred Qualifications

  • Experience with finance data or in finance related roles.
  • Advanced experience with Looker.
  • Experience in management consulting would be a plus.

What we offer

We offer you a chance to be part of a truly amazing journey in a company that sets very high targets and works hard to achieve them. You will be able to work with smart, motivated, and engaged co-workers from all over the world, in an intense and very energetic environment. This leads to you having a tangible impact on the way that we operate and expand our business.

Some of the highlights of the package include:

  • Strong technical culture of continuous innovation and improvement
  • Chance to become a shareholder of Gelato!
  • Flexible festive holidays, swap days off according to your values and beliefs.
  • Work at one of our hub city offices or even remotely
  • And much much more!

What itâ€™s like to work at Gelato

We are a customer-obsessed team with the ambition to change the world by connecting technology to the printing industry and making it much more sustainable. Everyone who joins our team must feel genuinely intrigued and motivated by our mission. We expect a lot. We are a driven team with big goals, so we seek individuals who are genuinely passionate about their work and possess an entrepreneurial spirit. Our culture is unique and we live by our values, so it's worth learning more about our culture and how we work before presenting your application.

At Gelato, we pride ourselves on our global presence with 14 offices worldwide, fostering a dynamic and diverse work environment. Rooted in a culture that values collaboration, creativity, and camaraderie, we actively cultivate a company culture that thrives on shared experiences. We encourage team members to embrace this culture by working from our inspiring office spaces at least three days a week, allowing for meaningful connections and collective growth.

Lastly, we ask that you please upload your CV in English, regardless of which country you are applying from.

Title: Senior Data Analyst (m/f/d)
Description:
THIS IS US

At Oetker Digital, we partner with the Oetker Group companies to define what digital business transformation means and to create business value and impact based on data, technology and talents, so that they can unlock their digital future. We support many beloved brands such as Dr. Oetker, Radeberger and Coppenrath & Wiese.

With our team of about 100 talented individuals from diverse backgrounds, based in our Berlin headquarters, we foster an open, positive learning culture, driven by our shared values and the spirit of a family-run company.







THE ROLE

As a Senior Data Analyst at Oetker Digital, you will play a critical role in owning and leveraging data to drive business decisions and strategies. You will work closely with various teams and business partners on the side of our Group companies to ask the right questions, deeply understand the business domains and processes, analyze datasets, generate insights and business cases based on data that help our brands grow and succeed in the digital space. Your expertise will guide the optimization of brand, marketing and sales strategies, product development, and customer engagement initiatives.







WHAT YOU'LL DO

Partner and collaborate closely with business stakeholders to understand their strategies, needs and objectives
Develop and maintain strong relationships with key business partners to ensure data solutions align with business goals
Act as a consultant, using probing questions to gain deep insights into the business domain and processes
Analyze datasets to extract actionable insights and support data-driven decision making
Develop and implement statistical models to solve complex business problems
Communicate insights in a compelling and accessible manner to support data-driven decision-making
Translate complex data findings into clear, actionable insights through effective data storytelling







WHAT YOU'LL BRING

At least 5 years of experience in data analysis or data consulting, preferably within a business context, preferably in Consulting
A Bachelorâ€™s or Masterâ€™s degree in a related field (e.g., Economics, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science)
Proficiency in SQL and/or Python for data analysis and modeling
Experiences with Cloud platforms for data storage and processing, having worked with BigQuery is a plus
Experience with data visualization tools such as Power BI or Tableau
Experience in Marketing Analytics & Optimization
A proactive and collaborative mindset, with the ability to work effectively in cross-functional teams
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to communicate complex ideas clearly
You like to learn, work hands-on, take ownership, and have an impact
Fluent in German and English







WHAT WE OFFER

At Oetker Digital, we believe that a fulfilling career goes hand-in-hand with a vibrant culture and supportive environment. Hereâ€™s a glimpse of what you can expect when you join our team:




Our Berlin office is a lively space where creativity thrives â€“ and yes, your furry friends are welcome too. Centrally located at SÃ¼dkreuz, it offers excellent connections to public transport.
Enjoy the best of both worlds with our flexible hybrid work setup, designed to foster a healthy work-life balance.
Tailor your work schedule to fit your daily routine, ensuring you can achieve both professional success and personal fulfillment.
Work with diverse, talented colleagues from around the globe, and build meaningful connections at our regular company and team events, as well as during our monthly Collaboration Day.
Recharge with 28 days of paid vacation, plus enjoy Christmas and New Yearâ€™s Eve off. Need more time? We offer options for sabbaticals and additional unpaid leave.
We support families with 10 paid sick days per year for when your little ones need you.
Prioritize your mental health with individual sessions through our partner, Likeminded. Enjoy access to their exclusive workshops and webinars designed to support your well-being.
Invest in your future with up to â‚¬1,500 annually for courses, books, and other educational resources.
We foster a dynamic learning culture designed to empower your growth through Collaboration Days, Yeast Initiative exchanges, and knowledge-sharing sessions.
We offer a clear five-step career pathway, with the opportunity to choose from three advanced career tracks after reaching the senior level.
Choose between a Macbook or Lenovo, and get additional devices to perfect your home office setup.
Stay active with a subsidized Urban Sports Club Membership or BVG Deutschland Ticket.
Secure your future with our robust company pension plan and personal accident insurance.
Enjoy special discounts from a wide range of external partners, making your everyday life more affordable and enjoyable.




Ready to take the next step in your career? Join us and experience a workplace where your well-being and growth are our top priorities. Apply today and letâ€™s unlock next level Oetker together!







Diversity and Inclusion

At Oetker Digital, we believe that diversity, equity and inclusion are crucial elements of a respectful and inspiring workplace. We value the unique experiences that each individual brings to our team, and we are committed to creating a culture where everyone feels valued.

We are an equal opportunity employer and welcome applications from candidates of all walks of life, backgrounds, identities, and experiences. Even if you don't meet all the requirements above, we actively encourage you to apply. We're eager to learn about the perspective you can bring to our team!

Title: Customer Data Analyst (Customer Segmentation) (all genders)
Description:
THE ROLE & THE TEAM

You work for the Customer Analytics team in Zalandoâ€™s Markets organization, which enables data driven business strategies for 20+ countries. Through our customer focussed analytics and segmentations we put our customers at the center of every marketing and retail decision. As a (Senior) Customer Data Analyst in our Customer Segmentation Team you are the closest link to our customer You build a deep understanding of our customer base by developing and analyzing different customer segments based on their purchasing behavior, interests, customer value and onsite activities. You will transform data and segmentations into actionable insights and recommendations that drive strategic decisions and customer retention.

WHAT WEâ€™D LOVE YOU TO DO (AND LOVE DOING)



Develop and analyze customer segmentations and audiences, support targeting and steering initiatives to drive customer value and retention. Collaborate with data scientists and engineers to optimize and productionalize your segmentations and audience selections.
Design, conduct and evaluate A/B tests to optimize your segmentations and audiences according to their use case. Recommend testing strategies to optimize targeted campaigns, campaign efficiency and ultimately customer value and retention. Translate complex questions into sound analytical tasks, autonomously planning large scale projects.
Collaborate with business stakeholders to identify new strategic opportunities and recommend actions supporting the customer strategy. Present your findings and work closely with business stakeholders and product owners to operationalize your recommendations.
Drive data mindset in the team and provide senior guidance to your team members in terms of methodology & technology to raise the bar within the department. Collaborate with other analysts, data scientists, engineers and commercial colleagues to untap new sources of data and know-how.
Independently manage analytical projects, identifying efficiency opportunities and supporting decision-making with insights from descriptive and inferential analysis.
Conduct knowledge-sharing sessions, support junior colleagues, and contribute to internal events and the hiring process.



WEâ€™D LOVE TO MEET YOU IF



You have 3+ years experience in using customer data in smart and creative ways to answer business questions and/or drive targeting efforts incl. model driven statistical analysis, e.g. Causal Inference. Very good quantitative degree, e.g. in Economics, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science.
Advanced skills in data methodologies and technologies (Python and SQL, PySpark). Visualization tools, e.g. MicroStrategy, Tableau, PowerBI and versioning tools, e.g. Git/GitHub, are considered a plus. Curious about learning new technologies, e.g. Databricks, AWS data lake, Airflow.
Strong communicator to challenge the status-quo, tell data stories, maximize decision impact of your results and liaison with commercial and tech people alike.
Proactive, fast learner, problem solver, teamplayer, comfortable working in English in a fast paced international work environment



INCLUSIVE BY DESIGN

At Zalando, our vision is to be inclusive by design. And this vision starts with our hiring - we do not discriminate on the basis of gender identity, sexual orientation, personal expression, ethnicity, religious belief, or disability status. You are welcome to leave out your picture, age, or marital status from your application. We only assess candidates on their qualifications and merit.

We want to provide you with a great candidate experience. Feel free to inform us of any accommodations you may need, so we can best support you throughout the hiring process.

https //corporate.zalando.com/en/our-impact/dobetter-our-diversity-and-inclusion-strategy

Our employee resource groups

https //corporate.zalando.com/en/our-impact/our-employee-resource-groups

We want to provide you with a great candidate experience. Feel free to inform us of any accommodations you may need, so we can best support you throughout the hiring process.

Title: Digital Data Specialist
Description:
Your Role: As a Digital Data Specialist, youâ€™ll be the architect behind our data-driven success story. Youâ€™ll be responsible for gathering, analyzing, and interpreting digital data to uncover actionable insights. From optimizing marketing campaigns to enhancing user experiences, your expertise will be instrumental in shaping our strategies and driving growth.

What Youâ€™ll Do:


Dive deep into digital data sources to extract meaningful insights.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business objectives and translate them into data requirements.
Develop and implement data collection strategies across various digital platforms.
Analyze data to identify trends, patterns, and opportunities for optimization.
Create compelling data visualizations and reports to communicate findings effectively.
Stay updated on industry trends and emerging technologies to continuously innovate our data practices.


What Weâ€™re Looking For:


Passion for data-driven decision-making and problem-solving.
Strong analytical skills with a keen eye for detail.
Proficiency in data analysis tools such as Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics, or similar.
Experience with data visualization tools like Tableau, Power BI, or Domo.
Excellent communication skills with the ability to convey complex ideas to non-technical stakeholders.
Proven track record of driving business impact through data insights.
Bachelorâ€™s degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or related field (or equivalent experience).


Why Join Us:


Opportunity to work with a dynamic team of industry experts and thought leaders.
Flexible remote work environment, empowering you to balance work and life.
Ongoing learning and development opportunities to fuel your professional growth.
Competitive compensation package and benefits.

Title: Senior People Data Analyst
Description:
Brief info about Vinted

Vinted Marketplace is the largest online international C2C marketplace in Europe dedicated to second-hand fashion, with millions of registered members spanning 22 markets in Europe and North America. With a mission to make second-hand the first choice worldwide, Vinted enables people to sell and buy second-hand clothes and lifestyle items from each other, helping give those items a second or even third life.

Vinted Go launched in 2022, with a focus on developing products and solutions for more seamless shipping and delivery across Europe. Vinted Go has connected more than 40 carriers and more than 200,000 PUDO points across Europe to support the delivery of millions of parcels per year.

The Vinted Group, composed of Vinted Marketplace and Vinted Go, is headquartered in Vilnius, with workplaces in Germany, Lithuania, France, the United Kingdom, the Netherlands and over 2,000 employees. It is backed by six leading venture capital firms: Accel, Burda Principal Investments, EQT Growth, Insight Partners, Lightspeed Venture Partners, and Sprints Capital.

Information about the position

We are looking for a Senior Analyst to join our People Analytics Team. As Vinted grows with new products, locations and increasing complexity there is a need to further support decision making in the company with people data.

As a Senior Analyst your primary focus will be on analyzing and interpreting data across the employee lifecycle providing a holistic view from candidacy to alumni. You will have an opportunity to build People analytics products from scratch and shape the People Analytics function at Vinted. Weâ€™re looking for a special candidate that has a combination of HR domain expertise, strong knowledge of analysis tools and the ability to communicate well with a variety of stakeholders.

Reporting to People Analytics Lead you will work within a team whose mandate is to accelerate people analytics at Vinted. You will work with data across various People systems like Workday, Greenhouse, Peakon and others.

In this position, youâ€™ll


Contribute to building People Analytics products and expansion of data-based culture
Understand business problems and enable business leaders and the People team to translate them into solutions supported by data and analysis
Managing dashboards, analysis and enabling for data spanning across the complete Employee Life Cycle (â€œFrom Hire to Retireâ€)
Contribute to cross-functional projects and initiatives in People team


About You


BSc or MSc in Mathematics, Computer Science, Economics, Statistics, or another related field (or equivalent working experience)
HR domain expertise
Strong analytical, strategic, and storytelling skills
Experience with data visualization tools, preferably Looker but Tableau and Power Bi are applicable too
You are a Google Sheets master
Excellent communication and relationships building skills to partner with stakeholders
Ability to prioritize and manage time effectively
Knowledge of Workday reporting would be an advantage


Nice-to-have:


Hands-on experience in statistics and advanced analysis, i.e. hypothesis testing, forecasting, predictions, sentiment analysis, etc.
Knowledge of at least one statistical programming language (R, Python, Matlab etc.)
Ability to use SQL
App scripting in Google Sheets


Work perks


The opportunity to benefit from our share options programme
30 days of paid annual leave
Newest MacBook models
Mental and emotional health support through the Mindletic app
Home office support: we provide IT workstation equipment and a personal budget of up to â‚¬540 for home workplace furniture
A daily lunch allowance
Frequent team-building events
A personal monthly budget for shopping on Vinted
A subsidised gym membership with ClassPass or Urban Sports Card
A subsidised pension plan provided by Vinted
Hallesche Supplemental health insurance
Life and disability insurance provided
A subsidised Deutschlandticket
The opportunity to spend up to 90 days per year - 21 of which can be spent working outside of the EU - on workation
A dog-friendly office


Working at Vinted

Individual Learning Budget

Vinted will set aside a yearly sum equal to 10-13.2% of your annual salary to be invested in your continuous professional development. Youâ€™ll be able to take the initiative to use it for covering relevant learning activities that benefit your role.

Hybrid Work

Weâ€™ve adopted a hybrid workplace model where 2 days in the office are recommended but not enforced. Itâ€™s up to you and your team to decide on the exact days youâ€™ll spend working together in person.

Equal Opportunity

The Vinted Group is committed to building an inclusive workplace where people from all walks of life feel a sense of belonging. We welcome applications from people of all backgrounds, identities and life experiences. At Vinted, all applicants are treated fairly without regard to their race, age, religion or belief, sex, national origin, citizenship, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, or any other protected characteristic.

The salary range for this position is â‚¬ 68,000 - â‚¬ 92,000 gross per year.

Title: Data Analyst - Vendor Sales & Operations (all genders)
Description:
About The Opportunity

We are on the lookout for a Data Analyst (f/m/d) to join the Vendor Sales & Operations - Data Team on our journey to always deliver amazing experiences.

The sustainable acquisition of good quality restaurants is a crucial part of Delivery Heroâ€™s profitability goal. We focus on: what to acquire, where, how should we prioritize the backlog of leads, what channel is better for us to prioritize investments on our side, how do we enhance the vendor experience in the onboarding process, etc.

We focus on global initiative, and our main stakeholders are global product and business teams that are also focused on restaurant acquisition.

Your Mission:


Owning end to end the analytics part on multiple projects for the Vendor management team (this can vary from Competitor intelligence, VRM, Grading, AMC)
We focus on delivering data projects and adding value with actionable insights that help the business and product teams


What you need to be successful

Your Heroic Skills


Passion for data, problem-solving and generating actionable insights that impact the business
Highly proficient in SQL
Proficient in Data visualization and storytelling
Team player and ability to think outside the box
Communication skills
Business understanding


Nice to have:


Experience with process orchestrators (preferably DBT+Airflow)
Experience in AB Testing
Practical experience working with Git (or similar version control system)


Who we are

As the worldâ€™s pioneering local delivery platform, our mission is to deliver an amazing experience, fast, easy, and to your door. We operate in over 70+ countries worldwide, powered by tech, designed by people. As one of Europeâ€™s largest tech platforms, we enable creative minds to deliver solutions that create impact within our ecosystem. We move fast, take action and adapt. No matter where you're from or what you believe in, we build, we deliver, we lead. We are Delivery Hero

What's in it for you

At Delivery Hero, we believe diversity and inclusion are key to creating not only an exciting product, but also an amazing customer and employee experience. Fostering this starts with hiring -- therefore we do not discriminate on the basis of racial identities, religious beliefs, color, national origin, gender identities or expressions, sexual orientations, age, marital or disability statuses, or any other aspect that makes you, you. Just be yourself and we canâ€™t wait to see what value you bring to the role. We're as interested in your character as we are in your talent.

Title: Senior People Data Analyst
Description:
We believe it takes great people to create a great product. Thatâ€™s why our team lives our company values, and we hire based on them, too. Since 2010, Pipedrive has been on a mission to support sales and marketing teams with easy-to-use, powerful tools that make everyday work faster and easier. Today, our cloud-based software is trusted by over 100,000 companies and used in 179 countries. We have grown from a five-person team to a truly international company of over 850+ people, representing more than 50 nationalities, with ten offices distributed across Europe and the US. In 2020, Pipedrive received a majority investment from Vista Equity Partners, a global investment firm that invests exclusively in enterprise software, data and technology-enabled businesses, making Pipedrive the fifth unicorn from Estonia.

We are looking for a senior people data analyst to join our talented analytics team. In this role, you will leverage your expertise in data analysis and data visualisation to support and influence key business initiatives. Your insights will directly contribute to optimising our operations and will help guide strategic decisions across the organisation.

Your new adventure:


Gather and analyze data from various P&C systems and sources, including HRIS, ATS, performance management tools, employee surveys, and external benchmarks
Identify current industry trends and patterns within People data to provide insights into areas such as recruitment, talent management, workforce demographics, turnover rates, performance metrics, and employee engagement and proactively identify opportunities to enhance the organizationâ€™s analytical capabilities
Develop and maintain key People metrics and dashboards to track progress and identify areas for improvement. Present findings and recommendations through clear and compelling data visualizations and presentations
Provide data-driven recommendations to senior leadership and other stakeholders to inform strategic decisions related to human resources and organizational development
Collaborate with P&C business partners and other stakeholders to understand business needs and develop solutions that optimize the employee experience and drive organizational success
Lead or participate in special projects and initiatives related to HR analytics, such as predictive modelling, workforce planning, and diversity and inclusion initiatives
Mentor and provide guidance to junior members of the HR analytics team, fostering a culture of continuous learning and development
Ensure compliance with relevant regulations and ethical standards when handling sensitive HR data, maintaining confidentiality and data security at all times.


Does this sound like you?


4+ years of experience as an analyst with a focus on HR projects
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Experience working with data visualisation tools such as Tableau or Power BI
Ability to create and present data-driven stories to different stakeholders
Good understanding of SQL and Python is a plus


Why Pipedrive:


A value-driven work environment where people come first
A lively bunch of colleagues from over 50 different countries, with offices in Tallinn, Tartu, Lisbon, Prague, London, Dublin, New York, Florida, Riga and Berlin
A team serious about getting things done while not taking ourselves too seriously
A world-class working environment full of perks like parties, snacks, and drinks like Spezi and Club-Mate, and, of course, office dogs
Flexible working hours as long as youâ€™re there for your team members
Freedom to execute your ideas with a passionate and motivated team supporting you
Lots of room for personal and career development, with internal and external training opportunities
Competitive salary and bonus system and all the benefits youâ€™d expect from a great employer (health coverage, transportation allowance, language courses, in-house coaches, employee discounts, and more)


Pipedrive is an equal-opportunity employer. We encourage diversity in the workplace regardless of age, gender, race, religion, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity or veteran status.

We're on the looking for a senior people data analyst to join our team in Berlin.

If this is something for you, send us your resume (in English) or a link to your LinkedIn profile and please add why we should pay extra attention to your application.

Title: Data Analyst (0 Experience Required)
Description:
For thousands of years, maps have provided humans with the knowledge they need to make decisions. As a Maps Evaluator, you will have the opportunity to provide ground truth for your town, city or country.




At Peroptyx, we are looking for Data Analysts who will review mapping data for digital mapping applications. Your research capabilities will validate and ensure that the navigation of certain routes are accurate and safe.




As part of this role you will verify that business names and opening hours are correct. You will check that the distance from a starting point to an end destination is listed accurately resulting in better user experiences.




With this job you can plan your days around this highly flexible working schedule, work weekends or late evenings, all from the comfort of your own office. The flexibility of our roles minimizes the impact on your daily routine.




So, whether you are a student looking to earn as you learn, a retiree looking for a new challenge a part-time/full time professional or a work from home parent, Peroptyx has the right role for you!




Ideal Candidate

Fluent in English and German.
Excellent research skills.
Excellent local knowledge of your home country.
Good understanding and general knowledge of the geography and culture of Germany.
Analytical mindset.




Job Requirements

Must be living in Germany for a minimum of 5 consecutive years.
Must pass an online open-book exam that can verify your full understanding of the material and concepts.
Must be willing to work a minimum of 10 hours and up to 20 hours per week depending on task availability.
Good working knowledge of search engines, map applications and familiarity with social media platforms.
Strong ability to learn, understand and apply multiple sets of different instructions.
All work must be of an independent nature.




Benefits




Â· Work up to 20 hours per week.

Â· Earn a competitive rate of pay.

Â· Develop your research skills.

Â· Avoid the long commute.

Â· Work from the comfort of your home office.

Â· Enjoy the flexibility of setting your own working hours!




Apply Online Today!

Title: Data Analysis Lead (m/f/d)
Description:
Everything we do, starts with you. Together with you, we build the most human-centric fintech. To enable everyoneâ€™s future financial growth.




We are looking for a

Data Analysis Lead (m/f/d)

(unlimited, fulltime) Join our team at our location in Verl, Berlin, Baden-Baden, Oslo or Heerenveen â€“ flexible working conditions available




As the Data Analysis Lead, you will guide our international team of data analysts across the Nordics, Benelux, and DACH regions. You will play a crucial role in advancing our data strategy and developing our team to meet their professional growth goals. Collaborating closely with various business and functional units, you will translate business needs into data experiments and derive actionable insights about our consumers, clients, and business processes.







Your responsibilities:

Lead, mentor, and manage an international team of data analysts within the fintech domain
Foster a collaborative and high-performance team environment, promoting continuous improvement and innovation
Conduct complex data analyses and provide actionable insights to support business goals and strategic initiatives
Ensure accuracy, integrity, and timeliness of all analytical deliverables, maintaining high data quality standards
Develop and maintain analysis and visualizations to effectively communicate findings to stakeholders using data storytelling techniques
Oversee the planning, execution, and completion of data analysis projects, ensuring alignment with business objectives and deadlines
Collaborate with stakeholders from various business units (e.g., BNPL, collections) and functional units (e.g., Finance, Marketing, Risk Management) to understand data needs and deliver insights
Provide decision support to business units, aiding in informed, data-driven decision-making
Standardize data analysis methodologies, implementing best practices to ensure consistency across the team
Contribute to data governance and strategy initiatives, supporting the organizationâ€™s data management and strategic goals




What you should bring:

5+ years of data analysis experience, including 2 years in a leadership role
Masterâ€™s/MBA degree in a numerate subject (e.g., Finance, Statistics, Mathematics, Economics)
Proficiency in data analysis tools and programming languages (Databricks, SQL, Python)
Excellent analytical skills with attention to detail and accuracy, able to identify issues and conduct necessary analysis
Exceptional interpersonal and leadership skills, with a passion for enabling team growth
Ability to balance multiple priorities, work independently, and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment
Experience in the financial industry, especially in Debt Collection and Buy Now, Pay Later
Working experience in an agile, cross-functional organizational setup
Team player, hands-on mentality, and result-oriented







Thrive at Riverty with great benefits:

Enjoy an open, trusting culture in agile teams and access opportunities within the Bertelsmann Group.
Prioritize your health with supported sports and leisure activities.
Grow together through Riverty Academy trainings and personalized development.
Feel valued with numerous employee discounts.
Our flexible working arrangements empower you to blend on-site collaboration with remote work, tailoring your professional experience to suit your lifestyle.

This list doesn't assure any certain benefits or actions. They might depend on the country or contract details and can change anytime without prior notice. We are happy to discuss these benefits further during your interview.




About us

We are Riverty. And we believe everyone should be in control of their financials. We ask you to join in. Because together with you, we build the most human-centric fintech. We build on experience of more than 50 years. More than 5,000 people in 13 countries drive our company and contribution to society. And we have their backs. We make sure they feel supported and included: Across teams, across physical and invisible borders and across the globe.




Our world is growing. And weâ€™re here. Together, weâ€™re finding smarter, simpler, seamlessly connected ways to manage money. By leveraging data and financial technology, our holistic solutions provide flexible payments, smarter accounting, and fair debt collection, all aimed at fostering everyone's financial growth.




And. Everything we do, starts with you. Join us and letâ€˜s build a more sustainable financial future, together.




More information on riverty.com/careers. Are you already convinced? Then we look forward to receiving your online application â€“ with just a few clicks.

We look forward to applications from candidates who contribute to the diversity of our company. We relate diversity in particular to the dimensions of cultural or social origin, religion, age, disability, gender and sexual identity.

Title: Lead Data Analyst (f/m/d)
Description:
Founded in 2008, BMG has become the fourth-largest music publisher worldwide. Our success and competitive edge are rooted in our founding values of fairness, transparency, and service. Our mission is clear: to empower artists and songwriters to maximize the potential of their songs and recordings in the digital era.

BMGâ€™s Global Data Analytics is our central data unit, spanning a close-knit international team of experienced Analytics Engineers, Data Analysts and Data Scientists across Germany, the US and the UK. Weâ€™re transforming how music works, enabling operational stakeholders to make data-driven decisions as well as driving strategic growth, based on a modern data stack.

We are currently seeking anâ€¯experienced Lead Data Analyst (f/m/d) to join our headquarters in Berlin. As a seasoned Data Analyst, you will guide junior analysts and collaborate with senior stakeholders of various departments to facilitate informed decision-making through novel data insights, compelling storytelling, and advanced data visualization. Join us in shaping the future of music analytics!

â€¯

What Youâ€™ll Be Doing


Process big data volumes, modeling and transforming data (using dbt) from centralized DWHs (e.g. Google BigQuery) and external/organizational databases to build strategic analyses and operational KPIs
Utilize data visualization to support decision-making, crafting compelling (Looker) dashboards for key business stakeholders (e.g. Investments, Artist & Repertoire, Marketing, Streaming Sales, Rights & Royalties, Finance)
Develop scalable self-service reporting solutions and address diverse ad-hoc requests that transform our business
Collaborate closely with our global team and international colleagues to foster a data-driven culture by proposing innovative initiatives and building actionable data products
Interact with developers, data engineers, and management to propose new technologies, processes and system improvements, as well as global data governanceâ€¯strategies
Provide training and mentorship to junior team members, empowering them to excel in their contributions to the teamâ€™s projects
Develop sustainable processes and methodologies to support the effectiveness of our Data Analytics function


What You Bring


Degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Economics, Statistics, Mathematics, or related field
Profound experience in data analytics, ideally with large datasets
Excellent SQL skills and good knowledge of Python
Proficiency in data visualization tools, such as Looker or Tableau
Broad understanding of data analysis methods and storytelling
Results-driven and analytical character, with a strategic mindset to derive business insights
Effective communication skills - confident in presenting findings to senior management
Ability to build relationships with stakeholders to understand business needs and data consumer needs
Strong interest to mentor junior colleagues with enthusiasm and expertise
Capability to plan and implement projects independently
Comfortable working in a global, fast-paced and dynamic environment


Itâ€™s also a plus if you haveâ€¦


Team leadership experience
Prior music industry experience
Experience with GCP, dbt and Git
Knowledge of Jira and Confluence
Understanding of statistical methods and ML
Experience using ETL frameworks


What We Offer


A modern office in the heart of Berlin and flexible options for remote work.
Numerous benefits such as a free BVG job ticket, a reduced-price membership for Urban Sports, company bike leasing, discounts for Bertelsmann employees, among others
Ongoing training opportunities on our internal platforms BMG Campus and Bertelsmann University
Long-term career opportunities for all employees.
A collaborative work environment with an open, appreciative community of people who all share the same passion for working with artists and songwriters.
Our unique corporate culture based on strong values and mutual support that make us a great team.


This is us

As the great Kurt Cobain once said, "Come as you are."â€¯BMG is committed to providing equal employment opportunities for all employees. We value diversity in all forms. Equal opportunity is deeply rooted in our core value of fairness, and we are committed to creating a truly inclusive work environment where everyone can thrive. If you're good at what you do, come as you are! Whether you're an experienced professional or just starting out, we welcome you to join our team.

All applicants to BMG are treated equally - regardless of age, disability, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, marital status, pregnancy or parenthood, ethnic origin, color, nationality, religion or belief.

(BMG is publishing Kurt Cobain's catalog, including the 1992 single 'Come As You Are.')
