Title: Senior Data Analyst (f/m/x)
Description:
CarOnSale is a start-up in the heart of Berlin. As a tech company, we have made it our mission to enable smooth digital processes in the automotive trade across Europe. Join us and develop new, innovative solutions for the B2B sector.

For our Data team based at our HQ in Berlin, we are looking for a Senior Data Analyst (f/m/x)

Your tasks:

Data Analysis:


Analyse and interpret data from various sources to extract meaningful insights.
Identify opportunities for data-driven decision-making within the organisation.
Define and maintain key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure success.



Project Leadership:


Lead data exploration projects to uncover actionable insights.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify and define data needs for various business initiatives.



Dashboard Creation:


Develop and maintain dashboards that enable stakeholders to monitor and analyse critical business metrics.



Report Generation:


Generate reports that provide valuable insights to support decision-making across multiple teams.



Stakeholder Management:


Engage with internal stakeholders to ensure their expectations align with our deliverables.
Manage multiple projects simultaneously, setting clear expectations for scope and timeline.
Cultivate and maintain strong relationships with stakeholders and product managers.



Enablement:


Provide support to enhance daily reporting and analytics tasks within the company.
Offer training and education to team members on data analysis tools and techniques for better decision-making



Your profile


4+ yearsâ€™ experience as a data analyst
Proven experience in data analysis, interpretation, and visualisation.
Proficiency in data analysis tools and languages (e.g., SQL, Tableau).
Experience working with Python.
Strong communication and presentation skills.
Ability to manage multiple projects with attention to detail.
Strong problem-solving and critical-thinking skills.
Familiarity with Google Analytics & tracking data
Fluency in English (C1)



Nice to have:


Being able to communicate in German



Why COS?


First things first: Youâ€™ll be taken seriously from day one and will play an important role in our mission, because we want to disrupt Europeâ€™s automotive market together with you
Growth and development: benefit from a detailed on-boarding program, systematic feedback cycles and individual coaching
Your gear, your choice: you will be provided with a MacBook or Windows laptop and all the hardware and software you need to work
Become a COSie: be part of a motivated team with ambitious goals and enjoy lots of fun, lots of awesome team events and a unique COS team spirit
Truly diverse and inclusive: Diversity is important to you? It is important to us too! Diversity in which everyone feels comfortable, is absolutely central to us



Show more
HTML:
CarOnSale is a start-up in the heart of Berlin. As a tech company, we have made it our mission to enable smooth digital processes in the automotive trade across Europe. Join us and develop new, innovative solutions for the B2B sector.

For our Data team based at our HQ in Berlin, we are looking for a Senior Data Analyst (f/m/x)

Your tasks:

Data Analysis:

  • Analyse and interpret data from various sources to extract meaningful insights.
  • Identify opportunities for data-driven decision-making within the organisation.
  • Define and maintain key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure success.


Project Leadership:

  • Lead data exploration projects to uncover actionable insights.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify and define data needs for various business initiatives.


Dashboard Creation:

  • Develop and maintain dashboards that enable stakeholders to monitor and analyse critical business metrics.


Report Generation:

  • Generate reports that provide valuable insights to support decision-making across multiple teams.


Stakeholder Management:

  • Engage with internal stakeholders to ensure their expectations align with our deliverables.
  • Manage multiple projects simultaneously, setting clear expectations for scope and timeline.
  • Cultivate and maintain strong relationships with stakeholders and product managers.


Enablement:

  • Provide support to enhance daily reporting and analytics tasks within the company.
  • Offer training and education to team members on data analysis tools and techniques for better decision-making


Your profile

  • 4+ yearsâ€™ experience as a data analyst
  • Proven experience in data analysis, interpretation, and visualisation.
  • Proficiency in data analysis tools and languages (e.g., SQL, Tableau).
  • Experience working with Python.
  • Strong communication and presentation skills.
  • Ability to manage multiple projects with attention to detail.
  • Strong problem-solving and critical-thinking skills.
  • Familiarity with Google Analytics & tracking data
  • Fluency in English (C1)


Nice to have:

  • Being able to communicate in German


Why COS?

  • First things first: Youâ€™ll be taken seriously from day one and will play an important role in our mission, because we want to disrupt Europeâ€™s automotive market together with you
  • Growth and development: benefit from a detailed on-boarding program, systematic feedback cycles and individual coaching
  • Your gear, your choice: you will be provided with a MacBook or Windows laptop and all the hardware and software you need to work
  • Become a COSie: be part of a motivated team with ambitious goals and enjoy lots of fun, lots of awesome team events and a unique COS team spirit
  • Truly diverse and inclusive: Diversity is important to you? It is important to us too! Diversity in which everyone feels comfortable, is absolutely central to us

Title: Senior Data Analyst - Customer Analytics (all genders)
Description:
You work for the Customer Analytics team in Zalandoâ€™s Markets organisation, which enables data driven business strategies for 20+ countries. Through our customer analytics and customer segmentations we put our customers at the centre of every marketing and retail decision. As a Data Analyst in the Customer Analytics team, you will put customer data at the core of our decisions and processes.

WHERE YOUR EXPERTISE IS NEEDED



You derive actionable customer insights and recommendations to fuel our Zalando business and the customer strategy. Your insights are derived from deep dive analysis you perform using a broad range of analytical methods and visualisations applied to data from various sources (transactional data, onsite data etc)
You proactively share your insights and recommendations in regular business reviews to senior management by providing compelling visualisations and stories. You seek opportunities to spread the insights beyond regular touchpoints with the aim of sourcing new business opportunities
You develop and optimise forecasting models for key customer metrics and provide expertise on current and expected trends for central planning efforts in close collaboration with our commercial planning teams
You drive analytical and data mindset in the team and provide senior guidance to your team members
You effectively collaborate with other analysts, data scientists, engineers to untap new sources of data and know how



What Weâ€™re Looking For



5+ years of experience in using data in smart and creative ways to answer business questions incl. model driven statistical analysis. Very good quantitative degree, e.g. in Economics, Social Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science or related fields.
Proficient in data transformation and statistical computing in SQL and Python as well as strong skills in data visualisation. Basic experience in Google Analytics (BigQuery), MicroStrategy/Tableau, Airflow, Spark / DataBricks, and / or Github. Knowledge of basic time series forecasting techniques (SARIMAX, Prophet, Covariates) is considered a plus
Strong communication and visualisation skills and the ability to translate complex datasets into understandable and actionable insights and present to senior management in order to impact their decisions and strategy
Being curious and proactively creating insights while demonstrating end to end ownership of analytical projects. You innovate on new methodologies and datasets but also have a good sense when an pragmatic solution is sufficient
You are a role model and proved to be a mentor for junior to mid level team members



OUR OFFER

Zalando provides a range of benefits, hereâ€™s an overview of what you can expect. Ask your Talent Acquisition Partner to learn more about what we offer.



Employee shares program
40% off fashion and beauty products sold and shipped by Zalando, 30% off Zalando Lounge, discounts from external partners
2 paid volunteering days a year
Hybrid working model with 60% (or more) remote per week, actual practice is up to each team to best support their collaboration
Work from abroad for up to 30 working days a year
27 days of vacation a year (for Zalando SE)
Relocation assistance available (subject to prior agreement)
Family services, including counseling and support
Health and wellbeing options (including Gympass)
Mental health support and coaching available



Learn all about Zalando and our values here https //jobs.zalando.com/en/?gh_src=22377bdd1us

Title: Senior Growth Data Analyst
Description:
The role

As a Growth Data Analyst in the Growth Analytics team, you will join the wider International Marketing Analytics group which acts as a key consultant for the International part of HelloFresh business. Your main focus will be on supporting your Growth stakeholders in their decision making, and you will be their key contact person regarding data and analytics questions. Your experience with Growth analytics and related technologies, together with your excellent communication, stakeholder management and organizational skills will have a big impact on the companyâ€™s performance.

Above all, we are looking for people who will make HelloFresh better. We believe there are many different ways of developing skills and we love diverse experiences! So even if you donâ€™t â€œtick all the boxesâ€ but think youâ€™d thrive in this role, we would really like to learn more about you.

What Youâ€™ll Do


Provide cracking insights to optimize marketing campaigns and channel targeting and efficiency
Translate business questions into meaningful analytics for your stakeholders via multiple Growth channels
Creating ad-hoc insights, Lift Tests, AB test analyses, reporting & visualization
Utilise various databases and querying/programming languages to access, manipulate and present the data needed
Improve how we look at Growth Analytics as a group, bringing key analytical insight to various levels across the organization
You will not only take responsibility of own projects, but also be a team player to collaborate and share knowledge with other analysts


What Youâ€™ll Bring


Proven experience in Growth Marketing Analytics or any of the following domains: Data Analytics/Business Analytics/Marketing Analytics/Product Analytics/Data Science
4+ years of experience in data analytics and statistical modelling
A degree in Analytics, Economics, Statistics, Mathematics, or similar quantitative discipline
Preferably experience in working with web analytics (Google Analytics, Meta AA, ADH etc.)
Preferably experience with growth marketing analytics and testing (lift tests, campaign analytics, channel efficiency, AB testing)
Expertise in SQL, Python & bigquery with excitement to learn more on the technical side!
Expertise in building dashboards, we use Tableau
Experience in statistical modeling, regression, clustering, time series etc is good to have
Any team management experience, mentoring or managing 1-2 analyst is good to have
Experience in performing analysis with large datasets and knowing what the common pitfalls are
Marketing or product related experience is good, not a must
Analytical and critical thinking combined with good presentation and communication skills
Strong problems solving skills and hands-on & can-do attitude
Ability to work independently


What We Offer

Elevate your lifestyle! Join one of Europe's fastest-growing tech powerhouses in a dynamic phase of expansion.


Comprehensive relocation assistance to move to Berlin plus visa application support (if applicable)
A significant discount on your weekly HelloFresh box
Internal learning and development opportunities with the HelloFresh Academy
Mental health support, including Headspace subscription and access to qualified therapists through Spill
Monthly transportation budget through Rydes app
Working parents support
Additional perks include: Annual German language budget, discounts for John Reed gyms & Urban Sports Club, regular company events, fresh fruit & free drinks in the office, in-house yoga classes, monthly discount on the Convini vending machine in the office
Hybrid working model (option to work from home for up to 2 days per week if preferred)
Sabbatical leave option after 18 months of being with HelloFresh
HelloFresh Pension Scheme that is subsidized with 20% on top
A diverse and vibrant international environment of 90+ different nationalities
The chance to have a significant impact on one of the fastest-growing technology companies in Europe in an exciting growth phase


Are you up for the challenge?

Please submit your complete application below including your salary expectations and earliest starting date.

After submitting an application our team will review this and get back to you within 5 business days.

JR100987

Ãœber uns

Hi, weâ€™re denkwerk!

Unsere Mission ist es, die digitale Zukunft - besonders die unserer Kunden - mitzugestalten.

Was uns antreibt, ist ein Zusammenspiel aus Strategie, Design, Kommunikation und Technologie - wir nennen das Creative Business.

Und wenn wir Creative Business sagen, dann meinen wir kreative und bedÃ¼rfnisorientierte LÃ¶sungen fÃ¼r Marken und Menschen, die beiden einen Mehrwert bieten.

You are the one we miss!


We are looking for you, with a passion for data analysis and a keen eye for trends and competition in the fast-changing marketplace
In the online marketing team, you will skilfully take on various analyses and reports, which you will interpret and derive concrete measures for our customers
You develop, implement and optimize a data protection compliant tracking in common tag manager systems
You visualize and analyze the collected data using common web analysis tools such as Google Analytics, Piwik PRO, Google BigQuery or Google LookerStudio
You are involved in the execution and analysis of AB tests
You bring a good understanding of common web technologies such as Javascript, HTML & CSS
Experience with SQL, R, Python and other programming languages is an advantage
Agile mindset? Absolutely! Our projects mainly take place in an agile environment and we work with tools like Miro, Jira and Confluence
You have a very good German and English skills


Our benefits for you!


Agency feel and mobile working: easily compatible through our hybrid working model and flexible working hours
Workout-life-balance: Cooperation with Urban Sports Club and leasing offer from JobRad
Profit sharing: As a permanent part of denkwerk, you will share in the profits
Continuing internal & external education opportunities: Service Design Workshops and individual trainings,financed by a continuing education budget
Company Pension Scheme - as a denkwerker you receive an employer subsidy of 20% for your company pension scheme
Free choice of devices: Whether Mac or Windows - you may also use our hardware privately
Support in all life situations: Counseling opportunities from pme Familienservice
denkfrei days: of our 31 vacation days, three days are free for everyone (Christmas Eve, New Year's Eve & Carnival Monday) to take a deep breath together
denkmate: that's what we call our experienced denkwerkers, who are there to help and advise you at the start of your new working day
Corporate benefits: all kinds of employee discounts
Snacks & Drinks: cool lemonades, beer, fresh coffee or even fruit and vegetables - there's something for everyone


Here's how to get started!

Can't wait to get started? Neither can we! We're looking for you to start immediately, but we're also flexible with your possible start date.

Please also send us your CV and salary requirements.

P. S.: Classic cover letters are too normal for you? Surprise us with your creativity and introduce yourself and your motivations in your own way. We are curious!

What To Expect In The Application Process


1st interview: ~1 hour, mostly online with two participants from denkwerk
2nd interview: ~1 hour, preferably on site with two denkwerk participants
In our interviews, both the professional and human denkwerk fit are highlighted
After the two interviews, if the feedback is positive, a telephone offer conversation will follow
We aim for quick feedback loops: if you are still missing feedback, please contact us proactively!


Why denkwerk?

We are an owner-managed digital agency with headquarters in Cologne Ehrenfeld and further locations in Berlin Kreuzberg, Hamburg and Munich. A total of 250 motivated denkwerkers from 28 nations are waiting for you, including about 55 colleagues at the Berlin office. Specifically, you will be part of our 6-person Digital Marketing & Analytics team. As a data analyst, you will support exciting client projects and work closely with the strategy, content, SEO, SEA and technology departments. We create unique digital products for various clients such as Congstar, DeepL, ESPRIT, Mainova, Microsoft, Motel One, STIEBEL ELTRON and STORCK. To round off your onboarding, regular feedback meetings await you. As a "Great Place to Work 2023" employer, your opinion is important to us because we live an open feedback culture! We like to celebrate, especially our successes - look forward to celebrations of all kinds, such as our summer parties and Christmas parties.

Your contact persons

Janina Schulte-Kellinghaus, Marie Rybarczik & Rusin Hassan, Talent Acquisition Team

Our profile on kununu

Apply for this job

About Us

Hi, we're denkwerk!

Our mission is to reshape the digital future - especially of our clients.

What drives us is an interplay of strategy, design, communication and technology - we call it Creative Business.

And when we say creative business, we mean creative and individual solutions for brands and people that offer added value to both.

Wir schaffen einzigartige digitale Produkte fÃ¼r verschiedene Kunden wie z. B. Congstar, DeepL, ESPRIT, Mainova, Microsoft, Motel One, STIEBEL ELTRON und STORCK. Um dein Onboarding abzurunden, erwarten dich regelmÃ¤ÃŸige FeedbackgesprÃ¤che. Als â€žGreat Place to Work 2024â€œ-Arbeitgeber ist uns deine Meinung wichtig, denn wir leben eine offene Feedback-Kultur! Wir feiern gerne, besonders unsere Erfolge â€“ freue dich auf Feste aller Art, wie unsere Sommerpartys und Weihnachtsfeiern.

Deine Ansprechpartnerinnen

Janina Schulte-Kellinghaus, Marie Rybarczik & Rusin Hassan, Talent Acquisition Team

Unser Profil auf kununu

Apply for this job

Ãœber uns

Hi, weâ€™re denkwerk!

Unsere Mission ist es, die digitale Zukunft - besonders die unserer Kunden - mitzugestalten.

Was uns antreibt, ist ein Zusammenspiel aus Strategie, Design, Kommunikation und Technologie - wir nennen das Creative Business.

Und wenn wir Creative Business sagen, dann meinen wir kreative und bedÃ¼rfnisorientierte LÃ¶sungen fÃ¼r Marken und Menschen, die beiden einen Mehrwert bieten.

You are the one we miss!

  • We are looking for you, with a passion for data analysis and a keen eye for trends and competition in the fast-changing marketplace
  • In the online marketing team, you will skilfully take on various analyses and reports, which you will interpret and derive concrete measures for our customers
  • You develop, implement and optimize a data protection compliant tracking in common tag manager systems
  • You visualize and analyze the collected data using common web analysis tools such as Google Analytics, Piwik PRO, Google BigQuery or Google LookerStudio
  • You are involved in the execution and analysis of AB tests
  • You bring a good understanding of common web technologies such as Javascript, HTML & CSS
  • Experience with SQL, R, Python and other programming languages is an advantage
  • Agile mindset? Absolutely! Our projects mainly take place in an agile environment and we work with tools like Miro, Jira and Confluence
  • You have a very good German and English skills

Our benefits for you!

  • Agency feel and mobile working: easily compatible through our hybrid working model and flexible working hours
  • Workout-life-balance: Cooperation with Urban Sports Club and leasing offer from JobRad
  • Profit sharing: As a permanent part of denkwerk, you will share in the profits
  • Continuing internal & external education opportunities: Service Design Workshops and individual trainings,financed by a continuing education budget
  • Company Pension Scheme - as a denkwerker you receive an employer subsidy of 20% for your company pension scheme
  • Free choice of devices: Whether Mac or Windows - you may also use our hardware privately
  • Support in all life situations: Counseling opportunities from pme Familienservice
  • denkfrei days: of our 31 vacation days, three days are free for everyone (Christmas Eve, New Year's Eve & Carnival Monday) to take a deep breath together
  • denkmate: that's what we call our experienced denkwerkers, who are there to help and advise you at the start of your new working day
  • Corporate benefits: all kinds of employee discounts
  • Snacks & Drinks: cool lemonades, beer, fresh coffee or even fruit and vegetables - there's something for everyone

Here's how to get started!

Can't wait to get started? Neither can we! We're looking for you to start immediately, but we're also flexible with your possible start date.

Please also send us your CV and salary requirements.

P. S.: Classic cover letters are too normal for you? Surprise us with your creativity and introduce yourself and your motivations in your own way. We are curious!

What To Expect In The Application Process

  • 1st interview: ~1 hour, mostly online with two participants from denkwerk
  • 2nd interview: ~1 hour, preferably on site with two denkwerk participants
  • In our interviews, both the professional and human denkwerk fit are highlighted
  • After the two interviews, if the feedback is positive, a telephone offer conversation will follow
  • We aim for quick feedback loops: if you are still missing feedback, please contact us proactively!

Why denkwerk?

We are an owner-managed digital agency with headquarters in Cologne Ehrenfeld and further locations in Berlin Kreuzberg, Hamburg and Munich. A total of 250 motivated denkwerkers from 28 nations are waiting for you, including about 55 colleagues at the Berlin office. Specifically, you will be part of our 6-person Digital Marketing & Analytics team. As a data analyst, you will support exciting client projects and work closely with the strategy, content, SEO, SEA and technology departments. We create unique digital products for various clients such as Congstar, DeepL, ESPRIT, Mainova, Microsoft, Motel One, STIEBEL ELTRON and STORCK. To round off your onboarding, regular feedback meetings await you. As a "Great Place to Work 2023" employer, your opinion is important to us because we live an open feedback culture! We like to celebrate, especially our successes - look forward to celebrations of all kinds, such as our summer parties and Christmas parties.

Your contact persons

Janina Schulte-Kellinghaus, Marie Rybarczik & Rusin Hassan, Talent Acquisition Team

What drives us is an interplay of strategy, design, communication and technology - we call it Creative Business.

And when we say creative business, we mean creative and individual solutions for brands and people that offer added value to both.

Title: Data Engineer (Consultant, entry-level)
Description:
Come work with us




Netlight strives to be a truly diverse, equitable and inclusive organization. Regardless of who you are, what personality, background, and experience you have, you enrich our culture through your values. Netlightâ€™s purpose is to unleash full potential, realize great careers, and fulfill personal growth. To achieve this, we have a highly engaged network organization, where every employee gets a mentor, delivery coach and personal communities. The key to our continued success is trust and personal responsibility, diverse experiences, challenging opportunities and developing from personal values. Every Netlighter is an active part of building and shaping this culture, which leads to a clear correlation between personal growth and the growth of Netlight.







About us




Netlight provides a full range of premium IT-consulting services at the forefront of the digital industry and stands out for its product- and technology-independent expertise in a wide range of industries and clients. We are a network organization of more than 2 000 role models making aspiring digital leaders successful in their business-critical IT projects. Netlight has been awarded several times as top employer, as well as for growth, continued profitability and engagement for diversity, equity and equality within the IT industry. Today we are growing all across Europe, currently with more than 10 active international offices.







What does it mean to be an IT Consultant in Data Engineering at Netlight?




Join the Netlight Berlin team as a consultant and be a part of shaping the software products and technical solutions of today and tomorrow alongside your colleagues and clients. The role will vary between Netlighters as we, around the right person, will design a role together with you.




Our focus is not just on the digital product, but also on the team and the business. You'll have the ownership to carve your own career path, starting somewhere familiar and building from there. As a consultant at Netlight, you will build the products, systems and technical solutions of today and tomorrow. This means that our consultants get the opportunity to help build and scale existing and new products and companies and also continuously learn and master a variety of technical tools. As a consultant within the data area, you will help our clients in roles such as Data Engineer, Cloud Engineer, Data Architect, Analytics Engineer, to name a few. We build comprehensive data platforms that encompass data warehousing & data lake infrastructure, data modeling, and the implementation of ETL/ELT data pipelines, whether batch or real-time. We design and implement innovative data products, incorporating elements of backend and cloud engineering. We are at the forefront advising clients around emerging topics such as data governance, AI and data mesh. Our clients will challenge you. You will challenge our clients. You will challenge us. We will grow together and unleash the potential in each other.







Minimum Qualifications




Bachelor degree in Computer Science or Engineering AND 2 years of full-time working experience in a similar role
Working student and/or internship experience in agile software engineering roles
Verbal and written proficiency in English
Based in Berlin or willingness to relocate to Berlin (or see other open Netlight job ads) - no travelling required!




Preferred Qualifications

Master's Degree in Computer Science or Engineering




We are looking for newly graduated software developers with 1-2 years of relevant experience within tech projects. If we find that your profile matches what we are looking for, you will hear from us within two weeks of applying.




We're looking forward to hearing from you!

Title: Data Engineer (f/m/x)
Description:
About Us:

Join our dynamic and rapidly growing B2B SaaS startup, SAIZ, based in the heart of Berlin! Just two years into our journey, we're on a mission to revolutionize the way apparel businesses operate. Powered by advanced analytics and artificial intelligence, we provide cutting-edge software solutions that empower apparel brands to reduce returns, enhance customer satisfaction, and embrace sustainability. Our team thrives on innovation, collaboration, and a startup culture that encourages independence and creativity.




Role Overview:

We are seeking a talented and motivated Data Engineer (f/m/x) to join our team. In this role, you will be instrumental in designing, developing, and maintaining our data infrastructure, ensuring the smooth integration and processing of data. You will work closely with various teams, including data analysts and clients, to support data-driven decision-making and enhance our product offerings. As a team, we plan our tasks on Jira and include them in our sprints. You will have the freedom to develop your own ideas.




Key Responsibilities:

Data Pipeline Development: Design, implement, and maintain efficient data pipelines to facilitate seamless data integration and processing.
Data Infrastructure: Build and optimize data infrastructure to ensure reliability, scalability, and performance of our data systems.
Client Collaboration: Work with clients to understand their data requirements and provide technical support for data-related issues.
Data Management: Ensure data quality, consistency, and security across various data sources and systems.
Problem Solving: Address and resolve complex data-related challenges, using your technical skills to devise effective solutions.
Continuous Improvement: Stay updated with the latest industry trends and best practices to enhance our data processes and technologies.




Qualifications:

Technical Proficiency: Strong skills in Python and SQL are essential. Familiarity with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI), as well as building and maintaining data pipelines for reading, structuring, cleaning, and testing data, is highly desirable.
Analytical Mindset: A solid understanding of data structures, algorithms, and data modeling.
Educational Background: Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.
Experience: Previous experience in a data engineering role, particularly in a startup or fast-paced environment, is preferred.
Independence: Ability to work independently and manage multiple tasks effectively.
Fast Learner: Eagerness to learn and adapt quickly in a dynamic startup environment.
Communication Skills: Excellent verbal and written communication skills to collaborate with technical and non-technical stakeholders.




Why Join Us?

Startup Culture: Be part of an energetic and innovative startup environment.
Impact: Directly influence our product development and business strategies with your insights.
Growth Opportunities: Expand your skills and grow with our company as we continue to scale.
Collaborative Team: Work alongside a passionate and driven team that values creativity and independence.
The job is full-time and remote.




How to apply:

If you are enthusiastic about working in a startup environment and passionate about data engineering, we would love to hear from you! Please apply via the Easy Apply function, including your resume and answers to a few questions.




At SAIZ, we are committed to creating an inclusive and supportive environment where all individuals can thrive. We warmly welcome candidates of all different backgrounds and identities to apply, valuing the unique perspectives each individual brings. Our ongoing dedication is to further diversify our team, enriching our collective experiences and driving innovation.




Join us in our mission to transform the apparel industry and digitize production in fashion with innovative data-driven solutions!

Title: Lead Data Analyst (f/m/d)
Description:
Lead Data Analyst (f/m/d)




As a Lead Game Data Analyst, you will play a pivotal role in shaping our games' success by leveraging data insights to drive strategic decisions across game design, player behavior analysis, and monetization strategies. You will collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to ensure our games remain competitive and captivating in the dynamic gaming industry landscape.




We have ambitious plans around growth and the data team is integral to our success, directly impacting our key decisions.

As the Lead Data Analyst, you will lead a team of data analysts and spearhead our data efforts in Product, User Acquisition and monetization, leveraging data to drive decisions and strategies that significantly boost our performance and revenue.




Responsibilities




Lead and mentor a team of data analysts, fostering a culture of collaboration, innovation, and continuous learning.
Utilize exceptional problem-solving and critical-thinking skills to interpret complex game telemetry data and identify actionable insights.
Communicate effectively with stakeholders and executive leadership, presenting data-driven recommendations to drive informed decision-making.
Champion a data-driven culture within the organization, promoting data literacy and empowering team members to leverage key performance indicators (KPIs) for strategic initiatives.
Work with the Data Engineering team to help direct their efforts and be the key communicator between the main stakeholders in the company requiring data
Drive experimentation and A/B testing initiatives to evaluate the impact of game changes on player behavior, monetization, and engagement.
Analyze player retention and churn rates, identifying opportunities to enhance player experiences and maximize long-term value.
Collaborate with Product Leads and Head of Growth to influence product development and strategies by gaining insights through analysis of patterns, relationships and trends across complex data sets, directly impacting the company and game revenue.
Stay updated on industry trends and best practices, leveraging advanced understanding of game monetization and marketing strategies to maintain a competitive edge, as well as, digital marketing environment and marketing measuring frameworks.
Build and monitor predictive models that will help daily Product, User Acquisition and Monetization decisions.




Required Skills




5+ years of experience in data analysis in the gaming industry.
Proven experience managing a team, having exceptional leadership and team-building capabilities
Experience with real-time data analysis for live operations in games.
Ability to write complex queries using languages such as SQL
Experience using Python, BI tools such as Looker or similar
Previous experience with AB testing
Advanced understanding of game monetization and marketing strategies as well as key gaming industry KPIs and metrics
Games industry experience with a strong understanding of the game and player market
Strong problem-solving skills and creativity in addressing complex challenges.
Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills.
Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, collaborative environment.




Desirable Skills




Proficiency in additional programming languages (e.g., Java, C#, etc.).
Advanced understanding of game monetization and marketing strategies or game industry pattern
Experience with Product Data Science, including but not limited to Churn Prediction, LTV.
An applied understanding of Player Psychology and/or Economics.

Show more
HTML:
Lead Data Analyst (f/m/d)


As a Lead Game Data Analyst, you will play a pivotal role in shaping our games' success by leveraging data insights to drive strategic decisions across game design, player behavior analysis, and monetization strategies. You will collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to ensure our games remain competitive and captivating in the dynamic gaming industry landscape.


We have ambitious plans around growth and the data team is integral to our success, directly impacting our key decisions.

As the Lead Data Analyst, you will lead a team of data analysts and spearhead our data efforts in Product, User Acquisition and monetization, leveraging data to drive decisions and strategies that significantly boost our performance and revenue.


Responsibilities


  • Lead and mentor a team of data analysts, fostering a culture of collaboration, innovation, and continuous learning.
  • Utilize exceptional problem-solving and critical-thinking skills to interpret complex game telemetry data and identify actionable insights.
  • Communicate effectively with stakeholders and executive leadership, presenting data-driven recommendations to drive informed decision-making.
  • Champion a data-driven culture within the organization, promoting data literacy and empowering team members to leverage key performance indicators (KPIs) for strategic initiatives.
  • Work with the Data Engineering team to help direct their efforts and be the key communicator between the main stakeholders in the company requiring data
  • Drive experimentation and A/B testing initiatives to evaluate the impact of game changes on player behavior, monetization, and engagement.
  • Analyze player retention and churn rates, identifying opportunities to enhance player experiences and maximize long-term value.
  • Collaborate with Product Leads and Head of Growth to influence product development and strategies by gaining insights through analysis of patterns, relationships and trends across complex data sets, directly impacting the company and game revenue.
  • Stay updated on industry trends and best practices, leveraging advanced understanding of game monetization and marketing strategies to maintain a competitive edge, as well as, digital marketing environment and marketing measuring frameworks.
  • Build and monitor predictive models that will help daily Product, User Acquisition and Monetization decisions.


Required Skills


  • 5+ years of experience in data analysis in the gaming industry.
  • Proven experience managing a team, having exceptional leadership and team-building capabilities
  • Experience with real-time data analysis for live operations in games.
  • Ability to write complex queries using languages such as SQL
  • Experience using Python, BI tools such as Looker or similar
  • Previous experience with AB testing
  • Advanced understanding of game monetization and marketing strategies as well as key gaming industry KPIs and metrics
  • Games industry experience with a strong understanding of the game and player market
  • Strong problem-solving skills and creativity in addressing complex challenges.
  • Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills.
  • Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, collaborative environment.


Desirable Skills


  • Proficiency in additional programming languages (e.g., Java, C#, etc.).
  • Advanced understanding of game monetization and marketing strategies or game industry pattern
  • Experience with Product Data Science, including but not limited to Churn Prediction, LTV.
  • An applied understanding of Player Psychology and/or Economics.

Title: Staff Data Analyst - BI and Marketing Analytics (all genders)
Description:
About The Opportunity

We are looking for a Staff Data Analyst (all genders) to join the BI and Marketing Analytic ( BIMA) team on our journey to always deliver amazing experiences. This is a global position working closely with our brands in over 70 countries and implementing strategy from our HQ in Berlin.

BIMA is part of the Global marketing team responsible for central BI and marketing analytics . BIMAâ€™ s team mission is to drive marketing actions through data-driven solutions & strategic insights to ensure sustainable growth. We drive strategic projects such as customer segmentation, marketing ROI measurement , CLV and support the C-level in making strategic decisions across all brands and countries.

If you're a creative problem solver who is hungry for a new adventure, an international workplace is waiting for you in the heart of Berlin!

The Staff Data Analyst will be responsible for optimizing our marketing strategies through data-driven insights and advanced analytics. This role will collaborate closely with the marketing leads , product, and data science teams, and regional analytic teams to analyze marketing performance and optimize our acquisition and retention strategies.

Your key responsibilities include :


Utilize analytics to provide actionable insights on marketing performance.
Design and implement A/B testing and other experimental frameworks to assess the effectiveness of marketing initiatives.
Create tools , KPI frameworks, and reports to measure ROI of marketing spend. Continuously monitor and guide marketing spend across various channels to maximize ROI.
Analyze and improve the customer segmentation to drive targeting strategies in the local markets and increase customer retention
Create statistical models to project customer lifetime value, measure customer acquisition costs (CAC) and use analytics to reduce CAC and increase LTV
Work closely with marketing, product, and engineering teams to ensure alignment on data needs and create global guidelines on how data needs to be collected and consumed.
Present findings and recommendations to senior leadership and stakeholders in a clear and actionable manner.


What you need to be successful


4+ years of experience in marketing analytics, with a focus on user retention for technology-driven consumer facing companies.
Strong proficiency in analytics tools and platforms (e.g., Google Big Query, Google Analytics, Tableau, SQL, Python/R).
Exceptional analytical skills with the ability to translate data into actionable insights.
Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to influence stakeholders at all levels.
Experience with A/B testing, attribution modeling, and other experimental design methodologies.
Strong understanding of digital marketing channels and strategies, including CRM, paid search, social media, and content marketing.


Who we are

As the worldâ€™s pioneering local delivery platform, our mission is to deliver an amazing experience, fast, easy, and to your door. We operate in over 70+ countries worldwide, powered by tech, designed by people. As one of Europeâ€™s largest tech platforms, we enable creative minds to deliver solutions that create impact within our ecosystem. We move fast, take action and adapt. No matter where you're from or what you believe in, we build, we deliver, we lead. We are Delivery Hero

What's in it for you

Nice to have:


Experience in agile development and methodologies
BS, MS or PhD in computer science, statistics, math, physic, business, etc
Expertise in developing and implementing naming conventions and tagging strategies to ensure data consistency in a global organization. Experience with Market mix modeling


At Delivery Hero, we believe diversity and inclusion are key to creating not only an exciting product, but also an amazing customer and employee experience. Fostering this starts with hiring -- therefore we do not discriminate on the basis of racial identities, religious beliefs, color, national origin, gender identities or expressions, sexual orientations, age, marital or disability statuses, or any other aspect that makes you, you. Just be yourself and we canâ€™t wait to see what value you bring to the role. We're as interested in your character as we are in your talent.

Title: Senior Data Analyst, Referrals (m/f/x)
Description:
The role

As a Senior Data Analyst in the Referrals Analytics team, you'll play a key role in the Global Virality department. This team works on getting customers to share their HelloFresh experiences and recommend us to their friends. We aim to build a flexible referral program offering attractive deals to customers across the HelloFresh Group. The team is a hyper growth team which contribute to ~30% of the overall business globally.

In this job, youâ€™ll provide important insights that help shape our Digital Product and Commercial strategies. You'll use data to spot trends and find new opportunities that guide our decisions. You'll also help create a data-driven culture in our team, making sure everyone can use data to make smart choices. Your skills in Data Analytics and related technologies, along with your strong communication and organizational abilities, will greatly influence our companyâ€™s success.

Above all, we are looking for people who will make HelloFresh better. We believe there are many different ways of developing skills and we love diverse experiences! So even if you donâ€™t â€œtick all the boxesâ€ but think youâ€™d thrive in this role, we would really like to learn more about you.

What Youâ€™ll Do


Provide cracking insights to optimize campaign targeting and efficiency of referral program promotions to customers
Analyze customer data to identify pain points and opportunities in the customer journey, helping to determine customer segmentation and personalization strategies.
Creating deep-dives and ad-hoc analysis, research, AB test analyses, reporting & visualization
Utilize various databases and querying/programming languages to access, manipulate and present the data needed
Improve how we look at Virality Analytics as a group, bringing key analytical insight to various levels across the organization
Work with other analytics departments, driving cross-team collaboration, best practice sharing, and insight generation.


What Youâ€™ll Bring


4+ years in a highly analytical role (bonus if youâ€™ve worked in a Start-Up or in a high-growth environment)
Advanced abilities in SQL and python, and the ability to use statistical modeling techniques for robust analysis.
A strong business acumen and can translate insights into actionable recommendations that align with business objectives
Expertise in data visualization and data storytelling, including experience with dashboarding tools (Tableau preferred)
Experience working with a range of business stakeholders and communicating technical results in business language
A BS in computer science, mathematics, economics, statistics, engineering, or similar program


What We Offer

Elevate your lifestyle! Join one of Europe's fastest-growing tech powerhouses in a dynamic phase of expansion.


Immerse yourself in a diverse global community of 90+ nationalities.
Enjoy a competitive compensation package that goes beyond the norm, with perks like a HelloFresh- subsidized Pension Scheme, Berlin relocation support, and a Hybrid working model.
Elevate your lifestyle with exclusive discounts on your weekly HelloFresh box and office meals.
Invest in your growth with an annual learning & development budget, German language learning budget, and access to the HelloFresh Academy.
Plus, we've got your well-being covered with mental health support, transportation perks, and working-parent-friendly benefits. From our 24/7 gym access,wellbeing platforms like Headspace and Spill, to sabbatical leave options, HelloFresh is not just a workplace; it's a lifestyle of perks and possibilities!


Are you up for the challenge?

Please submit your complete application below including your salary expectations and earliest starting date.

After submitting an application our team will review this and get back to you within 5 business days.

JR101535

You'll also help create a data-driven culture in our team, making sure everyone can use data to make smart choices. Your skills in Data Analytics and related technologies, along with your strong communication and organizational abilities, will greatly influence our companyâ€™s success.

Above all, we are looking for people who will make HelloFresh better. We believe there are many different ways of developing skills and we love diverse experiences! So even if you donâ€™t â€œtick all the boxesâ€ but think youâ€™d thrive in this role, we would really like to learn more about you.

What Youâ€™ll Do

  • Provide cracking insights to optimize campaign targeting and efficiency of referral program promotions to customers
  • Analyze customer data to identify pain points and opportunities in the customer journey, helping to determine customer segmentation and personalization strategies.
  • Creating deep-dives and ad-hoc analysis, research, AB test analyses, reporting & visualization
  • Utilize various databases and querying/programming languages to access, manipulate and present the data needed
  • Improve how we look at Virality Analytics as a group, bringing key analytical insight to various levels across the organization
  • Work with other analytics departments, driving cross-team collaboration, best practice sharing, and insight generation.

What Youâ€™ll Bring

  • 4+ years in a highly analytical role (bonus if youâ€™ve worked in a Start-Up or in a high-growth environment)
  • Advanced abilities in SQL and python, and the ability to use statistical modeling techniques for robust analysis.
  • A strong business acumen and can translate insights into actionable recommendations that align with business objectives
  • Expertise in data visualization and data storytelling, including experience with dashboarding tools (Tableau preferred)
  • Experience working with a range of business stakeholders and communicating technical results in business language
  • A BS in computer science, mathematics, economics, statistics, engineering, or similar program

What We Offer

Elevate your lifestyle! Join one of Europe's fastest-growing tech powerhouses in a dynamic phase of expansion.

  • Immerse yourself in a diverse global community of 90+ nationalities.
  • Enjoy a competitive compensation package that goes beyond the norm, with perks like a HelloFresh- subsidized Pension Scheme, Berlin relocation support, and a Hybrid working model.
  • Elevate your lifestyle with exclusive discounts on your weekly HelloFresh box and office meals.
  • Invest in your growth with an annual learning & development budget, German language learning budget, and access to the HelloFresh Academy.
  • Plus, we've got your well-being covered with mental health support, transportation perks, and working-parent-friendly benefits. From our 24/7 gym access,wellbeing platforms like Headspace and Spill, to sabbatical leave options, HelloFresh is not just a workplace; it's a lifestyle of perks and possibilities!

Are you up for the challenge?

Please submit your complete application below including your salary expectations and earliest starting date.

After submitting an application our team will review this and get back to you within 5 business days.

JR101535

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
The Company

Payrails is an innovative technology company with a team that has many years of experience in the payment industry and a real-life understanding of the merchantsâ€™ needs. We have seen the complexity firsthand and we have learned from all the challenges we've faced. Now we want to help leading technology companies around the world accept payments and build financial services with minimal upfront investments.

Our vision at Payrails is to reimagine payments. We do this by removing heavy reliance on Engineering efforts using composable building blocks that put the control firmly in the hands of our customers. We exist to help our customers become more productive and flexible, impacting directly on their ability to grow.

We are joined in our mission by top-tier clients Andreessen Horowitz, HV Capital, EQT and General Catalyst alongside a great cast of knowledgeable angel investors to enable us to solve the growing complexity of payments.

At Payrails, we are committed to building a team full of the most talented people. Excellence is part of our values and we understand that in order to achieve this, we need to build an environment where skilled people can work openly, collaboratively, and with the utmost trust in one another. We believe people thrive the most when they are fully aware of what the business is trying to achieve, why it is important to the market, and what challenges lie in the way to reaching our goals. In such an environment we believe people can truly excel, grow and enjoy working together. We try hard to be a company where everyone is inspired and feels a sense of responsibility to do the right thing to help us bring our vision to life. Succeeding with us is about finding solutions to the most pressing problems and executing them effectively.

Your Team

Payrails is a true tech company: our Product is designed by engineers for engineers. We believe in quality before delivery: our mission is to provide an outstanding Payment experience with a strong eye on automation, resilience, and scalability. Our engineering culture is focused on 3 main pillars:


We aim for operational excellence
We promote open communication and quick feedback
We share knowledge and learn continuously


Our Tech team offers you the chance to work alongside a group of highly ambitious and knowledgeable Engineers while being faced with complex problems that affect customers on a global scale.

What You Will Be Doing


Work alongside a dynamic team of talented data analysts, scientists, and engineers to craft innovative data products and services that drive business success.
Develop and maintain robust, scalable, and observable data pipelines.
Contribute to tooling that improves analytics workflows, CI/CD pipelines, and observability.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to transform complex requirements into efficient, impactful solutions.


You'll be great for this role if


You have experience in data engineering roles building reliable, scalable and observable production-grade data pipelines and services.
You have strong proficiency in Python.
You are proficient in SQL, data modeling and operating with OLAP databases (e.g. Snowflake, Bigquery) at scale.
You develop and maintain data pipelines using workflow management platforms such as Apache Airflow.
You are knowledgeable about containerization technologies such as Docker and container orchestration platforms like Kubernetes.
You communicate effectively and are proficient in English.
You work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.
FinTech or payments domain experience is a plus.


Why You should join Payrails


You can truly create your own path by taking responsibility and implementing your own ideas
We offer visa and relocation support to you and your family where required
We offer a hybrid working environment
You have 27 annual vacation days + 1 day of paid birthday leave for you to have fun and party without any worries!
We get together regularly for team lunches and events
You help us shape the future of payments


At Payrails, we prioritize a culture of inclusivity and diversity, evaluating candidates solely based on their skills and potential, regardless of age, gender, identity, ethnicity, sexual orientation, disability status, or religion. We welcome applications from individuals of all backgrounds and identities. In line with our commitment to fairness, we kindly request applicants to refrain from including personal details such as a picture, age, or marital status in their CVs.

Title: Associate Data Warehouse Engineer
Description:
Vestiaire Collective is the leading global online marketplace for desirable pre-loved fashion. Our mission is to transform the fashion industry for a more sustainable future by empowering our community to promote the circular fashion movement. Vestiaire was founded in 2009 and is headquartered in Paris with offices in London, Berlin, New York, Singapore, Ho Chi Minh and Hong Kong and warehouses in Tourcoing (France), Crawley (UK), Hong Kong and New York.

We currently have a diverse global team of 700 employees representing more than 50 nationalities. Our values are Activism, Transparency, Dedication and Greatness and Collective. We are proud to be a BCorp.

About The Job
We are seeking a motivated Junior Data Warehouse Engineer to join our Analytics Engineering team in Berlin. This role focuses on supporting and maintaining our Cloud Data Warehouse solution, primarily using Snowflake. The ideal candidate will have a growth mindset, be eager to learn new technologies, and assist in building data solutions to improve automation, efficiency, scalability, and data availability across the organization.

What You'll Do ðŸ‘œ


Assist in designing and managing Snowflake database architectures
Engage in CI/CD processes to streamline and automate development workflows
Contribute to and maintain DBT (data build tool) configurations and deployments
Explore and analyze database engine mechanics to enhance performance
Troubleshoot database-related issues with a detail-oriented approach





Who You Are â­


Recent graduate with a degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field
Strong interest in database technologies, particularly Snowflake
Understanding of CI/CD pipelines and their applications
Familiarity with DBT, particularly in its configuration and deployment aspects
Proficiency in SQL, including window functions
Enthusiastic about understanding and optimizing database engine mechani





What we offer ðŸŽ

A meaningful job with an impact on the way people consume fashion and promote sustainability

The opportunity to do career-defining work in a fast-growing French-born scale up

The possibility to work as part of a globally diverse team with more than 50 nationalities

Two days to help Project - reinforcing your activist journey and volunteer for an association

Significant investment in your learning and growth

Competitive compensation and benefits package (i.e 28 days of paid time off)

As full member of our entrepreneurial project, you will be eligible to free shares

Surveys show that women and members of underrepresented communities only apply for a job if they meet 100% of the required conditions. Does this sound like you? If so, Vestiaire Collective encourages you to reconsider your application. We look forward to receiving your application!

Vestiaire Collective is an equal opportunities employer

Title: IIoT & Business Data Analyst for FactoryPal (m/f/d)
Description:
You want to redefine how entire industries work by leveraging IoT, Smart Manufacturing and Industry 4.0? Would you like to be part of the success of a digital solution which will revolutionize the manufacturing process to improve shop floor performance? If your answer is a big yes, you should continue reading!

With HQ in Berlin, FactoryPal is a corporate Start-Up â€“ with an additional location in Porto/Portugal. The venture is poised to become the leading end-to-end IoT solution for machine efficiency and equipment effectiveness. The digitally enabled solution is not just completely reshaping how companies produce and elevate their efficiency levels, but it is fundamentally augmenting the way manufacturing employees do their job.

We are data scientists, engineers, designers, IIoT experts, product managers, and manufacturing operations consultants. We are a team, united by our shared ambition: revolutionize manufacturing and transform the way it is done to ensure smooth operations.

Become part of an amazing journey and successfully accompany our customers in their Digital Factory efforts!

Your Role & Key Responsibilities as a IIoT & Business Data Analyst

Joining our customer value analytics team as a data analyst means you'll be an essential part of further developing FactoryPal's analytics product. Together with our experienced data analysts, you'll work on the following topics:


Data Transformation and Analysis:

Generate key insights into customer data by extracting, cleaning, and transforming data from our Snowflake data warehouse using dbt.
Create and maintain data pipelines to ensure accurate and timely data delivery.
Explore large datasets to identify patterns, trends, and anomalies to tell stories with data.



Business Intelligence (BI) Reporting:

Work with Tableau to create insightful reports and dashboards.
Visualize complex data in a user-friendly manner, enabling stakeholders to make informed decisions.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand reporting requirements and deliver actionable insights.



Stakeholder Management & Product Development

Understand and identify the analysis and reporting needs of key customer contacts and internal stakeholders
Derive and communicate insights into customersâ€™ machine and business data.
Contribute with your experience to our product development process and thereby enhance FactoryPalâ€™s analytics solution.


Your Experience & Skills


Bachelor or Masterâ€™s degree in a relevant field (e.g., Computer Science, Data Science, Industrial Engineering, STEM or related fields)
>2 years experience in data analysis, modeling and reporting in a relevant environment - ideally in the industrial / manufacturing sector
Strong analytical mindset and a passion for working with data
Proficiency in SQL and relational databases (first experience with dbt is a plus)
Solid knowledge of Python for data analytics
Experience with Business Intelligence Tools (ideally Tableau)
Familiarity with version control systems (e.g., Git) for managing code and collaboration
Ideally first experience in development of an analytics product using agile methods
Excellent communication skills and ability to collaborate effectively within our team
Willingness to take ownership of tasks and seek solutions independently
Your English is fluent


What You Get


Opportunity to work in a well-funded corporate Start-Up with a competitive advantage derived from market access.
Exposure to the hottest IT technologies, like AI/ML, Cloud and Industrial IoT
Challenging role with lots of opportunities to grow fast & steadily - as an expert and as an entrepreneur
Development opportunity in a group of professionals, who joined from top tier start-up, industry and consulting companies and an education from top tier universities
Offices in prime working locations and technology hotspots such as Berlin and Porto.
Hands-On shopfloor experience in the manufacturing environment with travel opportunities - local and global.
An agile, inspiring, multi-cultural, multi-disciplinary and innovative work environment.
A competitive salary & benefits package - incl. 30 days vacation and dedicated training budget.


Are you interested?

Join our team and send us your detailed application documents via the "Apply" button.

Title: Data Analysis Lead (m/f/d)
Description:
Everything we do, starts with you. Together with you, we build the most human-centric fintech. To enable everyoneâ€™s future financial growth.




We are looking for a

Data Analysis Lead (m/f/d)

(unlimited, fulltime) Join our team at our location in Verl, Berlin, Baden-Baden, Oslo or Heerenveen â€“ flexible working conditions available




As the Data Analysis Lead, you will guide our international team of data analysts across the Nordics, Benelux, and DACH regions. You will play a crucial role in advancing our data strategy and developing our team to meet their professional growth goals. Collaborating closely with various business and functional units, you will translate business needs into data experiments and derive actionable insights about our consumers, clients, and business processes.







Your responsibilities:

Lead, mentor, and manage an international team of data analysts within the fintech domain
Foster a collaborative and high-performance team environment, promoting continuous improvement and innovation
Conduct complex data analyses and provide actionable insights to support business goals and strategic initiatives
Ensure accuracy, integrity, and timeliness of all analytical deliverables, maintaining high data quality standards
Develop and maintain analysis and visualizations to effectively communicate findings to stakeholders using data storytelling techniques
Oversee the planning, execution, and completion of data analysis projects, ensuring alignment with business objectives and deadlines
Collaborate with stakeholders from various business units (e.g., BNPL, collections) and functional units (e.g., Finance, Marketing, Risk Management) to understand data needs and deliver insights
Provide decision support to business units, aiding in informed, data-driven decision-making
Standardize data analysis methodologies, implementing best practices to ensure consistency across the team
Contribute to data governance and strategy initiatives, supporting the organizationâ€™s data management and strategic goals




What you should bring:

5+ years of data analysis experience, including 2 years in a leadership role
Masterâ€™s/MBA degree in a numerate subject (e.g., Finance, Statistics, Mathematics, Economics)
Proficiency in data analysis tools and programming languages (Databricks, SQL, Python)
Excellent analytical skills with attention to detail and accuracy, able to identify issues and conduct necessary analysis
Exceptional interpersonal and leadership skills, with a passion for enabling team growth
Ability to balance multiple priorities, work independently, and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment
Experience in the financial industry, especially in Debt Collection and Buy Now, Pay Later
Working experience in an agile, cross-functional organizational setup
Team player, hands-on mentality, and result-oriented







Thrive at Riverty with great benefits:

Enjoy an open, trusting culture in agile teams and access opportunities within the Bertelsmann Group.
Prioritize your health with supported sports and leisure activities.
Grow together through Riverty Academy trainings and personalized development.
Feel valued with numerous employee discounts.
Our flexible working arrangements empower you to blend on-site collaboration with remote work, tailoring your professional experience to suit your lifestyle.

This list doesn't assure any certain benefits or actions. They might depend on the country or contract details and can change anytime without prior notice. We are happy to discuss these benefits further during your interview.




About us

We are Riverty. And we believe everyone should be in control of their financials. We ask you to join in. Because together with you, we build the most human-centric fintech. We build on experience of more than 50 years. More than 5,000 people in 13 countries drive our company and contribution to society. And we have their backs. We make sure they feel supported and included: Across teams, across physical and invisible borders and across the globe.




Our world is growing. And weâ€™re here. Together, weâ€™re finding smarter, simpler, seamlessly connected ways to manage money. By leveraging data and financial technology, our holistic solutions provide flexible payments, smarter accounting, and fair debt collection, all aimed at fostering everyone's financial growth.




And. Everything we do, starts with you. Join us and letâ€˜s build a more sustainable financial future, together.




More information on riverty.com/careers. Are you already convinced? Then we look forward to receiving your online application â€“ with just a few clicks.

We look forward to applications from candidates who contribute to the diversity of our company. We relate diversity in particular to the dimensions of cultural or social origin, religion, age, disability, gender and sexual identity.




Company: Riverty Group GmbH

Country: Germany

State/Region: Berlin

City: Europe multi-location

Postal Code: 10623

Job ID: 271863

Title: Data Analyst (0 Experience Required)
Description:
For thousands of years, maps have provided humans with the knowledge they need to make decisions. As a Maps Evaluator, you will have the opportunity to provide ground truth for your town, city or country.




At Peroptyx, we are looking for Data Analysts who will review mapping data for digital mapping applications. Your research capabilities will validate and ensure that the navigation of certain routes are accurate and safe.




As part of this role you will verify that business names and opening hours are correct. You will check that the distance from a starting point to an end destination is listed accurately resulting in better user experiences.




With this job you can plan your days around this highly flexible working schedule, work weekends or late evenings, all from the comfort of your own office. The flexibility of our roles minimizes the impact on your daily routine.




So, whether you are a student looking to earn as you learn, a retiree looking for a new challenge a part-time/full time professional or a work from home parent, Peroptyx has the right role for you!




Ideal Candidate

Fluent in English and German.
Excellent research skills.
Excellent local knowledge of your home country.
Good understanding and general knowledge of the geography and culture of Germany.
Analytical mindset.




Job Requirements

Must be living in Germany for a minimum of 5 consecutive years.
Must pass an online open-book exam that can verify your full understanding of the material and concepts.
Must be willing to work a minimum of 10 hours and up to 20 hours per week depending on task availability.
Good working knowledge of search engines, map applications and familiarity with social media platforms.
Strong ability to learn, understand and apply multiple sets of different instructions.
All work must be of an independent nature.




Benefits




Â· Work up to 20 hours per week.

Â· Earn a competitive rate of pay.

Â· Develop your research skills.

Â· Avoid the long commute.

Â· Work from the comfort of your home office.

Â· Enjoy the flexibility of setting your own working hours!




Apply Online Today!

Title: Staff/Principal Data Analyst (d/f/m)
Description:
The Role: How you'll make an impact at Personio

This position can be office-based, hybrid, or fully remote from one of the following countries: Germany, Spain, Ireland, the Netherlands, or the UK.

Drive Strategic Decisions. Shape Our Future. The Data Department is on a mission to facilitate better decisions within the company. We build core data products and enable internal teams to create and share their own. Join our team and help us build the foundation of data at Personio.

As a Staff/Principal Data Analyst supporting the Finance, Legal, and Strategy (FLS) team at Personio, you play a pivotal role in transforming data into strategic insights, shaping our companyâ€™s financial strategy. In this role, you're not just analyzing numbers; you're driving critical business decisions and influencing long-term strategies. Your insights directly impact our financial health and strategic direction, making your contribution vital to our mission of sustainable growth and operational excellence.

Role Responsibilities: What you'll do


Strategic Business Partnership: Act as a primary data strategist for the organization, partnering with top executives. Regularly consult with the CFO and other executives, providing data-driven guidance on major strategic initiatives and long-term planning.
Data Analysis: Analyze and interpret diverse datasets, focusing on financial performance, legal trends, and strategic initiatives to guide FLS in making informed, data-driven decisions.
Dashboard Development: Create and strategize the evolution of real-time, interactive dashboards for stakeholders, ensuring they are user-friendly and aligned with the evolving needs of the business.
Business Reviews and Insight Generation: Oversee the insight generation process for business reviews at a company-wide level, guiding analysts in different departments to highlight crucial insights and trends.
Strategic Planning: Collaborate with leadership and peers in developing business strategies grounded in data insights, aimed at growth, operational optimization, and cost reduction.
Stakeholder Management: Lead multiple projects simultaneously, managing expectations and collaborating with the data team for internal consistency, scalability, and reliability of data practices.
Proactive Team Embedding: Act as a strategic data partner for multiple teams, guiding them in aligning their objectives with data insights. Lead initiatives to use data in solving complex business challenges.


Role Requirements: What you need to succeed


Education & Experience: A quantitative degree (e.g., Applied Math, Econ, Stats, Eng, CS) paired with a minimum of 7 years of data analytics experience, in a SaaS, Subscription, or B2B environment with a focus on Finance, Legal, and Strategy. Experience working with executive-level stakeholders (CFO, CEO, â€¦).
Deep understanding of SaaS-specific financial processes and financial systems like Salesforce, Chargebee, Adaptive.
KPI and Dashboard Expertise: Strong understanding of financial and strategic KPIs and proficient in creating scalable dashboards that effectively translate business requirements into impactful visuals.
Technical Proficiency: Advanced skills in SQL and BI/Visualization tools like Tableau, facilitating data extraction, manipulation, and presentation.
Statistical Knowledge: Master the use of cutting-edge statistical methods and tools, providing strategic guidance and recommendations based on sophisticated data analysis.
Analytical Mindset: Intellectual curiosity to delve deep into data, identifying underlying trends, patterns, and actionable insights.
Communication Skills: Ability to articulate complex data observations in simple terms, ensuring clarity and understanding among stakeholders. Master the art of storytelling with data, driving organizational change and strategy through powerful presentations and reports.
Entrepreneurial Approach: A proactive problem-solver, focused on generating impactful results and identifying opportunities for improvement through data-driven insights.


Why Personio

Personio is an equal opportunities employer, committed to building an integrative culture where everyone feels welcomed and supported. We embrace uniqueness and understand that our diverse, values-driven culture makes us stronger. We are proud to have an inclusive workplace environment that will foster your development no matter your gender, civil status, family status, sexual orientation, religion, age, disability, education level, or race.

Benefits

Aside from our people, culture, and mission, check out some of the other benefits that make Personio a great place to work:


Receive a competitive reward package â€“ reevaluated each year â€“ that includes salary, benefits, and pre-IPO equity
Enjoy 28 days of paid vacation, plus an additional day after 2 and 4 years (because we love what we do, but we also love vacation!)
Make an impact on the environment and society with 2 (fully paid) Impact Days â€“ one for an individual project of your choice and one for a company-wide initiative
Receive generous family leave, child support, mental health support, and sabbatical opportunities with PersonioCares
Find your best way to work with our office-led, remote-friendly PersonioFlex! Most teams offer a roughly 50% remote, 50% in-office working framework
Invest in your development with an annual personal development budget to use on professional memberships, external certifications, conferences, and more
Connect with your fellow Personios at regular company and team events like All Company Culture Week and local year-end celebrations
Engage in a high-impact working environment with flat hierarchies and short decision-making processes


About Us

Bring your best. Make your mark. Weâ€™re using technology to revolutionize the way HR operates so that we can transform the way millions of people experience work every day. We move fast, challenge the status quo, and support our people as they shape their careers.

With over 10,000 customers and a team of 2,000 in eight offices around the world, now is the perfect time to join! We believe in hiring driven people who want to make an impact. So bring your best, and letâ€™s build the future of HR technology together.

Discover our Personio Principles, that guide our mindset, behaviours, and the ways we work together:

Exceed Customer Expectations: We anticipate, prioritize, and solve for the needs of our customers.

Deliver Exceptional Results: We dream big and move with urgency to make great things happen.

Elevate One Another: We work together as trusted partners to amplify our collective impact.

Care to Challenge: We care personally and challenge directly to unlock our full potential.

Ignite Positive Momentum: We embrace the challenge with a positive mindset and celebrate our wins together.
