Title: Lead Data Analyst (f/m/d)
Description:
Founded in 2008, BMG has become the fourth-largest music publisher worldwide. Our success and competitive edge are rooted in our founding values of fairness, transparency, and service. Our mission is clear: to empower artists and songwriters to maximize the potential of their songs and recordings in the digital era.

BMGâ€™s Global Data Analytics is our central data unit, spanning a close-knit international team of experienced Analytics Engineers, Data Analysts and Data Scientists across Germany, the US and the UK. Weâ€™re transforming how music works, enabling operational stakeholders to make data-driven decisions as well as driving strategic growth, based on a modern data stack.

We are currently seeking anâ€¯experienced Lead Data Analyst (f/m/d) to join our headquarters in Berlin. As a seasoned Data Analyst, you will guide junior analysts and collaborate with senior stakeholders of various departments to facilitate informed decision-making through novel data insights, compelling storytelling, and advanced data visualization. Join us in shaping the future of music analytics!

â€¯

What Youâ€™ll Be Doing


Process big data volumes, modeling and transforming data (using dbt) from centralized DWHs (e.g. Google BigQuery) and external/organizational databases to build strategic analyses and operational KPIs
Utilize data visualization to support decision-making, crafting compelling (Looker) dashboards for key business stakeholders (e.g. Investments, Artist & Repertoire, Marketing, Streaming Sales, Rights & Royalties, Finance)
Develop scalable self-service reporting solutions and address diverse ad-hoc requests that transform our business
Collaborate closely with our global team and international colleagues to foster a data-driven culture by proposing innovative initiatives and building actionable data products
Interact with developers, data engineers, and management to propose new technologies, processes and system improvements, as well as global data governanceâ€¯strategies
Provide training and mentorship to junior team members, empowering them to excel in their contributions to the teamâ€™s projects
Develop sustainable processes and methodologies to support the effectiveness of our Data Analytics function


What You Bring


Degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Economics, Statistics, Mathematics, or related field
Profound experience in data analytics, ideally with large datasets
Excellent SQL skills and good knowledge of Python
Proficiency in data visualization tools, such as Looker or Tableau
Broad understanding of data analysis methods and storytelling
Results-driven and analytical character, with a strategic mindset to derive business insights
Effective communication skills - confident in presenting findings to senior management
Ability to build relationships with stakeholders to understand business needs and data consumer needs
Strong interest to mentor junior colleagues with enthusiasm and expertise
Capability to plan and implement projects independently
Comfortable working in a global, fast-paced and dynamic environment


Itâ€™s also a plus if you haveâ€¦


Team leadership experience
Prior music industry experience
Experience with GCP, dbt and Git
Knowledge of Jira and Confluence
Understanding of statistical methods and ML
Experience using ETL frameworks


What We Offer


A modern office in the heart of Berlin and flexible options for remote work.
Numerous benefits such as a free BVG job ticket, a reduced-price membership for Urban Sports, company bike leasing, discounts for Bertelsmann employees, among others
Ongoing training opportunities on our internal platforms BMG Campus and Bertelsmann University
Long-term career opportunities for all employees.
A collaborative work environment with an open, appreciative community of people who all share the same passion for working with artists and songwriters.
Our unique corporate culture based on strong values and mutual support that make us a great team.


This is us

As the great Kurt Cobain once said, "Come as you are."â€¯BMG is committed to providing equal employment opportunities for all employees. We value diversity in all forms. Equal opportunity is deeply rooted in our core value of fairness, and we are committed to creating a truly inclusive work environment where everyone can thrive. If you're good at what you do, come as you are! Whether you're an experienced professional or just starting out, we welcome you to join our team.

All applicants to BMG are treated equally - regardless of age, disability, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, marital status, pregnancy or parenthood, ethnic origin, color, nationality, religion or belief.

(BMG is publishing Kurt Cobain's catalog, including the 1992 single 'Come As You Are.')

Title: Senior Data Analyst (f/m/x)
Description:
CarOnSale is a start-up in the heart of Berlin. As a tech company, we have made it our mission to enable smooth digital processes in the automotive trade across Europe. Join us and develop new, innovative solutions for the B2B sector.

For our Data team based at our HQ in Berlin, we are looking for a Senior Data Analyst (f/m/x)

Your tasks:

Data Analysis:


Analyse and interpret data from various sources to extract meaningful insights.
Identify opportunities for data-driven decision-making within the organisation.
Define and maintain key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure success.



Project Leadership:


Lead data exploration projects to uncover actionable insights.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify and define data needs for various business initiatives.



Dashboard Creation:


Develop and maintain dashboards that enable stakeholders to monitor and analyse critical business metrics.



Report Generation:


Generate reports that provide valuable insights to support decision-making across multiple teams.



Stakeholder Management:


Engage with internal stakeholders to ensure their expectations align with our deliverables.
Manage multiple projects simultaneously, setting clear expectations for scope and timeline.
Cultivate and maintain strong relationships with stakeholders and product managers.



Enablement:


Provide support to enhance daily reporting and analytics tasks within the company.
Offer training and education to team members on data analysis tools and techniques for better decision-making



Your profile


4+ yearsâ€™ experience as a data analyst
Proven experience in data analysis, interpretation, and visualisation.
Proficiency in data analysis tools and languages (e.g., SQL, Tableau).
Experience working with Python.
Strong communication and presentation skills.
Ability to manage multiple projects with attention to detail.
Strong problem-solving and critical-thinking skills.
Familiarity with Google Analytics & tracking data
Fluency in English (C1)



Nice to have:


Being able to communicate in German



Why COS?


First things first: Youâ€™ll be taken seriously from day one and will play an important role in our mission, because we want to disrupt Europeâ€™s automotive market together with you
Growth and development: benefit from a detailed on-boarding program, systematic feedback cycles and individual coaching
Your gear, your choice: you will be provided with a MacBook or Windows laptop and all the hardware and software you need to work
Become a COSie: be part of a motivated team with ambitious goals and enjoy lots of fun, lots of awesome team events and a unique COS team spirit
Truly diverse and inclusive: Diversity is important to you? It is important to us too! Diversity in which everyone feels comfortable, is absolutely central to us

Company Pension Scheme - as a denkwerker you receive an employer subsidy of 20% for your company pension scheme
Free choice of devices: Whether Mac or Windows - you may also use our hardware privately
Support in all life situations: Counseling opportunities from pme Familienservice
denkfrei days: of our 31 vacation days, three days are free for everyone (Christmas Eve, New Year's Eve & Carnival Monday) to take a deep breath together
denkmate: that's what we call our experienced denkwerkers, who are there to help and advise you at the start of your new working day
Corporate benefits: all kinds of employee discounts
Snacks & Drinks: cool lemonades, beer, fresh coffee or even fruit and vegetables - there's something for everyone


Here's how to get started!

Can't wait to get started? Neither can we! We're looking for you to start immediately, but we're also flexible with your possible start date.

Please also send us your CV and salary requirements.

P. S.: Classic cover letters are too normal for you? Surprise us with your creativity and introduce yourself and your motivations in your own way. We are curious!

What To Expect In The Application Process


1st interview: ~1 hour, mostly online with two participants from denkwerk
2nd interview: ~1 hour, preferably on site with two denkwerk participants
In our interviews, both the professional and human denkwerk fit are highlighted
After the two interviews, if the feedback is positive, a telephone offer conversation will follow
We aim for quick feedback loops: if you are still missing feedback, please contact us proactively!


Why denkwerk?

We are an owner-managed digital agency with headquarters in Cologne Ehrenfeld and further locations in Berlin Kreuzberg, Hamburg and Munich. A total of 250 motivated denkwerkers from 28 nations are waiting for you, including about 55 colleagues at the Berlin office. Specifically, you will be part of our 6-person Digital Marketing & Analytics team. As a data analyst, you will support exciting client projects and work closely with the strategy, content, SEO, SEA and technology departments. We create unique digital products for various clients such as Congstar, DeepL, ESPRIT, Mainova, Microsoft, Motel One, STIEBEL ELTRON and STORCK. To round off your onboarding, regular feedback meetings await you. As a "Great Place to Work 2023" employer, your opinion is important to us because we live an open feedback culture! We like to celebrate, especially our successes - look forward to celebrations of all kinds, such as our summer parties and Christmas parties.

Your contact persons

Janina Schulte-Kellinghaus, Marie Rybarczik & Rusin Hassan, Talent Acquisition Team

Title: Senior Business Intelligence Analyst (m/f/d)
Description:
Location: Onsite. Berlin Mitte, Germany.

About Us

Founded in 2021, our company operates a pioneering marketplace that redefines one of the largest supply chains in the world from out of the heart of Berlin. Our mission is to unlock the vast potential of cross-border supply for the Western Market by providing global access to high-quality products through our innovative platform.

Since our launch in January 2022, we have operated discreetly, successfully serving hundreds of companies without a public profile or media coverage. We cater to both major industry players and mid-sized companies, utilizing a cutting-edge technology platform that is experiencing rapid growth. Having secured substantial capital from top-tier VCs, Unicorn and Decacorn founders, and industry experts through various funding rounds, we are well-funded, 50 people strong, and expanding our team!

About This Role

We are seeking a highly skilled Senior Business Intelligence Analyst to join our team in the heart of Berlin. In this pivotal role, you will define and execute our data modeling and analysis strategy, drive data governance and quality assurance excellence, take the lead in tool and system innovation, and introduce best practices and mentoring.

You will work closely with business intelligence professionals, senior engineers, data analysts, and business stakeholders from sales, procurement, and accounting to develop features that drive business growth.

Tasks

What You Will Do


Lead the development and maintenance of the companyâ€™s BI structure to support strategic business initiatives
Conduct complex data analysis to extract deep insights and trends that drive business growth and operational efficiency
Create advanced dashboards, reports, and visualizations that facilitate data-driven decision-making at all levels of the organization
Act as a strategic partner to senior management and department heads, understanding their data needs and delivering actionable intelligence
Translate high-level business requirements into detailed technical specifications for robust data reporting and analysis
Facilitate data-driven discussions and workshops with stakeholders to enhance organizational data literacy
Ensure the accuracy, consistency, and integrity of data across the organization
Develop and implement comprehensive data validation and cleansing processes to maintain the highest data quality standards
Lead the continuous improvement and optimization of the BI infrastructure and reporting capabilities using advanced BI tools and platforms (such as Tableau, Power BI, SQL, and Databricks)
Mentor and develop junior analysts, fostering a culture of continuous learning and professional growth within the team



Requirements

What you bring


Masterâ€™s degree in Business, Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, or a related field. A Masterâ€™s degree is strongly preferred.
5+ years of extensive experience in business intelligence, data analysis, and reporting.
Proven track record of delivering strategic insights and high-quality reports in a fast-paced environment.
Advanced proficiency in BI tools such as Tableau/Power BI, SQL and Google Sheets
Experience with data warehousing, ETL processes, and real-time data processing frameworks



Who You Are


Exceptional analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to interpret complex datasets and translate them into actionable business insights
Excellent communication skills with the ability to effectively collaborate with cross-functional teams and stakeholders
Strong ability to present data insights and strategic recommendations to diverse audiences, including senior leadership
High level of attention to detail and accuracy in data analysis and reporting
Ability to ensure data quality and integrity in all analytical processes
Ability to thrive in a dynamic, fast-paced environment and drive results in a rapidly evolving organization



Benefits

What we offer


A role with entrepreneurial freedom in a pre-validated business model, to push to the next level
An experienced founding team of serial founders
A future-proof job with an attractive salary
Collaboration with top-tier investors and angles (incl. various unicorn founders) as well as leading market experts
A challenging yet rewarding work environment, and the opportunity to make a significant impact within a rapidly growing company
Beautiful office space in the center of Berlin, monthly All-Hands, team events, and team lunches



Join one of the fastest-growing B2B companies in Europe, led by an international, intercultural team of serial entrepreneurs, and experienced executives!

Internal job reference: 7b906e50-fcaa-4972-90c8-418ed163b669

Title: Staff Data Analyst - BI and Marketing Analytics (all genders)
Description:
About The Opportunity

We are looking for a Staff Data Analyst (all genders) to join the BI and Marketing Analytic ( BIMA) team on our journey to always deliver amazing experiences. This is a global position working closely with our brands in over 70 countries and implementing strategy from our HQ in Berlin.

BIMA is part of the Global marketing team responsible for central BI and marketing analytics . BIMAâ€™ s team mission is to drive marketing actions through data-driven solutions & strategic insights to ensure sustainable growth. We drive strategic projects such as customer segmentation, marketing ROI measurement , CLV and support the C-level in making strategic decisions across all brands and countries.

If you're a creative problem solver who is hungry for a new adventure, an international workplace is waiting for you in the heart of Berlin!

The Staff Data Analyst will be responsible for optimizing our marketing strategies through data-driven insights and advanced analytics. This role will collaborate closely with the marketing leads , product, and data science teams, and regional analytic teams to analyze marketing performance and optimize our acquisition and retention strategies.

Your key responsibilities include :


Utilize analytics to provide actionable insights on marketing performance.
Design and implement A/B testing and other experimental frameworks to assess the effectiveness of marketing initiatives.
Create tools , KPI frameworks, and reports to measure ROI of marketing spend. Continuously monitor and guide marketing spend across various channels to maximize ROI.
Analyze and improve the customer segmentation to drive targeting strategies in the local markets and increase customer retention
Create statistical models to project customer lifetime value, measure customer acquisition costs (CAC) and use analytics to reduce CAC and increase LTV
Work closely with marketing, product, and engineering teams to ensure alignment on data needs and create global guidelines on how data needs to be collected and consumed.
Present findings and recommendations to senior leadership and stakeholders in a clear and actionable manner.


What you need to be successful


4+ years of experience in marketing analytics, with a focus on user retention for technology-driven consumer facing companies.
Strong proficiency in analytics tools and platforms (e.g., Google Big Query, Google Analytics, Tableau, SQL, Python/R).
Exceptional analytical skills with the ability to translate data into actionable insights.
Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to influence stakeholders at all levels.
Experience with A/B testing, attribution modeling, and other experimental design methodologies.
Strong understanding of digital marketing channels and strategies, including CRM, paid search, social media, and content marketing.


Who we are

As the worldâ€™s pioneering local delivery platform, our mission is to deliver an amazing experience, fast, easy, and to your door. We operate in over 70+ countries worldwide, powered by tech, designed by people. As one of Europeâ€™s largest tech platforms, we enable creative minds to deliver solutions that create impact within our ecosystem. We move fast, take action and adapt. No matter where you're from or what you believe in, we build, we deliver, we lead. We are Delivery Hero

What's in it for you

Nice to have:


Experience in agile development and methodologies
BS, MS or PhD in computer science, statistics, math, physic, business, etc
Expertise in developing and implementing naming conventions and tagging strategies to ensure data consistency in a global organization. Experience with Market mix modeling


At Delivery Hero, we believe diversity and inclusion are key to creating not only an exciting product, but also an amazing customer and employee experience. Fostering this starts with hiring -- therefore we do not discriminate on the basis of racial identities, religious beliefs, color, national origin, gender identities or expressions, sexual orientations, age, marital or disability statuses, or any other aspect that makes you, you. Just be yourself and we canâ€™t wait to see what value you bring to the role. We're as interested in your character as we are in your talent.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
The Company

Payrails is an innovative technology company with a team that has many years of experience in the payment industry and a real-life understanding of the merchantsâ€™ needs. We have seen the complexity firsthand and we have learned from all the challenges we've faced. Now we want to help leading technology companies around the world accept payments and build financial services with minimal upfront investments.

Our vision at Payrails is to reimagine payments. We do this by removing heavy reliance on Engineering efforts using composable building blocks that put the control firmly in the hands of our customers. We exist to help our customers become more productive and flexible, impacting directly on their ability to grow.

We are joined in our mission by top-tier clients Andreessen Horowitz, HV Capital, EQT and General Catalyst alongside a great cast of knowledgeable angel investors to enable us to solve the growing complexity of payments.

At Payrails, we are committed to building a team full of the most talented people. Excellence is part of our values and we understand that in order to achieve this, we need to build an environment where skilled people can work openly, collaboratively, and with the utmost trust in one another. We believe people thrive the most when they are fully aware of what the business is trying to achieve, why it is important to the market, and what challenges lie in the way to reaching our goals. In such an environment we believe people can truly excel, grow and enjoy working together. We try hard to be a company where everyone is inspired and feels a sense of responsibility to do the right thing to help us bring our vision to life. Succeeding with us is about finding solutions to the most pressing problems and executing them effectively.

Your Team

Payrails is a true tech company: our Product is designed by engineers for engineers. We believe in quality before delivery: our mission is to provide an outstanding Payment experience with a strong eye on automation, resilience, and scalability. Our engineering culture is focused on 3 main pillars:


We aim for operational excellence
We promote open communication and quick feedback
We share knowledge and learn continuously


Our Tech team offers you the chance to work alongside a group of highly ambitious and knowledgeable Engineers while being faced with complex problems that affect customers on a global scale.

What You Will Be Doing


Work alongside a dynamic team of talented data analysts, scientists, and engineers to craft innovative data products and services that drive business success.
Develop and maintain robust, scalable, and observable data pipelines.
Contribute to tooling that improves analytics workflows, CI/CD pipelines, and observability.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to transform complex requirements into efficient, impactful solutions.


You'll be great for this role if


You have experience in data engineering roles building reliable, scalable and observable production-grade data pipelines and services.
You have strong proficiency in Python.
You are proficient in SQL, data modeling and operating with OLAP databases (e.g. Snowflake, Bigquery) at scale.
You develop and maintain data pipelines using workflow management platforms such as Apache Airflow.
You are knowledgeable about containerization technologies such as Docker and container orchestration platforms like Kubernetes.
You communicate effectively and are proficient in English.
You work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.
FinTech or payments domain experience is a plus.


Why You should join Payrails


You can truly create your own path by taking responsibility and implementing your own ideas
We offer visa and relocation support to you and your family where required
We offer a hybrid working environment
You have 27 annual vacation days + 1 day of paid birthday leave for you to have fun and party without any worries!
We get together regularly for team lunches and events
You help us shape the future of payments


At Payrails, we prioritize a culture of inclusivity and diversity, evaluating candidates solely based on their skills and potential, regardless of age, gender, identity, ethnicity, sexual orientation, disability status, or religion. We welcome applications from individuals of all backgrounds and identities. In line with our commitment to fairness, we kindly request applicants to refrain from including personal details such as a picture, age, or marital status in their CVs.
Show more
HTML:
The Company

Payrails is an innovative technology company with a team that has many years of experience in the payment industry and a real-life understanding of the merchantsâ€™ needs. We have seen the complexity firsthand and we have learned from all the challenges we've faced. Now we want to help leading technology companies around the world accept payments and build financial services with minimal upfront investments.

Our vision at Payrails is to reimagine payments. We do this by removing heavy reliance on Engineering efforts using composable building blocks that put the control firmly in the hands of our customers. We exist to help our customers become more productive and flexible, impacting directly on their ability to grow.

We are joined in our mission by top-tier clients Andreessen Horowitz, HV Capital, EQT and General Catalyst alongside a great cast of knowledgeable angel investors to enable us to solve the growing complexity of payments.

At Payrails, we are committed to building a team full of the most talented people. Excellence is part of our values and we understand that in order to achieve this, we need to build an environment where skilled people can work openly, collaboratively, and with the utmost trust in one another. We believe people thrive the most when they are fully aware of what the business is trying to achieve, why it is important to the market, and what challenges lie in the way to reaching our goals. In such an environment we believe people can truly excel, grow and enjoy working together. We try hard to be a company where everyone is inspired and feels a sense of responsibility to do the right thing to help us bring our vision to life. Succeeding with us is about finding solutions to the most pressing problems and executing them effectively.

Your Team

Payrails is a true tech company: our Product is designed by engineers for engineers. We believe in quality before delivery: our mission is to provide an outstanding Payment experience with a strong eye on automation, resilience, and scalability. Our engineering culture is focused on 3 main pillars:

  • We aim for operational excellence
  • We promote open communication and quick feedback
  • We share knowledge and learn continuously

Our Tech team offers you the chance to work alongside a group of highly ambitious and knowledgeable Engineers while being faced with complex problems that affect customers on a global scale.

What You Will Be Doing

  • Work alongside a dynamic team of talented data analysts, scientists, and engineers to craft innovative data products and services that drive business success.
  • Develop and maintain robust, scalable, and observable data pipelines.
  • Contribute to tooling that improves analytics workflows, CI/CD pipelines, and observability.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to transform complex requirements into efficient, impactful solutions.

You'll be great for this role if

  • You have experience in data engineering roles building reliable, scalable and observable production-grade data pipelines and services.
  • You have strong proficiency in Python.
  • You are proficient in SQL, data modeling and operating with OLAP databases (e.g. Snowflake, Bigquery) at scale.
  • You develop and maintain data pipelines using workflow management platforms such as Apache Airflow.
  • You are knowledgeable about containerization technologies such as Docker and container orchestration platforms like Kubernetes.
  • You communicate effectively and are proficient in English.
  • You work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.
  • FinTech or payments domain experience is a plus.

Why You should join Payrails

  • You can truly create your own path by taking responsibility and implementing your own ideas
  • We offer visa and relocation support to you and your family where required
  • We offer a hybrid working environment
  • You have 27 annual vacation days + 1 day of paid birthday leave for you to have fun and party without any worries!
  • We get together regularly for team lunches and events
  • You help us shape the future of payments

At Payrails, we prioritize a culture of inclusivity and diversity, evaluating candidates solely based on their skills and potential, regardless of age, gender, identity, ethnicity, sexual orientation, disability status, or religion. We welcome applications from individuals of all backgrounds and identities. In line with our commitment to fairness, we kindly request applicants to refrain from including personal details such as a picture, age, or marital status in their CVs.

Title: Speech/Text Analyst
Description:
At eBay, we're more than a global ecommerce leader â€” weâ€™re changing the way the world shops and sells. Our platform empowers millions of buyers and sellers in more than 190 markets around the world. Weâ€™re committed to pushing boundaries and leaving our mark as we reinvent the future of ecommerce for enthusiasts.

Our customers are our compass, authenticity thrives, bold ideas are welcome, and everyone can bring their unique selves to work â€” every day. We're in this together, sustaining the future of our customers, our company, and our planet.

Join a team of passionate thinkers, innovators, and dreamers â€” and help us connect people and build communities to create economic opportunity for all.

About The Role And Team

As a speech & text analyst supporting our Service Insights program, you are key to our GCX transformation project! You will support our transformational project to understand what is driving customer contacts, effort, and satisfaction. We will be making recommendations on process, policy, and product changes that improve the customer journey. You will design and build speech/ text analytics models from multiple data sources such as chats, phone calls, email, and surveys. You will implement CX processes, tools, and measurement systems that drive customer centricity as well as employee engagement. You will work with partners to understand their goals and use speech/text analytics to identify key problems as well as enable closed loop feedback processes.

To be successful in this role, you should provide a strategic perspective, possess a focused, analytical mind, with the ability to connect the dots and identify the big picture. You have an unwavering advocacy for the customers we serve.

What you will accomplish


Build speech/text analytics models in German and English
Lead and take part in analysis projects including light analytics & statistical analysis
Evaluate customer experiences and recommend solutions for improvement
Manage speech/text analytics model health for all GCX programs
Support our CS tech partners on back end technical updates
Serve as a subject matter expert for GCX organization on speech/text analytics
Perform in-depth analysis to identify gaps and opportunities and propose impactful enhancements
Ensure compliance with customer and company standards



What you will bring

Being in such a dynamic role you will have a blend set of core and adjacent skills.

Core Skills & Proficiencies


1-2 years experience building speech analytics models, text analytics models, or similar technologies (including CallMiner, NICE, Nexidia, XM Discover, etc.)
1-2 years experience in CX using customer data to understand problems, making recommendations, and working cross functionally to improve the customer experience.
Track record driving CX innovation and initiatives with a view to enhance the customer experience and uplift satisfaction.
Fluency in German and English. Proficiency with Spanish, French, or Italian is a plus.



Additional Considerations


Experience managing projects. Project management certification is a plus.
Deep knowledge of eBay and familiarity with buying and selling on eBayâ€™s platform.
Organizational dexterity â€“ ability to interact across all levels within the organization.
Strong emotional intelligence and skills in leading robust cross-functional relationships.
Effective communicator with written and oral presentations. Demonstrate solid presentation, demonstration, and technical writing skills.
Must be able to use deep problem-solving skills to unpack issues/questions and develop relevant solutions.
Experience with analytical software (Tableau, SQL (Teradata), data warehouse, etc.) is a plus.
Level of Education: 4-yr degree or equivalent experience.



Please see the Talent Privacy Notice for information regarding how eBay handles your personal data collected when you use the eBay Careers website or apply for a job with eBay.

eBay is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status, and disability, or other legally protected status. If you have a need that requires accommodation, please contact us at talent@ebay.com. We will make every effort to respond to your request for accommodation as soon as possible. View our accessibility statement to learn more about eBay's commitment to ensuring digital accessibility for people with disabilities.

Jobs posted with location as "Remote - United States (Excludes: HI, NM)" excludes residents of Hawaii and New Mexico.

Title: Replenishment Analyst (m/f/d)
HTML:
Company Description

Flink is the leading quick commerce player in Europe. We are on a mission to give people back time: You can order your groceries through our app and we deliver to your doorstep in minutes. We carry 2,500 products with focus on the leading brands in each category. We aim for sustainability by making deliveries on electric bikes and utilizing recyclable packaging.

Flink launched in February 2021 and already operates in more than 80 cities in Germany, and the Netherlands. The business generated more than EUR 400m in revenues in 2022 and is operationally profitable. Flink is backed by the worldâ€™s most renowned tech investors, including Prosus, Mubadala and Bond and strategic investors like Doordash and REWE. We take great pride in being an inclusive employer that offers equal opportunities, and we celebrate the diversity and multiculturalism of our team. We're growing fast and always pushing ourselves to do better - we play for #1.

As a Replenishment Analyst (m/f/d), your goal is to increase product availability and reduce product waste. You will identify issues using SQL, Python, and Looker, and then transform these insights into actionable projects in Relex, our primary replenishment tool, and present your work to relevant stakeholders within the company.

Job Description

  • Analyze and Forecast Demand: utilize historical data, market trends, and predictive analytics tools such as Relex to accurately forecast product demand and ensure optimal inventory levels;
  • Optimize Inventory Management: implement strategies within Relex to balance stock levels, minimize excess inventory, and reduce stockouts, ensuring continuous product availability;
  • Collaborate with Cross-Functional Teams: work closely with commercial, hub operations, and supply chain teams to align inventory strategies with business objectives and respond effectively to changes in demand;
  • Monitor and Report Key Metrics: track and report on key performance indicators (KPIs) related to product availability, inventory turnover, and waste reduction, providing actionable insights and recommendations for continuous improvement;
  • Develop and Implement Improvement Initiatives: identify opportunities for process improvements and efficiencies in demand planning and replenishment, and lead projects to implement these improvements.

Qualifications

  • Demonstrated ability to independently drive projects forward, take full ownership of tasks, and deliver results in a timely manner;
  • Degree in Engineering, Mathematics, Business, Economics or related fields (Supply Chain / Logistics is a plus);
  • Initial work experience in a data-driven business environment such as analytics, demand planning, controlling, or business intelligence;
  • Business fluency in English (German is a plus);
  • Excellent analytical skills, including proficiency in Excel and SQL (Python is a plus);
  • Prior experience with Relex or other replenishment software;
  • Experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau, PowerBI, Looker, or similar;
  • Hands-on team player with a demonstrated ability to think outside the box and a nothing-is-impossible mindset.

Additional Information

  • A â‚¬1000 annual L&D budget as well as individual coaching options to ensure you have plenty of opportunities to learn, grow and achieve your goals
  • 26 days of vacation, +1 day every year up to a maximum of 30 days
  • A mobility budget of 30 EUR per month with NAVIT, which you can use individually for Uber, BVG and many other providers
  • A cool discount on your Urban Sports Club membership
  • Attractive company pension options
  • Unlimited access to an e-learning and development platform, MyAcademy, including online German courses
  • Online discounts with Corporate Benefits and Future Bens
  • A cool discount off your personal Flink orders; be the first to test out new products!
  • A modern and dog-friendly office in the heart of Berlin - lots of delicious lunch spots available within short walking distance

It is our commitment that every applicant will be evaluated according to their skills regardless of age, gender identity, ethnicity, sexual orientation, disability status, or religion.

Title: Senior Data Analyst, Referrals (m/f/x)
Description:
The role

As a Senior Data Analyst in the Referrals Analytics team, you'll play a key role in the Global Virality department. This team works on getting customers to share their HelloFresh experiences and recommend us to their friends. We aim to build a flexible referral program offering attractive deals to customers across the HelloFresh Group. The team is a hyper growth team which contribute to ~30% of the overall business globally.

In this job, youâ€™ll provide important insights that help shape our Digital Product and Commercial strategies. You'll use data to spot trends and find new opportunities that guide our decisions. You'll also help create a data-driven culture in our team, making sure everyone can use data to make smart choices. Your skills in Data Analytics and related technologies, along with your strong communication and organizational abilities, will greatly influence our companyâ€™s success.

Above all, we are looking for people who will make HelloFresh better. We believe there are many different ways of developing skills and we love diverse experiences! So even if you donâ€™t â€œtick all the boxesâ€ but think youâ€™d thrive in this role, we would really like to learn more about you.

What Youâ€™ll Do


Provide cracking insights to optimize campaign targeting and efficiency of referral program promotions to customers
Analyze customer data to identify pain points and opportunities in the customer journey, helping to determine customer segmentation and personalization strategies.
Creating deep-dives and ad-hoc analysis, research, AB test analyses, reporting & visualization
Utilize various databases and querying/programming languages to access, manipulate and present the data needed
Improve how we look at Virality Analytics as a group, bringing key analytical insight to various levels across the organization
Work with other analytics departments, driving cross-team collaboration, best practice sharing, and insight generation.


What Youâ€™ll Bring


4+ years in a highly analytical role (bonus if youâ€™ve worked in a Start-Up or in a high-growth environment)
Advanced abilities in SQL and python, and the ability to use statistical modeling techniques for robust analysis.
A strong business acumen and can translate insights into actionable recommendations that align with business objectives
Expertise in data visualization and data storytelling, including experience with dashboarding tools (Tableau preferred)
Experience working with a range of business stakeholders and communicating technical results in business language
A BS in computer science, mathematics, economics, statistics, engineering, or similar program


What We Offer

Elevate your lifestyle! Join one of Europe's fastest-growing tech powerhouses in a dynamic phase of expansion.


Immerse yourself in a diverse global community of 90+ nationalities.
Enjoy a competitive compensation package that goes beyond the norm, with perks like a HelloFresh- subsidized Pension Scheme, Berlin relocation support, and a Hybrid working model.
Elevate your lifestyle with exclusive discounts on your weekly HelloFresh box and office meals.
Invest in your growth with an annual learning & development budget, German language learning budget, and access to the HelloFresh Academy.
Plus, we've got your well-being covered with mental health support, transportation perks, and working-parent-friendly benefits. From our 24/7 gym access,wellbeing platforms like Headspace and Spill, to sabbatical leave options, HelloFresh is not just a workplace; it's a lifestyle of perks and possibilities!


Are you up for the challenge?

Please submit your complete application below including your salary expectations and earliest starting date.

After submitting an application our team will review this and get back to you within 5 business days.

JR101535

  • 4+ years in a highly analytical role (bonus if youâ€™ve worked in a Start-Up or in a high-growth environment)
  • Advanced abilities in SQL and python, and the ability to use statistical modeling techniques for robust analysis.
  • A strong business acumen and can translate insights into actionable recommendations that align with business objectives
  • Expertise in data visualization and data storytelling, including experience with dashboarding tools (Tableau preferred)
  • Experience working with a range of business stakeholders and communicating technical results in business language
  • A BS in computer science, mathematics, economics, statistics, engineering, or similar program

What We Offer

Elevate your lifestyle! Join one of Europe's fastest-growing tech powerhouses in a dynamic phase of expansion.

  • Immerse yourself in a diverse global community of 90+ nationalities.
  • Enjoy a competitive compensation package that goes beyond the norm, with perks like a HelloFresh- subsidized Pension Scheme, Berlin relocation support, and a Hybrid working model.
  • Elevate your lifestyle with exclusive discounts on your weekly HelloFresh box and office meals.
  • Invest in your growth with an annual learning & development budget, German language learning budget, and access to the HelloFresh Academy.
  • Plus, we've got your well-being covered with mental health support, transportation perks, and working-parent-friendly benefits. From our 24/7 gym access,wellbeing platforms like Headspace and Spill, to sabbatical leave options, HelloFresh is not just a workplace; it's a lifestyle of perks and possibilities!

Are you up for the challenge?

Please submit your complete application below including your salary expectations and earliest starting date.

After submitting an application our team will review this and get back to you within 5 business days.

JR101535

Title: IIoT & Business Data Analyst for FactoryPal (m/f/d)
Description:
You want to redefine how entire industries work by leveraging IoT, Smart Manufacturing and Industry 4.0? Would you like to be part of the success of a digital solution which will revolutionize the manufacturing process to improve shop floor performance? If your answer is a big yes, you should continue reading!

With HQ in Berlin, FactoryPal is a corporate Start-Up â€“ with an additional location in Porto/Portugal. The venture is poised to become the leading end-to-end IoT solution for machine efficiency and equipment effectiveness. The digitally enabled solution is not just completely reshaping how companies produce and elevate their efficiency levels, but it is fundamentally augmenting the way manufacturing employees do their job.

We are data scientists, engineers, designers, IIoT experts, product managers, and manufacturing operations consultants. We are a team, united by our shared ambition: revolutionize manufacturing and transform the way it is done to ensure smooth operations.

Become part of an amazing journey and successfully accompany our customers in their Digital Factory efforts!

Your Role & Key Responsibilities as a IIoT & Business Data Analyst

Joining our customer value analytics team as a data analyst means you'll be an essential part of further developing FactoryPal's analytics product. Together with our experienced data analysts, you'll work on the following topics:


Data Transformation and Analysis:

Generate key insights into customer data by extracting, cleaning, and transforming data from our Snowflake data warehouse using dbt.
Create and maintain data pipelines to ensure accurate and timely data delivery.
Explore large datasets to identify patterns, trends, and anomalies to tell stories with data.



Business Intelligence (BI) Reporting:

Work with Tableau to create insightful reports and dashboards.
Visualize complex data in a user-friendly manner, enabling stakeholders to make informed decisions.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand reporting requirements and deliver actionable insights.



Stakeholder Management & Product Development

Understand and identify the analysis and reporting needs of key customer contacts and internal stakeholders
Derive and communicate insights into customersâ€™ machine and business data.
Contribute with your experience to our product development process and thereby enhance FactoryPalâ€™s analytics solution.


Your Experience & Skills


Bachelor or Masterâ€™s degree in a relevant field (e.g., Computer Science, Data Science, Industrial Engineering, STEM or related fields)
>2 years experience in data analysis, modeling and reporting in a relevant environment - ideally in the industrial / manufacturing sector
Strong analytical mindset and a passion for working with data
Proficiency in SQL and relational databases (first experience with dbt is a plus)
Solid knowledge of Python for data analytics
Experience with Business Intelligence Tools (ideally Tableau)
Familiarity with version control systems (e.g., Git) for managing code and collaboration
Ideally first experience in development of an analytics product using agile methods
Excellent communication skills and ability to collaborate effectively within our team
Willingness to take ownership of tasks and seek solutions independently
Your English is fluent


What You Get


Opportunity to work in a well-funded corporate Start-Up with a competitive advantage derived from market access.
Exposure to the hottest IT technologies, like AI/ML, Cloud and Industrial IoT
Challenging role with lots of opportunities to grow fast & steadily - as an expert and as an entrepreneur
Development opportunity in a group of professionals, who joined from top tier start-up, industry and consulting companies and an education from top tier universities
Offices in prime working locations and technology hotspots such as Berlin and Porto.
Hands-On shopfloor experience in the manufacturing environment with travel opportunities - local and global.
An agile, inspiring, multi-cultural, multi-disciplinary and innovative work environment.
A competitive salary & benefits package - incl. 30 days vacation and dedicated training budget.


Are you interested?

Join our team and send us your detailed application documents via the "Apply" button.

Title: Senior Data Analyst and Engineer
Description:
We are working with a leading German educational technology business to help them hire a Senior Data Analyst and Engineer. They are well established and the market leader particularly in the maths learning space, and their products are used by millions of children across Europe on a daily basis. This is a business with an incalculable social impact, their maths learning platforms enable the next generation to improve their maths, science, technology and engineering skills and become the Data Analysts and Engineers of tomorrow.

Industry

OQ-industries EdTech

What To Expect

You will join a small, central data team that is responsible for all data oriented activities of the business, such as data infrastructure, analytics, data science and reporting topics. You will be the primary Data Analyst in the team, working mostly on product analytics topics to enable the product teams to know how their products are performing and conducting experiments to understand how well children can learn from the learning platforms they use. Outside of this youâ€™ll get the chance to work on data modelling, analytics engineering. They have huge flexibility where one day you can work on business-facing reporting, one day work with Python and the next with DBT. If you are a data generalist then this is the role for you.

Perks


Work in a product space with HUGE and genuine social impact
Get unrivalled flexibility and role where you can really explore your interests within data
A mature remote policy. They won't ask you to come to the office for the sake of it but only for team events or key meetings.
When you do go to the office you'll go somewhere fully kitted out, located in the heart of Kreuzberg.


Requirements

Requirements:


4+ Years in the Data space with at least 2 working as a Data Analyst
Experience in Data Engineering or Analytics Engineering topics
You are not just an expert in SQL but are pretty handy with Python too
You are proactive and are not looking for clear role distinctions, but thrive in a flexible and trusting environment


Sounds good? Apply now
Show more

Title: Data Engineer (m/w/d)
Description:
Ihre Aufgaben


You design a robust and simple data platform
You build ETL pipelines to import, clean, and process data
You build dashboards to support business decisions and operations
You host and use ML Models (when necessary) for performing tasks such as Image-to-Text conversion, Predictions, etcâ€¦
You take care of our data aggregation


Ihr Profil


You have experience in designing and building ETL pipelines and familiarity with multiple technologies in this area
You have extensive experience in building and maintaining Data Lakes and Data Warehouses
You are familiar with cloud providers such as GCP and AWS
You have proficiency in storage solutions like BigQuery, PostgreSQL, and object storage solutions (S3 or GCS)
You are experienced in working with Kafka, Python, Jupyter Notebooks, and Airflow
You know all about data governance, security, and privacy regulations
You have a high degree of self-motivation and self-organization


Warum wir?


Attractive remuneration package
30 vacation days
Flexible further training opportunities
Broad network of mentors that we make available to you
Team offsites
Flexible working from our office or mobile
More impact is not possible: through your work you contribute to saving millions of tons of CO2 in the world and also help the state to live up to its role as a role model again and save money in the process

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
In partnership with an established heavy industries company, we are searching for a Data Engineer on a freelance 6 month basis.




Role: Data Engineer
Location: Dusseldorf/Berlin
Duration: 6 months (renewable) // 2 year project
Flexible Hybrid Working - Occasional Travel
Start Date: Aug/Sept




Responsibilities:

Assist in the design and maintenance of data pipelines using Databricks, ensuring data is readily available
Design and implement data models and schemas in Databrick to support business intelligence and analytics needs
Ensure the continuous monitoring and improvement of the data pipelines, optimising performance




Profile:

6+ years of professional experience in data engineering, with a focus on big data technologies
Technical proficiency in databricks (Databricks SQL, Delta Lake and MLFlow)
Strong programming language skills in Python & SQL
Worked in cloud environment (AWS, Azure, GCP, with a preference on Azure and Azure Databricks)
Familiarity with data warehousing concepts and tools (e.g., Snowflake, Redshift, BigQuery) is a bonus
Fluent English




If the role is of interest, and you would like to find out more, please apply directly.

Show more

  • Start Date: Aug/Sept

  • Assist in the design and maintenance of data pipelines using Databricks, ensuring data is readily available
  • Design and implement data models and schemas in Databrick to support business intelligence and analytics needs
  • Ensure the continuous monitoring and improvement of the data pipelines, optimising performance

Title: Data Engineer (f/m/d)
Description:
remote - Germany, Spain, Czech Republic, Portugal, Slovakia or Austria | Full-time | Start ASAP

About us ðŸš€

We accelerate the growth of digital companies by providing tailored funding solutions and data-driven financial insights. Our mission is to refine capital for economies to come. We want to enable every company to access funding that'll help them to thrive.

As a product- and tech-driven company we are founded by a team of experienced fintech entrepreneurs. We are backed by Tier 1 venture capital investors that have also backed the likes of Stripe, Trade Republic, Telegram, Monday.com and Sorare.

Our values ðŸ’ªðŸ¼

We value flat hierarchies, full ownership and responsibility. Trust and open, honest communication are crucial to us, as it makes everything else easier. We work together and grow as a team.

Focus on Execution: We love and live off great ideas, but to create value we need to focus on execution.

Don't Fear Failure: We know that failure is an innate part of learning and success, so we value these experiences and take them as opportunities to try again and get better.

Trust Your Team: We trust our peers to do their best to achieve our shared goals, support each other and share their feedback so we can all grow and develop.

Your contribution to our success ðŸ¤“


You will write production-grade Python code for data applications that will be directly integrated into re:cap's platform
You will collaborate with our backend team (working mostly with Go) to ensure our solutions are successfully implemented from end-to-end
You will interface with different teams to gather business requirements and prototype solutions (e.g., Streamlit applications or Python scripts)
You will build pipelines to move data from various third-party sources into re:cap's data warehouse in Google BigQuery
You will maintain our data warehouse and ensure our data transformations are efficient and well structured using dbt and SQL


Who we are looking for ðŸ•µðŸ½â€â™€ï¸


You have 2+ years of experience in data engineering, with a background that enables you to iterate quickly on your solutions.
Your attention to detail ensures that the data you provide supports critical business decisions accurately
You're comfortable wearing multiple hats, from supporting the finance department with data analysis to building data pipelines and deploying data applications
You can effectively communicate complex topics to non-technical audiences and translate their requirements into code
Experience with tech-driven and distributed companies is a plus
You have a valid EU work permit and reside within the EU. re:cap does not offer visa or relocation support at the moment


Our tech stack ðŸ‘©ðŸ½â€ðŸ’»


Programming languages: Python, SQL and Go
Data ingestion: Airbyte
Data transformation: dbt
Data warehouse: Google BigQuery
Orchestration: Dagster
Analysis & reporting: Looker Studio, Streamlit
DevOps: AWS, GCP, Docker, Terraform, GitHub
Experience with our stack isn't a must


What you can expect ðŸª´


Remote first. Our team is located all over Germany and Europe, with the flexibility of 100% home office. However, if you are in Berlin you are more than welcome to come around the office and maybe even bring your furry friend ðŸ¶
Stock options. Every employee receives stocks, because our success is also your success
Development opportunities. Because we care about your growth, we have regular feedback talks as well as set paths for the development of each employee
The latest tech equipment. Every new team member receives an Apple MacBook Air to guarantee smooth productivity
Flexibility. We offer flexible working hours and value asynchronous communication as well. On top we offer 25 vacation days
Team building. Meet the team at in-person on-sites, get a buddy to fully integrate into the company and join other team events
Workation. Experience the blend of work and leisure with our worldwide new benefit catering to your work-away-from-home needs
International health insurance for business trips and workation. We prioritise your well-being and guarantee you comprehensive insurance cover, no matter where your travels take you
We care about security. You will receive 1password family membership
Choice. You get a monthly budget to finance a benefit of your choice


Even if not all of these points fit 100% we encourage you to apply! We hire also for attitude, not just for knowledge and are looking forward to hearing from you soon.

What comes after you apply? ðŸ§šðŸ½â€â™€ï¸

Easy steps for a smooth hiring process


Application Review
Get to know re:cap
Case study/Take home Assignment (depending on the position)
Role-specific Interview
Get to know the team
Offer


We are committed to foster a diverse and inclusive workplace where we provide equal opportunities regardless of age, gender identity, disability status, ethnicity, sexual orientation, or religion. Therefore we encourage you to apply as all qualified applications will be taken into consideration.

  • Get to know the team
  • Offer

We are committed to foster a diverse and inclusive workplace where we provide equal opportunities regardless of age, gender identity, disability status, ethnicity, sexual orientation, or religion. Therefore we encourage you to apply as all qualified applications will be taken into consideration.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
As a Data Engineer in the Data Analytics team, you will be crucial in ensuring we can bring together all relevant data from various sources in a reliable and scalable way, by contributing to the design and development of a global consumer data hub, assuming stewardship for data quality, consistency and usability of data.

Your responsibilities:


Developing and maintaining data models for a variety of use-cases and ensure consistency of definitions and data quality across Sonovaâ€™s group companies
Contribute to the development of the consumer data hub on Azure Infrastructure, in close collaboration with internal and external teams; continuously support the addition of new data sources
Coordinating with global BI and IT functions on engineering topics
Writing documentation for data pipelines, data sources, structures, and transformations
Working closely with the analysts (centrally and locally) to ensure data accessibility, reports automation and enable sharing of best practices



Your profile:


BS/MS/PhD in an IT, Mathematics, Science or Engineering discipline
3+ years of professional experience in data engineering field including building data pipelines
Experience in data lake and data warehouse modeling techniques
Experience with SQL (PL/SQL) and Python
Familiar with data ETL from a wide variety of data sources
Experience with SQL and NoSQL databases
Experience working with Microsoft Azure using relevant services such as Databricks, Data Factory, Synapse Analytics
Experience with pipeline and workflow management tools
Experience with code versioning, code review and documentation



We offer:

We can offer you a new challenge, with interesting tasks and much more â€“ including an open corporate culture, flat hierarchies, support for further training and development, opportunities to take on responsibility, an excellent range of foods, sports and cultural facilities, attractive employment conditions, and flexible working time models.

Sonova is an equal opportunity employer.

We team up. We grow talent. We collaborate with people of diverse backgrounds to win with the best team in the market place. We guarantee every person equal treatment in regard to employment and opportunity for employment, regardless of a candidateâ€™s ethnic or national origin, religion, sexual orientation or marital status, gender, genetic identity, age, disability or any other legally protected status.

Title: Data Engineer (m/f/d)
Description:
Are you skilled in the art of transforming raw information into strategic insights? Do you see yourself as a key player in building the foundations for a data-driven mindset transformation? Here at SoSafe, we might have the right position for you. Get ready to have a significant impact, establish the bases for our data architecture, and shape the future of our analytics infrastructure. Be part of one of the fastest-growing tech start-ups and become a Cyber-Security-Hero with us! Help us build the product that creates the Human Firewall within organizations.

Your mission



Embrace a culture of continuous learning and improvement, staying updated with industry trends and best practices while promoting innovation within your team.
Design, develop, and deploy data engineering solutions to address business challenges, managing the entire data lifecycle journey from ingestion to end-user reporting.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand requirements and translate them into scalable and efficient data solutions.
Build and maintain scalable data pipelines for extracting, transforming, and loading (ETL/ELT) data from various sources.
Contribute to deliveries within your team, ensuring that your work aligns with the goals of the domain and impacts organizational objectives effectively.
Prioritize quality in delivery by embracing aspects such as maintainability, complexity, testability, and progressive rollout mechanisms.
Identify and mitigate technical risks that may impact delivery, implementing incremental mitigation strategies over time.
Advocate for the right level of investment in solutioning and strive for robust implementations, providing reliable estimations and preventing system clutter.
Foster a collaborative mindset, encouraging cross-functional collaboration and empowering less experienced engineers to take ownership of their work.
Optimize the performance of data pipelines and processing systems to ensure reliability and scalability.
Stay up-to-date with the latest advancements in data engineering, evaluating new technologies and frameworks to enhance our data capabilities.
Contribute to research and development projects, driving innovation and influencing the direction of data engineering within the organization.
Communicate effectively with technical and non-technical stakeholders, presenting complex data concepts in a clear and concise manner.



Your profile



3+ years of experience designing, developing, and optimizing end-to-end data solutions in real-world applications.
Proficiency with stacks using technologies such as Python, AWS (DMS, Redshift), Java, Spark, Kafka, and SQL, along with expertise in data libraries and frameworks.
Passion for continuous growth and learning, embracing change, and proactively adapting to new requirements and environments.
Strong problem-solving skills with a structured and holistic approach to complex challenges.
Ability to identify and mitigate technical risks, ensuring on-time and safe delivery of new product capabilities.
Solid understanding of software engineering principles and effective design patterns suitable for different development scenarios.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, fostering teamwork and collaboration.
Proven track record of driving technical excellence, innovation, and continuous improvement within your team.
Fluent in English and optionally German.
You are a team player and open-minded for after-work socializing.



Why Us?

At SoSafe, you'll be part of a cybersecurity team that thrives on innovation, safeguarding organizations against evolving threats and making the digital world a safer place. You will have the opportunity to make a real impact, surrounded by a dynamic and supportive team and environment committed to your professional growth.

What we offer:

Work-Life Balance:



Flexible hours
33 vacation days
Daycare Support



Mobility Support:



Public Transport Subsidy
Swapfiets
EuroRad
Free Parking at HQ



Work Environment:



State-of-the-art tech
Annual company off-site
Networking events
Dog Friendly HQ



Healthcare:



OpenUp
Fitness First



Other Perks:



Company Pension Scheme
Corporate Discounts
Referral Bonus
Learning & Development Allowance



About Us

We are one of the fastest-growing security awareness scale-ups worldwide. By putting people first and focusing on behavioral science, we are disrupting the status-quo of Cyber Security.

Backed by strong VC funding by those such as Highland Europe and Global Founders Capital, we are looking for more motivated team players who will assist us with our ambitious mission and international expansion. At SoSafe, you will take ownership for your work and your growth, taking your career to the next level! If you want to have an impact and are looking to contribute in meaningful ways within an open-minded environment that values diversity and community, SoSafe might just be the right place to work for you!

Are you our next Cyber Security Hero?

Come work with us in our HQ in Cologne, our offices in Amsterdam, Berlin, Paris or Lisbon or at our co-working locations in Dublin, Munich, London or Chemnitz.

Join us on our journey to make the digital world a safer place!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
The Role

At Deliveroo we have an outstanding data science organisation, with a mission to enable the highest quality human and machine decision-making. We work throughout the company - in product, business and platform teams - using analysis, experimentation, causal inference and machine learning techniques. We are uniquely placed to use data to help make better decisions and improve data literacy across Deliveroo.

We are looking for a Data Analyst that is passionate about metrics and telling the stories behind the data. We have several roles open across different teams (grocery, loyalty, restaurants). Data Analysts at Deliveroo report into our data science management team.

You will be a professional in insights storytelling, communication and visualisation and know how to create action from metrics. Crafting effective intelligent benchmarks, understanding performance, caring about data quality, enabling automation and creating phenomenal visualisations and stories are things that drive you.

What you'll be doing



Work closely with commercial stakeholders to create value and business impact through better data availability, visualisation and analysis
Discover, analyse, and interpret trends or patterns in complex datasets to perform ad-hoc analyses and deliver insights to the executive team and senior management
Understand key drivers of the business and provide data driven guidance on key levers
Identify and specify data needs and quality requirements and work closely with Analytics Engineers to ensure data is available, accurate and corresponds to the business needs
Consolidate and distribute best analytical practices from different teams and countries



Requirements



Experience identifying the root cause of problems, assessing risks/impacts and determining and implementing effective solutions.
A good understanding of querying in SQL and understanding of database structure - you'll be expected to be able to extract the data you need for your analysis.
Compelling story-telling skills, and an eye for powerful visualisations - you'll need to translate your findings for all levels of stakeholder (business and technical)
Good knowledge of Excel/GSheets - depending on the task, there is a good chance that this is where some of your exploratory analysis will take place. Being comfortable with pivot tables and functions will be essential.
Developer experience with a data visualisation tool (Looker, Tableau, Periscope)



Why Deliveroo

Our mission is to transform the way you shop and eat, bringing the neighbourhood to your door by connecting consumers, restaurants, shops and riders. . We are transforming the way the world eats and shops by making access to food and products more convenient and enjoyable. We give people the opportunity to buy what they want, as they want it, when and where they want it.

We are a technology-driven company at the forefront of the most rapidly expanding industry in the world. We are still a small team, making a very large impact, looking to answer some of the most interesting questions out there. We move fast, value autonomy and ownership, and we are always looking for new ideas.

Workplace & Benefits

At Deliveroo we know that people are the heart of the business and we prioritise their welfare. Benefits differ by country, but we offer many benefits in areas including healthcare, well-being, parental leave, pensions, and generous annual leave allowances, including time off to support a charitable cause of your choice. Benefits are country-specific, please ask your recruiter for more information. This role in a Hybrid position.

Diversity

At Deliveroo, we believe a great workplace is one that represents the world we live in and how beautifully diverse it can be. That means we have no judgement when it comes to any one of the things that make you who you are - your gender, race, sexuality, religion or a secret aversion to coriander. All you need is a passion for (most) food and a desire to be part of one of the fastest-growing businesses in a rapidly growing industry.

We are committed to diversity, equity and inclusion in all aspects of our hiring process. We recognise that some candidates may require adjustments to apply for a position or fairly participate in the interview process. If you require any adjustments, please don't hesitate to let us know. We will make every effort to provide the necessary adjustments to ensure you have an equitable opportunity to succeed.

Please click here to view our candidate privacy policy.

Please click here to view our candidate privacy policy.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
payabl. empowers businesses to grow through payments innovation and banking services. Our ambition is to expand our strong portfolio of global financial services we provide to business and make them all available in one place on our platform we call payabl.one.

As a licensed financial company with principal membership with card schemes, we specialize in global payments and providing businesses with multi-currency accounts. With offices located in Frankfurt, Amsterdam, Limassol, and London, we are currently undergoing significant expansion and are looking for a Data Analyst to join our team. This role can be in one of our offices in Frankfurt, Limassol, Amsterdam, or London, it can also be remote anywhere in Europe.

This role is about:

The Data Analyst role is responsible for collecting, processing data of business information systems to discover useful information, suggest conclusions, and support decision-making. Furthermore you will identify challenges and opportunities within the organization and provide solutions that help achieve the business' goals. Strong technology, analytical and communication skills are must-have traits. You will be a driving force in data systems development, backing up suggestions with evidence.

You will:


Analyse data, outlining challenges, opportunities and solutions based on the internal and external data
Filtering the data, handling missing values, and preparing the dataset for analysis to ensure accuracy and relevance
Use statistical tools and techniques to explore and analyze data, identifying patterns, relationships, and trends
Create visual representations of data findings through charts, graphs, and dashboards to make the data understandable at a glance
Prepare reports and presentations to communicate the insights and findings from the data to stakeholders, which can influence policy and decision-making processes
Work with other departments to understand their data needs and help them make informed decisions based on data insights



What we need:


Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
Excellent at presenting data analysis insights to any type of audience in a clear and actionable way
Have a sense of ownership and assume end-to-end responsibility in everything you do
Experience working with senior decision makers
Conduct data analysis with Python (Pandas, Matplotlib, SciPy), SQL, Excel
Experience with data visualization tools (Power BI, Tableau or Qlik) and databases (PostgreSQL, BigQuery, Apache Druid)
Ability to automate data reports, ensuring efficiency and accuracy in data delivery
Familiarity with tools and software that enable scheduling and automatic generation of reports (e.g., cron jobs, Apache Airflow, Microsoft Power Automate)
Experience with Event Tracking, conceptualizing product events, and product analytics tools (Amplitude, Google Analytics, Matomo, etc.)



The perks of being a payabler:


ðŸš— Drive in Style: After your probation, a sleek company car is all yours.
Future-Proof Your Finances: Jump on board, and after your probation period, we'll kickstart your Provident Fund
ðŸŒ± Grow Without Limits: Our environment is all about nurturing your talents and fueling your ambition with endless opportunities for professional development.
Speak Like a Local: Greek language classes, offered twice a week for all team members.
ðŸ’³ Shop and Save: Get exclusive access to a discount card at various local businesses.
ðŸŒThrive in a multicultural workplace that celebrates diversity and values your unique contributions. Here, every perspective is appreciated, and every voice is heard.
Lead the Charge in Pioneering Projects: Be at the forefront of innovation by playing a key role in groundbreaking projects.
ðŸ Max Out Your Downtime: With 25 days off plus public holidays, and an extra 10 days for when you're under the weather, we make sure you have ample time to relax, recharge, and return brighter.
ðŸ“š Support for Your Educational Aspirations: We're here to support your educational pursuits because we believe in investing in your growth.
ðŸ” Wolt Your Way Through Lunch: Enjoy a Wolt lunch allowance of â‚¬150 per month


Ready to Join Us?

Let's embark on a journey to redefine the landscape of payments together. We're not just offering a role; we're inviting you to be a part of something bigger. Join our team, and let's innovate, disrupt, and lead the future of payments. Together, we can make an impact that resonates. Welcome to the team!

If this role seems like a good match, please submit your resume all applications are treated with the strictest confidentiality. Please note that we may keep your CV for a period of one (1) year for future relevant job opportunities. For more information about how we process your data please see our privacy policy at https://www.payabl.com/privacy-policy

Title: Insights Analyst
Description:
Since our launch in 2009, PureGym has been pioneering the model for affordable, flexible, high-quality gyms and our mission to inspire a healthier nation by helping more people in more places live healthier lives has led us to be the UK's favourite gym with over 380+ sites and many more to come. But our ambition hasnâ€™t stopped there, and our international expansion has seen us become a leading international operator with 150+ clubs in Denmark, 40+ clubs in Switzerland and new openings in the USA, Saudi Arabia and UAE.

We are driven by the passionate people of PureGym, who create brilliant environments for our members and the communities we serve. Our unique "Everybody Welcome" approach provides a friendly, warm and welcoming environment for our members and our ambition to double in size over the next few years gives a great opportunity for our teams to grow and accelerate their careers.




Role Purpose

We are a value business, focused on making gyms and fitness accessible to as many people as possible. Data is at the heart of how we run our business, starting from where to open our gyms, through what we offer within them through to how we engage with past, current, and future members. Combining the data from our over 2 million members with data about locations, operations, and performance allows us to unlock industry leading insights and drive a better member experience and commercial performance.

As an Insights Analyst you will be at the heart of solving some of the hardest data challenges in the business, turning data into insights and business value through a combination of in-depth analysis and reporting creation. You will be leveraging one of the biggest fitness data assets in the world to help determine what drives member behaviour and experience and commercial outcomes across all our operating geographies.




The Job

As a small, agile team, Insights works closely with its stakeholders, putting data at the heart of decision making across the business. While reporting to the Insights Manager, the role works closely with stakeholders across the business in addition to the wider Insights and Analytics functions, which also contains Data Science and Data Engineers.

In this role, you will have the opportunity to:

Work on analytics projects and reporting, identifying outcomes and communicating findings and recommendations to stakeholders across the business.
Work closely with the Commercial, Finance, Operational and Marketing teams, in addition to Data Science and Data Engineering.
Drive continuous improvement to how we enable data driven decision making in PureGym.
Work with Azure Databricks and PowerBI technology, leveraging modern cloud-native technologies and data lakehouse architecture.




About you

We would expect some or all of the following:

Experience in data analytics / insights
Proficient with SQL, Excel and PowerPoint
Experience with data visualisation platforms (PowerBI preferred but not required)
A drive and to turn insights into compelling stories for stakeholders to understand, for them to make more effective, data-led decisions
Strong commercial awareness with an interest in B2C

We are looking for an ambitious individual with a passion for leveraging analytics to drive business outcomes. The following core attributes are essential:

Excellent problem-solving: someone who enjoys applying their mind to many and varied business problems and be a driving force behind solving them
Innovative and curious: constantly seek to learn and find new and better ways of doing things; not just solving problems but seeking them out; always interested to find new and better methods and technologies
Biased towards action: take the initiative and get things done under their own steam and in collaboration with others
Collaborative: driven to engage with colleagues from across the business and support and enable your team members
A great communicator: able to translate complex concepts and analyses into digestible recommendations that can be easily interpreted and acted upon

Show more
