Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About Rapp

We stand up for individuality. We actively foster an inclusive workplace where diversity and individual difference are valued and leveraged to achieve the agencyâ€™s vision. And most importantly we value every individualâ€™s wellbeing.

As a diversity champion, equal opportunities and disability confident employer and an ardent advocate of flexible working we understand that everyone has unique requirements and needs.

We are a global creative agency, but the individual really is at the heart of everything we do. We use data to find out what makes them tick. We use technology to talk to them one-to-one â€“ but to one million at a time. And we use creativity to encourage them to engage, click, buy and bond, again and again.

Each brand is unique and has its own individual challenges. We pride ourselves in rising to each and every one of them, for brands such as KFC, Mercedes Benz, IKEA, Paypal and Virgin Media 02.

Us

In order to foster collaboration and relationships, our hybrid model requires three office days per week. As equal opportunities proponents, we are open to discuss any hybrid working related needs during the initial screening.

Learning and Development is important. We all know that. Its why we have a dedicated Learning and Development team and offer regular career conversations and bespoke L&D programmes so that you can leave us with more than when you started.

We recognise that the work of diversity, equity and inclusion calls on all of us. Thatâ€™s why we set up The Neighbourhood. A collective of people, at different stages of the DE&I journey, whether impacted or allies, dedicated to helping our colleagues take ownership and effect change across 4 key pillars; Anti-racism, Disability, Gender & LGBTQ+ and Parents & Carers.

The Health and Wellbeing of our people matters immensely. We offer Coaching opportunities for all through our partnerships with Sanctus (mental health partner who provides online coaching; you can talk about anything, personal or professional) and Sayge (1:1 professional development coaching program). We have 40 trained Mental Health First Aiders across the agency and have Babylon Health (Private GP service) for all.

Youâ€™re better at work when you feel better in yourself. So, in addition to your annual holiday, you can take a â€œMeâ€ day and an â€œUsâ€ day, every year. Your â€œMeâ€ day is for you to invest in yourself â€“ go after a life goal, meditate, learn to paint, bake cakes or just have a duvet day watching Netflix!

Your â€œUsâ€ day is all about giving back and helping others â€“ volunteer, pick litter at a local park, hang out with the elderly or raise money for a local charity.

Weâ€™re progressive and always open to new initiatives, for example weâ€™ve recently partnered with Fertifa (Leading Fertility and Reproductive Health benefit providers). Because we know the journey to becoming a family isnâ€™t always easy (that includes men too), and we support our people through that journey whether you are new parent, experiencing the menopause, or anything else in between.

Whatever stage of life you are at, we make sure you have the tools you need to have a healthy work life balance.

US MARKETING SCIENCES

The Marketing Sciences team at RAPP is a driving force behind the agency's success, harnessing the power of data and technology. We are superconnectors, bridging the gap between creativity, data and tech to unlock limitless possibilities and disruption.

Our mission is to provide deep insights and a true robust understanding of our clients' businesses and marketing challenges. Our expertise is to empower our agency and the client to make data-driven decisions that directly impact performance and drive measurable results.

From identifying the untapped value of client data to expanding its potential through data capture, rigorous analysis, and statistical techniques, we leave no stone unturned. We are split into 4 disciplines in Marketing Sciences; Data Science, Data Analytics, Data Enablement and Data Visualisation to enable us to deliver against any client data driven challenge.

Together, we will revolutionize the way data is utilised, ensuring that every action we take contributes to the success of our clients and propels the agency forward. Welcome to a future where data and technology and your ideas push the boundaries of what's possible.

Your Role

In the Data Analytics team you will ensure both the voice of the customer and CFO are represented in the room with hard evidence. As well as supporting exceptional customer experiences using data, you will help ensure every action we take is directly improving performance against your clients objectives.

As an Analyst, you will work under supervision to deliver projects within set deadlines, utilising your strong hands on analytical capabilities. Your strengths in Python and SQL will ensure you can efficiently deliver robust analytics with guidance from your team.

Your experience with web and social analytics tools (GA / Adobe / Brandwatch / Sprinklr) and data visualisation tools (Power BI / Tableau / Looker / etc) will enable you to uncover key insights across channels and create self-service dashboards.

You will be comfortable working as part of a team with supervision from seniors, whilst being able to execute analysis independently.

Whilst no two days will look the same, youâ€™ll be sharing findings back to more senior members of the team to shape for articulation to clients.

Under the guidance of senior members of the team you support answering strategic questions using data and forge an understanding of how to deliver personalisation at scale.

In Data Analytics you wonâ€™t be expected to build advanced segmentations and data science models, but you will develop an understanding of the art of the possible with data science, the necessary data required to fuel models and an ability to spot where a business challenge would be best supported through automation or leveraging the latest modelling techniques.

You will have a developing interest with the omni-channel landscape and be able to develop a strong understanding of how to capture and utilise data across channels, from creating tagging and taxonomy to measurement with web analytics tools.

Once you join the team, you will be onboarded to our product suite and playbooks and be capable of articulating and following these best-in-class approaches.

The ideal candidate is ready to jump in. Find problems. Fix them. Build relationships. Stay up-to-date with the latest innovations. Do whatever it takes to go above and beyond. And stand up for individuality.

Your Responsibilities

Management


You will be mentored to understand how to become a manager
You will follow the direction of your line manager and manage upwards when needed


Client


Understanding clientsâ€™ objectives, their business and KPIs and step change their businesses through the power of data
Deliver and understand the role of the work briefed to you
Challenge the briefs and ambition of the work
Build relationships with analysts client side
Support the creation of best-in-class, statistically significant, measurement and reporting
Collaborate in a results-driven, test, learn and optimisation culture for the client
Communicate analytical outputs
Ensure deliverables are completed on time and learn to deliver presentation quality
Follow robust, scalable and efficient processes for delivery

New Business / PR


Be aware of our new business pitches and work we are doing
Participate in thought pieces / case studies / award entries showing off your work to the industry


Network


Understand our network and other players within it


Evolution


Focus on your constant evolution - Show a desire to learn and develop core analytical skills
Understand your strengths and weaknesses and train accordingly


Your Skills And Experience


Bachelorâ€™s Degree in a quantitative subject (Statistics, Mathematics, Economics) or Social Sciences, with heavy emphasis on quantitative methods; Masterâ€™s degree or PHD is a plus. Degree will not be required with appropriate work experience.
1 â€“ 2 years of relevant experience in marketing analytics, customer experience insights, performance optimization, ideally in a marketing agency or management consulting practice.
You will be expected to have an understanding and with guidance utilise our core technical skills:
Core analytical languages and software (Excel, SQL, Python, Alteryx)
Statistics
Data Visualisation tools (Power BI / Tableau / Looker / etc)
Web and Social Analytics (GA / Adobe / Brandwatch / Sprinklr)
Value engineering / Business casing
Performance Measurement and Measurement Frameworks
Data Protection / GDPR
Customer journey analysis and planning
Brief planning and writing
Progressive data capture
Segmentation and Modelling
Martech design and ecosystem tracking (tagging and taxonomy)
Developing knowledge of experimental / multivariate test design techniques.
Growing knowledge of 1st, 2nd and 3rd party data
Confident, conscientious, self-starter, a good work ethic, and capable of building good working relationships with clients as well as other team members.
Naturally curious, imaginative and have a practical approach to problem solving.
Experience jumping in, finding problems across data and process, and fixing them.
Ability to work independently as well with a team in an agile and fast environment.
Ability to develop, learn, follow and adapt repeatable processes or products to drive efficiency and consistency of delivery.


Recruitment process

Weâ€™re not a 9 stage interview process agency. We like to keep recruitment swift, lean and individual and find that 2 or 3 stages gives all parties the opportunity to get to know each other. Plus we have a team on hand to answer questions throughout the process.

We are RAPP. And we canâ€™t wait to meet you

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst

Â£35,000 - Â£40,000 + 10% bonus + benefits

London (2 days per week in the office)




Our client




Our client is a global strategic technology and payments partner. They deliver seamless personalised shopping experiences to over 29m international shoppers, who in turn generate â‚¬22.9bn revenue.




With 2,000 employees spread across 50 countries, they integrate with 300,000 point of sale systems in a number of luxury retailers and brands including Harrods, Selfridges, John Lewis, Libertyâ€™s, Apple, Cartier, De Beers, HermÃ¨s, Rolex, Dior and Jimmy Choo.




Their products include tax-free shopping, smart data and intelligence, marketing and sales, POS technology and payment solutions.




The role




The Data Analyst will help the business to understand customer needs and behaviours through the analysis of complex data sets and subsequent translation into meaningful, shareable insights and stories.




This role will be hands on with building visualisations in Tableau and ad hoc analysis (using SQL) to inform the optimisation of products and features.




As a Data Analyst, you will:




Monitor and report on key KPIs.
Deep-dive (using SQL) into customer data to provide product teams with detailed customer analysis.
Be hands-on with building visualisations in Tableau.
Identify data requirements, working with international data teams to ensure data is cleansed and prepared.
Support with the identification of new and innovative ways to leverage data to deliver new customer engagement opportunities, optimise channels and deliver economic efficiency.
Deliver enhanced customer profiling and segmentation.
Measure the effectiveness of customer-facing products, features and campaigns.
Provide ad-hoc analysis to inform the optimisation of customer-facing products, features and campaigns.
Advise on how advanced statistical and analytical techniques can further improve the understanding of customers.




To apply, you should have




Experience working as a Data Analyst with good exposure to statistical methodologies.
Intermediate SQL skills.
Advanced experience with Tableau (or a similar tool).
Advanced Excel skills.
Proven experience delivering impactful and actionable insights with a B2C environment.




The perks include




25 days holiday + bank holidays.
An extra day off for moving to a new house; 2 days off for your wedding; 3 days off for charity / community days.
Private healthcare and medical cashback plan.
Perkbox.
Competitive pension plan.
Virgin gym membership.

Match Digital specialises in connecting talented individuals with businesses in the digital, tech, media and marcomms industries.

Title: Business Data & Reporting Analyst
Description:
Our client, a leading independent academic and professional publisher, is seeking a Business Data and Reporting Analyst to support their Hybrid and Open Access journalsâ€™ editorial function. This role involves developing and delivering analytics and reporting solutions that transform data into actionable insights.




Business Data & Reporting Analyst: Key responsibilities




Implement, manage, maintain, and develop existing reports and dashboards across the Journals Editorial function
Quickly acquire a good understanding of the critical data sources regarding availability, integrity, complexity and ownership to ensure reports and analyses are complete, consistent and understood
Troubleshoot, resolve and drive improvement to existing reporting and data visualisations, with a keen interest in automation
Effectively prioritise and manage multiple data-focused requests through delivery with a high degree of accuracy and on time completion
Help evaluate acquisitions of new third-party data sources and assist in implementing and using these sources to achieve business benefits for Editorial







Business Data & Reporting Analyst: Skills/experience




A proven record of collaborative work with other highly skilled data analysts and data coordinators to produce and present clear reports and data visualisations that are user-friendly and accessible to stakeholders
Data analyst experience and applied critical thinking and analytical skills to solve real-world business problems
Knowledge of the journal publishing industry and an understanding of Open Access business models
Advanced experience with Microsoft Office 365 apps (including advanced skills in Excel and proficiency in Power BI, along with DAX, Power Query, and Excel Power Pivot), SQL, and API integrations
Good relationship management skills and confidence in dealing with people at all levels of the business




A competitive salary, bonus, and benefits package is offered.




Referral Scheme - Telfer Partners offer a referral reward if we fill this vacancy with someone you recommend. You can send us contact details of anyone you would like to recommend to enquiries@telferpartners.com.




Equality Policy - Telfer Partners is committed to upholding a professional and impartial recruitment process. HTML:
Our client, a leading independent academic and professional publisher, is seeking a Business Data and Reporting Analyst to support their Hybrid and Open Access journalsâ€™ editorial function. This role involves developing and delivering analytics and reporting solutions that transform data into actionable insights.


Business Data & Reporting Analyst: Key responsibilities


  • Implement, manage, maintain, and develop existing reports and dashboards across the Journals Editorial function
  • Quickly acquire a good understanding of the critical data sources regarding availability, integrity, complexity and ownership to ensure reports and analyses are complete, consistent and understood
  • Troubleshoot, resolve and drive improvement to existing reporting and data visualisations, with a keen interest in automation
  • Effectively prioritise and manage multiple data-focused requests through delivery with a high degree of accuracy and on time completion
  • Help evaluate acquisitions of new third-party data sources and assist in implementing and using these sources to achieve business benefits for Editorial



Business Data & Reporting Analyst: Skills/experience


  • A proven record of collaborative work with other highly skilled data analysts and data coordinators to produce and present clear reports and data visualisations that are user-friendly and accessible to stakeholders
  • Data analyst experience and applied critical thinking and analytical skills to solve real-world business problems
  • Knowledge of the journal publishing industry and an understanding of Open Access business models
  • Advanced experience with Microsoft Office 365 apps (including advanced skills in Excel and proficiency in Power BI, along with DAX, Power Query, and Excel Power Pivot), SQL, and API integrations
  • Good relationship management skills and confidence in dealing with people at all levels of the business


A competitive salary, bonus, and benefits package is offered.


Referral Scheme - Telfer Partners offer a referral reward if we fill this vacancy with someone you recommend. You can send us contact details of anyone you would like to recommend to enquiries@telferpartners.com.


Equality Policy - Telfer Partners is committed to upholding a professional and impartial recruitment process. Our Equal Opportunities policy ensures that all job applicants and employees are treated fairly and equally, regardless of their gender, sexual orientation, marital status, race, nationality, religion, age, disability, or union membership status.

Title: Data Analyst (SQL/EXCEL) GLOBAL SAAS!
Place: Kingston Upon Thames, England, United Kingdom
Description:
Are you a driven and recent IT Graduate with a strong passion for Data and Analytics? Do you have 1+ years of experience working as a Data Analyst? Are you looking for a real challenge? This company has been trading for 20 years!. Do you love data?

You will be joining a very well-funded SAAS software company who has recently received a HUGE CASH INJECTION! So it's now time to grow the Data team. APPLY NOW!!!

This is an amazing chance to join a progressive company with a long-term career on offer to move into Data Analysts, Data Engineering and to work for a GLOBAL SAAS Company who works with the S&P 500 companies to make a big impact!.

The Data Analyst must have at least 1+ years' experience. This is a great role for a second jobber!

Overall, the purpose of this role will be to maintain and ensure the quality of the data, ensuring timeliness of data availability.

This is a hand-on and fast paced role that requires pragmaticism and problem solving skills.

Key Responsibilities


Downloading and adding data into a global database
Data validation and correction using in-house applications, Excel and SQL Server Management Studio
Investigation of new patent data sources
Dealing with helpdesk support queries
Working with the development team regarding data extraction and application troubleshooting
Specification writing of new in-house applications
User Acceptance Testing of new in-house applications
Ensuring data quality with emphasis on attention to detail
Ensuring all data feeds are completed on time
Data source ownership and process reviews in order to improve speed, accuracy and automation opportunities


Person Spec


Good communication, detail orientated, methodical and numerate
Experience of querying databases using SQL Server
Excellent computer skills including Word and Excel
Excellent oral and written communication skills


Interviews will be arranged ASAP.

2 Stage process and quick turnaround.

Hybrid working 2 days in the office in South West London (excellent transport links including people who live close to the overground, district line, Piccadilly line and national rail) and 3 days from home. More flex on offer for the right person but this is a hybrid working role.

Excellent Benefits on offer

Pension

Bonus

25 days holidays +8 Bank Holidays

Robert Half Ltd acts as an employment business for temporary positions and an employment agency for permanent positions. Robert Half is committed to equal opportunity and diversity. Suitable candidates with equivalent qualifications and more or less experience can apply. Rates of pay and salary ranges are dependent upon your experience, qualifications and training. Robert Half do not ask candidates for a fee or request candidates to send applications through instant messaging services such as WhatsApp or Telegram. Learn how to protect yourself by visiting our website: roberthalf.com/gb/en/how-spot-recruitment-scams-and-protect-yourself

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We're hiring the very best data analysts to join our agile in-house team. You will be working on the fastest growing direct to consumer (e-commerce) brands and will have access to unlimited performance bonus.




What You'll Be Doing




Launch and optimize social, native and search advertising campaigns
Improve Conversion Rate across multiple funnels - multivariant and A/B testing
Design new funnels and analyse granular data using proprietary data warehouse
Manage unlimited budget while staying profitable. Compensation is directly correlated to your personal campaign performance and paid monthly
Optional managerial roles available




What You'll Need




Results-driven and numbers-oriented personality
High attention to detail
Flexibility and adaptability
Commitment to innovations




A little about us




We're passionate about building life changing consumer products and delivering them with astonishing service. We are also one of the UK's fastest growing direct to consumer companies.




The Benefits




Salary above market
All the latest tech you need
Pension plan

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst (SQL / PowerBI) | Â£40,000 - Â£50,000 | 4 Days / Per Week (West London)




Here at Burns Sheehan, we have partnered up with a well-established name in the UK market for over 20 years who have just been bought out by an experienced leader in the gambling industry as they look to invest heavily within growth and explore International Markets.




As a result, they are looking for a Data Analyst to join the team and report into the Head of Analytics as one of the 1st key hires in this initial growth phase. In this role you will be responsible for taking over the curation and development of a suite of Power BI reports, which are used across all areas of the business to help drive strategy and run the day to day mechanics of the organisation.

2 + Years experience within Data Analysis
Proficient in SQL / T-SQL and PowerBI (Potentially Tableau)




With a two-decade presence in the UK, this company has a proven track record of success and customer loyalty this an amazing time to join as the companies goes from strength to strength. If you are a Data Analyst with excellent experience across both SQL and PowerBI feel free to apply and I will get back to you accordingly !!!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Department: Engineering

Location: London, UK

Compensation: Â£30,000 - Â£50,000 / year

Description

White Swan Data is a small but rapidly growing team of mathematicians, data scientists and software engineers who are constantly striving to refine world class betting models while also researching and deploying new ones. Our work bridges three domains, each challenging in its own right - betting and gambling, quantitative research and software development.

We are seeking a talented Data Analyst, well-versed in the R programming language, who can pull actionable insights out of large data sets. As a member of the team, you will be working on a variety of different projects and collaborating with the team to ensure we deliver to our clients needs.

We will consider graduate applicants if we feel your degree has equipped you with the necessary skills to further develop in this role.

Key Responsibilities


Dive into diverse datasets to extract meaningful patterns, trends, and insights.
Cleanse and process data to ensure accuracy and reliability in analysis.
Utilise statistical methods to interpret and validate findings, contributing to data-driven decision-making.
Develop comprehensive reports to communicate findings effectively to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Stay updated on the latest industry trends, tools, and techniques in data analytics.
Implement and maintain data quality assurance processes to ensure the reliability of analytical outputs.


Requirements

Must Have -


Proficiency in the R programming language, ideally ggplot2, tidyverse and data.table.
Advanced spreadsheeting skills, ideally google-sheets and Excel.
A passion for data analytics and a desire to translate complex data into actionable insights.
A Bachelor's degree in a data-oriented subject (statistics, econometrics, economics etc) and/or several years of highly relevant experience in data analysis using the above software.


Desirable -


Previous experience using the SQL/Sequel programming language.
Experience in creating compelling visualisations using tools like Tableau, PowerBI, or Grafana software.
Experience of data manipulation, management and reporting.
Adept at solving analytical problems with attention to detail.
Excellent communication skills with the ability to convey technical findings to non-technical audiences.
Collaborative mindset with the ability to work effectively within a team.
A passion and understanding of sports and sports betting markets/odds.


Benefits


Competitive salary depending on experience.
Annual discretionary performance bonus.
25 days holiday per annum, plus UK bank holidays.
Private health & dental insurance.
Pension plan.
Complimentary gym membership
Regular team events/socials.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst Trainee
Description:
Are you looking to benefit from a new career in Data Analysis?

If you are detail orientated, perceptive, organised, competent, analytical and can communicate well with those around you; you could have a truly rewarding future as a Data Analyst

We do this using our specialised Data Analyst career programme which looks to assist and place qualified candidates into a career pathway in Data Analysis.

Please note this career program is designed for entry level individuals with limited or no experience, so please do not apply if you are already an experience Data Analyst as we will be looking primarily at entry level roles.

Demand for Data Analysts has grown 20% year on year with experienced analysts easily commanding salaries of Â£50k+. All business decisions rely on data to ensure correct business decisions are made and therefore the role of the data analyst in the new digital world has become essential for business owners.

Below are current average salaries in the sector for lower-level positions and fully trained Data Analysts:


Junior Data Analyst - Â£30,000
Data Analyst - Â£50,000
Business Data Analyst - Â£67,500
Data Analytics Analyst - Â£80,000
Business Analysts - Â£60,000


Using our experience in providing data analysis and business analysis training online and through our expert recruitment consultants, we can provide a seamless journey and often fast-tracked route into a new career in Data Analysis.

The courses in the package have been identified by our recruitment partners as industry standards for the UK/European and International Data Analysis sector.

Skills shortages across all sectors are increasing the demand for qualified, entry-level career seekers and career changers.

Whether you are working full-time, part-time or are unemployed, this job and recruitment package has the flexibility to be completed at a pace that suits you and can be completed in a few weeks. Your job and career goals are completed in 4 easy steps listed below.

Step 1 - CompTIA Data+ Qualification

The first step is completing the CompTIA Data+ Qualification accredited by CompTIA.

This professional international industry-recognised qualification teaches you the essential skills of a Data Analyst. You will cover skills such as data mining, manipulating data, visualising data, and reporting on data.

Study time for the qualification is approximately 30 hours and qualification is achieved by completing a 1-hour multiple choice exam.

The course is provided online and comes complete with exam simulators and revision tools.

You will be provided with access to a tutor and a 1-hour online revision workshop prior to sitting your exam.

This qualification will set you on a route to becoming a data analyst.

Step 2 - Data Administration Training

Data is extracted using various method which are normally IT driven.

Therefore, we will provide you with access to the following additional courses to ensure you are suitably employable as a data analyst.


Microsoft excel - to expert level.
Learn SQL - the programming language used for extracting data from more complex databases.
Learn Python 3 - Python 3 is a simple to use programming language used by many analysts.
Learn Tableau - Tableu is a tool which analysts use to build visually appealing dashboards for complex data making it easier for stakeholders to comprehend.


Study time for these courses is approximately 30-60 hours and qualification is achieved through completion of the course with no exam.

Step 3 - Business Analysis Foundation

Business Analysts and Data Analysts often work very closely together and indeed many Data Analysts become Business Analysts and vice versa.

Adding a Business Analyst Foundation certificate will make you much more employable and enable you to cross over into business analyst roles and hybrid roles. Business Analysis Foundation accredited by the BCS (The British Computer Society also known as the Chartered Institute of IT).

Study time for this course is approximately 15 hours and qualification is achieved through an online BCS exam.

Step 4 - Recruitment Support

Now you are qualified for an entry level data analyst position our recruitment support team will now begin collaborating with you to help you secure your first a suitable role based on your new qualifications and any other experience you may have.

We have been helping candidates start and build careers in the project management industry since 2007 and have a 4.8 Trustscore on Trustpilot.

Our Recruitment Support team will help you work through job applications, interviews and provide you with a full cv review based around your new qualification and written to maximise your chances of obtaining a role in the project management sector.

They will provide you with guidance as to which roles our most suitable for you as an entry level project sector worker aiming to become a project manager. This will include mock job interviews as well as any help you feel you need.

Our money back guarantee

If after 1 year of passing your formal qualifications, we have been unable to help you secure a role, we will refund your study fees minus the cost of the exams.

However, we are normally able to help candidates find their first role within 6 months of qualifying and for locations based close to major cities this is often reduced to less than 3 months.

Check our testimonials from the hundreds of candidates we have already helped.

What Now?

To accommodate candidates, the training element of the package is available on finance terms of up to 1 year. This enables you to get qualified and start in your new role without having to fund all the training costs up front.

Enquire now and one of our experienced Career Consultants will contact you within 4 working hours to answer any questions that you may have and to assist you in taking the first step towards your Data Analyst Career aspirations.

Title: Data Analyst - up to Â£45,000 Bonus Benefits - Hybrid
Description:
Data AnalystSalary: up to Â£45,000 + Bonus + BenefitsLocation: 2/3 days onsite near London BridgeWorking Hours: 9am - 6pm with 1 hour for lunchContract: Permanent A rapidly growing client who is looking to expand their data function is looking to hire a Data Analyst to drive insights for their key products and shape product analytics. The Data Analyst will have the opportunity to increase their responsibilities, take ownership of projects and progress up the ladder.Data Analyst - Responsibilities:


Generate valuable insights for core products, including advanced deals, mobile applications, experimentation tools and identity protection features.
Utilising visualisation techniques to help present/explain product performance and key businesses insights
Partner closely with the product team to drive revenue generation, guide product evolution and inform key decisions.
Utilise technical expertise to process and analyse large-scale datasets, transforming complex data into meaningful insights for product teams.
Explore intricate data sets to uncover opportunities that enhance product performance and support the execution of strategic initiatives.
Use their centralised reporting system to aid in strategic decision-making and revenue optimisation.
Collaborate with product and data teams to create and sustain data models and performance metrics for new product experiments.


Data Analyst - Essential Skills


SQL - extract insights, write queries & manipulate data
Any data visualisation tool experience - creating dashboards & reports and commenting on trends


Data Analyst - Desirable Skills


Looker, BigQuery
A degree


If you are interested in working for a rapidly growing organisation who will give you the chance to grow and develop in the business, be influential in helping the data analytics function grow and work on key products then please apply in the immediate instance.

Data Analyst, Data Analytics, SQL, Tableau, Power BI, BigQuery, Looker

Please register your interest in this Data Analyst role by applying via this website. For more information on this role or other roles in the Business Intelligence market, reach out to Kathryn Self at Harnham.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Analyzes data, assesses trends and develops actionable insights and recommendations in support of business objectives. Trains and develops junior analysts.

Data Analyst

Walbrook, London

The opportunity

â€¯

The UK Personal Investor (UKPI) business relies on data and analytics to understand our clients and make business decisions to improve our clients' chances of investment success. This data and analytics support comes from the CDAO (Chief Data & Analytics Office) division in Europe - part of Vanguardâ€™s IT department. This division was created in 2023 after the launch of global CDAO to centralise data & analytics capabilities and transform how crew use data so that clients and investors can thrive.

Within the CDAO UKPI Data & Analytics team, weâ€™re looking for an experienced, collaborative and self-motivated data analyst, with a passion for data and understanding individual investors. Leveraging a universe of data through a data lake, you will work across multiple UKPI initiatives, delivering data capabilities to analyse data, assess trends and develop actionable insights and recommendations in support of business objectives. Day-to-day activities include building scripts, querying data, designing data visualisations (including dashboards), optimising data infrastructure, identifying automation opportunities, and collaborating with stakeholders across Product, Client Experience, Operations, Marketing, Finance, IT, and Architecture

This role plays a critical role in enabling UKPIâ€™s priorities, and is a great opportunity to embedded in a team that supports UKPIâ€™s long-term strategic vision.

In return we offer an attractive base salary, annual performance bonus paid in January, Partnership bonus paid in June, and competitive benefits. At Vanguard we work Monday to Friday and our staff in most roles work in the office on Tuesdays, Wednesdays and Thursdays, with Mondays and Fridays working from home. As one of the worldâ€™s largest asset management firms, Vanguard can offer unrivalled career opportunities in Manchester, the UK, and further afield.

In this role you will:



Collaborate with our UKPI partners and frame business problems to define analytical frameworks and approaches with a focus on business outcomes, to enable UKPI objectives.
Collect and prepare structured and unstructured data, and verify its quality, accuracy, and reasonableness.
Perform data analysis to surface trends and insights using analytical methods and connecting data sources.
Build advanced scripts in SQL and Python by connecting a series of databases in the UKPI data lake.
Design and deliver advanced self-serve capabilities, data visualisations (including Tableau and PowerBI dashboards) and internal presentations that translate analytic insights into tangible, actionable solutions for business and IT partners to implement.
Iterate on existing data assets and provide quick turnarounds to ad-hoc insight requests from stakeholders.
Deliver and manage the end-to-end lifecycle of data projects, working closely with technical and non-technical across departments and regions.
Own and optimise recurring analytic or reporting processes, including providing automation solutions.
Align with and evolve agile work management frameworks (including documentation).
Invest time in upskilling on technical data tools, concepts and frameworks, and share learnings with the team.â€¯
Train and develop junior analysts.



â€¯

What we are looking for:

Technical skills:



Strong experience in a data analyst/science role within the finance industry.
Bachelorâ€™s and/or Masters in a highly quantitative degree discipline (e.g. Mathematics, Statistics, Finance, Computer Science or Economics) desired.
Advanced SQL and Python to extract data from multiple sources, perform detailed analysis and automate processes.
Strong proficiency in building data visualisation dashboards in Tableau (PowerBI is also desirable).
Experience with AWS (particularly Athena, S2 and glue ETL).
Comfortable working in an Agile framework and using Agile tools (including JIRA).
Proven experience presenting complex data finding and concepts to business stakeholders of varying levels of data literacy.



Mindset & Behaviours:



Keen interest in analytics and data-driven decision making, demonstrating knowledge of how your role directly impacts the business and telling stories through data.
Ability to self-manage and self-motivate, with an ability to learn quickly, proactively deliver and communicate results, and take accountability for the teamâ€™s goals as if they were your own.
Ability to communicate effectively (verbal and written) with a range of cross-functional teams, including communicating technical concepts to non-technical audiences.
Proactivity to shape the teamâ€™s work, demonstrate situational adaptability and end-to-end knowledge of a product, collaborating with teams across departments and subdivisons.
Strong ability to engage with key work partners, encourage others to share diverse ideas, and drive engagement in the team by sharing expertise and being recognised as a trusted adviser.



About Vanguard

â€¯

We are Vanguard. Together, weâ€™re changing the way the world invests. For us, investing doesnâ€™t just end in value. It starts with values. Because when you invest with courage, when you invest with clarity, and when you invest with care, you get so much more in return. We invest with purposeâ€”and thatâ€™s how weâ€™ve become a global market leader. Here, we grow by doing the right thing for the people we serve. And so can you. We want to make success accessible to everyone. This is our opportunity. Letâ€™s make it count.

How We Work

Vanguard has implemented a hybrid working model for the majority of our crew members, designed to capture the benefits of enhanced flexibility while enabling in-person learning, collaboration, and connection. We believe our mission-driven and highly collaborative culture is a critical enabler to support long-term client outcomes and enrich the employee experience.

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Please note this is a hybrid role which will require attendance in our St Albans office at least once a week:

About The Role

Are you excited by what data can uncover? Do you have a natural ability to think analytically? Are you intrigued by the impact a website can have on an individualâ€™s decisions? We have the role for you!

Joining our Technology team, you will have the opportunity to demonstrate and further develop your data analysis skills in this brand-new role. The Junior Data Analyst role will suit a highly numerate and enthusiastic individual who will bring an analytical mindset, lateral thinking, and a fresh perspective.

Working closely with our Marketing team and other stakeholders across the business, the primary focus for the Junior Data Analyst will be to support the business in leveraging data analysis, identifying data-led opportunities, and creating data-driven insights for business decision-making.

To help you learn our systems, you will also be helping our testing team with some of our web testing work. We have found this to be a really effective way of initiating junior staff and helping you gain that all important system and database knowledge. You may also be called upon to conduct web testing on an ad-hoc basis on other occasions for example covering leave or when we may have a backlog of testing to complete.

You will ideally have had a minimum of 1 yearâ€™s experience in a similar role and we will also consider new graduates who can demonstrate a real passion for data and some experience of the key skills listed below.

Your main duties:

As a Junior data analyst we wonâ€™t be expecting you to do all of this from day 1! You will be fully supported to help you achieve these goalsâ€¦


Deliver actionable insight by collecting, analysing and interpreting business data to help drive informed business decisions.
Creating complex SQL queries to extract data for analysis from Microsoft SQL Server and MySQL databases using Microsoft SQL Server Management Studio and MySQL Workbench.
Helping the test team with functional web testing when required.
Analysing business performance to identify and implement areas for improvement and growth opportunities.
Collaborating on data analysis projects to measure and report web data and marketing performance. This will include using tools such as Google Analytics.
Developing and maintaining marketing analytics models to optimise campaigns and customer targeting.
Analysing customer behaviour and campaign performance to provide actionable insights and recommendations.
Making and extracting data-led recommendations for pieces of external content related to the property and legal services industries/Press Releases.
Creating data-driven dashboards and reports to communicate business insights to stakeholders using Power BI.
Continuously developing processes so that deliverables are created in the most efficient way to improve performance, using automation.


Education/qualifications

About you

We welcome candidates educated to degree level or equivalent in a numerate subject and those without a degree who can demonstrate a suitable level of knowledge and work experience.

Skills, Knowledge And Abilities


Confidence and solid experience using SQL to extract and analyse data
Ability to create reports and visualise data into charts and graphs using Power BI
You know how to use Excel with experience of creating formulae
An understanding of how relational databases work
Excellent attention to detail, numerical and analytical skills, and the ability to translate data into actionable insights.
Some awareness of the UK housing market and home moving
Demonstrable ability to clearly and concisely summarise data into consumable content (e.g. in PowerPoint) for a wide audience including senior leadership
Ability to manage multiple priorities, meet deadlines, and adapt to changing requirements in a dynamic environment.
A passion for data-driven decision-making, problem solving and a customer-centric mindset.
IT literate and competent with the Microsoft Office suite
Strong teamwork skills, time management, motivation, and ability to work autonomously.
Be enthusiastic to join a growing business and therefore be flexible to new demands.


Knowledge of any of the following would be advantageous:


More detailed knowledge of conveyancing, surveying types, Stamp Duty Land Tax, freehold, leasehold, shared ownership and other matters related to home moving in the UK.
Google Analytics (GA4)
Google Tag Manager (GTM)
Power Automate
Power Query


Motivation


Ability to work on own initiative
Willing to adapt and learn new skills
You will also feel at home with our values;
Customer obsessed: We start with the customer and work backwards
Ambitious: We think long term, we think big and we value calculated risk taking
Humble: We are vocally self-critical and respectfully challenge othersâ€™ opinions
United: We are one team
Weâ€™re people people: We care about our colleagues and the communities we live and work in


What can we offer you?


Discretionary annual bonus
25 days holiday per annum
Your birthday day off.
An extra dayâ€™s leave when you move house (per annum)
Up to 5 days of unpaid leave for those unexpected life events
Flexible approach to hybrid working
Enhanced Pension Scheme
Free unlimited book allowance for work-relevant publications
A very healthy annual training budget for use on courses, classes, qualifications or professional memberships. You decide how you can grow best
Employee Assistance Programme .
and much more as outlined on our careers page


What To Expect From Our Recruitment Process


Online HR interview approx. 45-60 minutes
Technical Test
Face to Face Interview - with hiring manager, Head of Technology and Head of Marketing - approx. 60 minutes

Title: Data Analyst Trainee
Description:
Are you looking to benefit from a new career in Data Analysis?

If you are detail orientated, perceptive, organised, competent, analytical and can communicate well with those around you; you could have a truly rewarding future as a Data Analyst

We do this using our specialised Data Analyst career programme which looks to assist and place qualified candidates into a career pathway in Data Analysis.

Please note this career program is designed for entry level individuals with limited or no experience, so please do not apply if you are already an experience Data Analyst as we will be looking primarily at entry level roles.

Demand for Data Analysts has grown 20% year on year with experienced analysts easily commanding salaries of Â£50k+. All business decisions rely on data to ensure correct business decisions are made and therefore the role of the data analyst in the new digital world has become essential for business owners.

Below are current average salaries in the sector for lower-level positions and fully trained Data Analysts:


Junior Data Analyst - Â£30,000
Data Analyst - Â£50,000
Business Data Analyst - Â£67,500
Data Analytics Analyst - Â£80,000
Business Analysts - Â£60,000


Using our experience in providing data analysis and business analysis training online and through our expert recruitment consultants, we can provide a seamless journey and often fast-tracked route into a new career in Data Analysis.

The courses in the package have been identified by our recruitment partners as industry standards for the UK/European and International Data Analysis sector.

Skills shortages across all sectors are increasing the demand for qualified, entry-level career seekers and career changers.

Whether you are working full-time, part-time or are unemployed, this job and recruitment package has the flexibility to be completed at a pace that suits you and can be completed in a few weeks. Your job and career goals are completed in 4 easy steps listed below.

Step 1 - CompTIA Data+ Qualification

The first step is completing the CompTIA Data+ Qualification accredited by CompTIA.

This professional international industry-recognised qualification teaches you the essential skills of a Data Analyst. You will cover skills such as data mining, manipulating data, visualising data, and reporting on data.

Study time for the qualification is approximately 30 hours and qualification is achieved by completing a 1-hour multiple choice exam.

The course is provided online and comes complete with exam simulators and revision tools.

You will be provided with access to a tutor and a 1-hour online revision workshop prior to sitting your exam.

This qualification will set you on a route to becoming a data analyst.

Step 2 - Data Administration Training

Data is extracted using various method which are normally IT driven.

Therefore, we will provide you with access to the following additional courses to ensure you are suitably employable as a data analyst.


Microsoft excel - to expert level.
Learn SQL - the programming language used for extracting data from more complex databases.
Learn Python 3 - Python 3 is a simple to use programming language used by many analysts.
Learn Tableau - Tableu is a tool which analysts use to build visually appealing dashboards for complex data making it easier for stakeholders to comprehend.


Study time for these courses is approximately 30-60 hours and qualification is achieved through completion of the course with no exam.

Step 3 - Business Analysis Foundation

Business Analysts and Data Analysts often work very closely together and indeed many Data Analysts become Business Analysts and vice versa.

Adding a Business Analyst Foundation certificate will make you much more employable and enable you to cross over into business analyst roles and hybrid roles. Business Analysis Foundation accredited by the BCS (The British Computer Society also known as the Chartered Institute of IT).

Study time for this course is approximately 15 hours and qualification is achieved through an online BCS exam.

Step 4 - Recruitment Support

Now you are qualified for an entry level data analyst position our recruitment support team will now begin collaborating with you to help you secure your first a suitable role based on your new qualifications and any other experience you may have.

We have been helping candidates start and build careers in the project management industry since 2007 and have a 4.8 Trustscore on Trustpilot.

Our Recruitment Support team will help you work through job applications, interviews and provide you with a full cv review based around your new qualification and written to maximise your chances of obtaining a role in the project management sector.

They will provide you with guidance as to which roles our most suitable for you as an entry level project sector worker aiming to become a project manager. This will include mock job interviews as well as any help you feel you need.

Our money back guarantee

If after 1 year of passing your formal qualifications, we have been unable to help you secure a role, we will refund your study fees minus the cost of the exams.

However, we are normally able to help candidates find their first role within 6 months of qualifying and for locations based close to major cities this is often reduced to less than 3 months.

Check our testimonials from the hundreds of candidates we have already helped.

What Now?

To accommodate candidates, the training element of the package is available on finance terms of up to 1 year. This enables you to get qualified and start in your new role without having to fund all the training costs up front.

Enquire now and one of our experienced Career Consultants will contact you within 4 working hours to answer any questions that you may have and to assist you in taking the first step towards your Data Analyst Career aspirations.

Title: Data Modelling Analyst
Description:
Job Title: Data Modelling Analyst

Job Position: Data Analyst

Location: Remote

Starting Salary: Â£27,000 - Â£35,000

About Us: Evolution HTD is an innovative hire, train, deploy organisation headquartered in Warrington, UK. We specialise in building data capabilities within the insurance sector. Our HTD Programme is a fixed 2-year commitment between Evolution and the data consultant, where customers have the option to hire the consultant permanently at the end of the agreed deployment period.

Why Evolution: ðŸ”¥ Dynamic Data Opportunities: Immerse yourself in hands-on experiences working directly with data projects for one or more organisations within our impressive client portfolio. Tackle challenging data visualisation projects that will enhance your skills, broaden your network, and equip you with the tools to excel in data analysis and deployment.

ðŸ“š Ongoing Data Learning: Your journey begins with intensive training in data technologies, but the learning is continuous. Over several years, you will engage in ongoing education, obtaining industry-recognised qualifications tailored to your abilities, including Data Analysis, Data Visualisation, Advanced Analytical Techniques, and more.

ðŸŽ“ Mentoring and Coaching: Thrive under the guidance of our seasoned data experts and Technical Trainers. Leverage their expertise to advance your career path in the data field.

Job Description:

Key Responsibilities


Catastrophe Management:
Run models to quantify the likelihood and severity of natural catastrophes
Process and interpret client exposure data for use in catastrophe models
Conduct sensitivity testing and provide event-response insights to clients
Collaborate with academic and industry partners to innovate solutions
Catastrophe Cyber:
Work with cyber insurance datasets and risk models
Develop and maintain global data sets and analytics offerings
Evaluate and validate cyber models
Manage client relationships and contribute to research efforts
Catastrophe Evaluation/Research:
Provide up-to-date information on natural catastrophes
Evaluate and validate catastrophe models
Test model sensitivities and validate components using third-party data
Analyze claims experience and quantify climate change impacts


Requirements


Experience: 1-3 years in data visualisation and/or business analysis roles, ideally within financial services
Skills and Requirements:
Analytical Skills: Strong logical thinking and problem-solving abilities
Attention to Detail: High attention to detail in data processing and analysis
Communication: Good communication skills, able to simplify complex ideas
Self-Starter: Initiative to work independently and collaboratively
Commercial Awareness: Understand and support clients with clarity and confidence
Technical Skills: Proficiency in programming (Python or R) is desirable
Project Management: Demonstrated ability to manage projects and coordinate activities across multiple departments
Soft Skills: Excellent communication, stakeholder management, and problem-solving skills. Ability to explain technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders
Education: Bachelor's degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Business Administration, or a related field, or equivalent experience

Job Title: Data Modelling Analyst

Job Position: Data Analyst

Location: Remote

Starting Salary: Â£27,000 - Â£35,000

About Us: Evolution HTD is an innovative hire, train, deploy organisation headquartered in Warrington, UK. We specialise in building data capabilities within the insurance sector. Our HTD Programme is a fixed 2-year commitment between Evolution and the data consultant, where customers have the option to hire the consultant permanently at the end of the agreed deployment period.

Why Evolution: ðŸ”¥ Dynamic Data Opportunities: Immerse yourself in hands-on experiences working directly with data projects for one or more organisations within our impressive client portfolio. Tackle challenging data visualisation projects that will enhance your skills, broaden your network, and equip you with the tools to excel in data analysis and deployment.

ðŸ“š Ongoing Data Learning: Your journey begins with intensive training in data technologies, but the learning is continuous. Over several years, you will engage in ongoing education, obtaining industry-recognised qualifications tailored to your abilities, including Data Analysis, Data Visualisation, Advanced Analytical Techniques, and more.

ðŸŽ“ Mentoring and Coaching: Thrive under the guidance of our seasoned data experts and Technical Trainers. Leverage their expertise to advance your career path in the data field.

Job Description:

Key Responsibilities

  • Catastrophe Management:
    • Run models to quantify the likelihood and severity of natural catastrophes
    • Process and interpret client exposure data for use in catastrophe models
    • Conduct sensitivity testing and provide event-response insights to clients
    • Collaborate with academic and industry partners to innovate solutions
  • Catastrophe Cyber:
    • Work with cyber insurance datasets and risk models
    • Develop and maintain global data sets and analytics offerings
    • Evaluate and validate cyber models
    • Manage client relationships and contribute to research efforts
  • Catastrophe Evaluation/Research:
    • Provide up-to-date information on natural catastrophes
    • Evaluate and validate catastrophe models
    • Test model sensitivities and validate components using third-party data
    • Analyze claims experience and quantify climate change impacts

Requirements

  • Experience: 1-3 years in data visualisation and/or business analysis roles, ideally within financial services
  • Skills and Requirements:
  • Analytical Skills: Strong logical thinking and problem-solving abilities
  • Attention to Detail: High attention to detail in data processing and analysis
  • Communication: Good communication skills, able to simplify complex ideas
  • Self-Starter: Initiative to work independently and collaboratively
  • Commercial Awareness: Understand and support clients with clarity and confidence
  • Technical Skills: Proficiency in programming (Python or R) is desirable
  • Project Management: Demonstrated ability to manage projects and coordinate activities across multiple departments
  • Soft Skills: Excellent communication, stakeholder management, and problem-solving skills. Ability to explain technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders
  • Education: Bachelor's degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Business Administration, or a related field, or equivalent experience

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
ðŸ”¥ðŸ”¥Data Insight AnalystðŸ”¥ðŸ”¥

ðŸ’« Social & Customer ðŸ’«







ðŸ’°Â£50k & benefits

ðŸ  Hybrid / London Office 2-3 days







ðŸ“ŒWork across a range of clients in retail, FMCG and charity industries

ðŸ“Œ Act as 'right hand person' to Head of Data to lead on projects

ðŸ“Œ Strong skills with SQL, social media listening tools and Google Analytics

ðŸ“Œ Basic (or more advanced) skills with Python coupled with base understanding of analytical modelling

ðŸ“Œ Business or client facing skills required to liaise with, and nurture client relationships







I have partnered with an award winning global Marketing & Advertising agency to hire for a Data Analyst to join their growing Data Science team.







A chance to diversify your experience by working across multiple clients in various industries, delivering data science solutions to support improved omnichannel customer experience and campaign performance.







You will use a variety of analytical techniques and tools, such as Python, Google Analytics and BrandWatch, to deliver insights and measurement around web, search and social data, working with API's (like TikTok and Spotify) to segment and analyse audience and customer data.







There is strong ambition and scope and deliver more advanced machine learning projects, so it's important your skills can span a range of analytics and more advanced data science projects, helping to win work in this space.







Responsibilities:




Build and maintain robust statistical algorithms and predictive models to support data analytics projects around customer, digital marketing and product performance.
Pull data from various API's to bridge gaps in traditional data sources and tools.
Translate complex data findings into compelling presentation for non-technical audiences ,through building beautiful data visualisations
Work in partnership with creative teams to support data driven thinking, content creation and web builds.







Experience:




Educated to degree level in relevant subject such as Computer Science, Machine Learning, Mathematics, Statistics, Physics, Chemistry, Engineering etc.
Strong coding skills with SQL, working with large and complex data sets to extract insights and identify trends
Ideally experience in programming and modelling with Python, to support analytics projects
Strong technical skills with Google Analytics (GA) or Adobe Analytics for digital analytics, as well as social media listening tools such as BrandWatch or TalkWalker
Ideally experience working with multiple API data flows

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data & Reporting Analyst â€“ 12 month fixed term contract

Hemel Hempstead (Hybrid) â€“ 3 days in office each week

Annual salary + bonus and benefits




Weâ€™re looking for an Analyst to set up and evolve reporting capabilities and standards to provide invaluable insight to the Procurement team and wider business that will help shape business decisions, buying strategy, guide good buying practices and drive compliance. This is an opportunity to be creative, build new reporting strictures and implement impactful change.




Your Opportunity:

To learn, develop and become an expert in a key area of the business by:

- Preparing monthly and quarterly reporting

- Setting up new tableau reporting and assist in implementing new reporting requirements

- Enhancing and evolving supplier spend data analysis and reporting capabilities, using the data to provide insight into spend patterns

- Reporting on key KPIs and compliance from supplier and understanding the impact of the performance measures

- Assisting with modelling and more complex analysis of information for Budgets/Forecasts.




What weâ€™d like you to bring:

- Advanced Excel capability and a good level of Tableau proficiency

- The ability to work with large amounts of data and to translate findings concisely

- A proven track record in an analytical role

- A good understanding of KPIs and commercial levers and they impact financial performance

- The ability to simplify complex analysis into easily understood language

- Good working knowledge of SQL an advantage




Whatâ€™s In It For You?

- Holiday allowance that rises with service, plus a â€˜Holiday Buy Schemeâ€™

- Annual bonus

- 20% discount on both Haven and Warner Hotels holiday for you, family and friends

- Comprehensive wellbeing support

- Access to the Bourne Leisure corporate box at the O2 Arena ,London

- Exclusive discounts with corporate partners

- Exciting career pathways, including Learning and Development opportunities such as Apprenticeships and Degrees

- Enhanced family friendly policies and pay (eligibility criteria applied)




Who are we?

Weâ€™re part of an award-winning Bourne Leisure family, which includes Haven & Warner Hotels. We have 9,000 fantastic team members and 39 beautiful seaside locations and our HQ based in Hemel Hempstead.




Whatâ€™s it like to work with us?

Working with us is ultimately defined by our exceptional people and teams. At Haven, we take pride in our Breath of Fresh Air culture, which focuses on valuing and supporting every team member. We prioritise openness and transparency in our interactions allowing our team members to be their authentic selves.

We operate a hybrid working model, meaning 50% of your working week will be spent at the office, occasionally on Park, or at external events.




What can you expect during the recruitment process?

The interview process will be up to 3 stages and may contain a presentation or skills test, depending on the role. If you require any support or reasonable adjustments to help you perform at your best during this process, please let us know.




Diversity, equity, and inclusion are at the heart of who we are and what we do. Our commitment to these values is unwavering and they are central to our mission. We encourage applications from all backgrounds, communities and industries and we are happy to discuss any reasonable adjustments or flexibility that you may require, including whether a role can be part-time or a job-share.




We genuinely care about every candidate's experience during the recruitment process and are here to provide support where we can. If you require any assistance or reasonable adjustments while applying, please don't hesitate to reach out to us at resourcingteam@bourne-leisure.co.uk.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
At Bending Spoons, weâ€™re striving to build one of the all-time great companies. A company that serves a huge number of customers. A company where team members grow to their full potential. A company that functions at unparalleled levels of effectiveness and efficiency. A company that creates value for shareowners at an extraordinary rate. And a company that does so while adhering to high ethical standards.




To achieve this mission, we execute the following strategy: We acquire a digital business with untapped potential and make it as successful as we can by leveraging our platformâ€”which comprises our expertise, technologies, data, brand, talents, and company culture. Then, we invest the proceeds into making our platform more powerful, and into acquiring new businesses. Thus, our strategy sees us combine an investorâ€™s attention to capital allocation with the hands-on approach of an operator.




For a talented, driven, and collaborative individual, working at Bending Spoons is an opportunity to learn, make an impact, and progress their career at an exceptionally high rate. Thatâ€™s our promise to such a candidate.




A few examples of your responsibilities

Collaborate with Product and Business teams to determine the most pressing questions that big data can help answer, and then figure out how to uncover those insights.
Query and analyze massive sets of usage data to identify product-improvement opportunities and actionable insights to profoundly impact our product strategy and roadmap.
Create brief, high-quality reports to explain your findings and discuss their implications with the relevant team members.
Screen the app stores and study competing products in search of insights and ideas we could learn from.
Help direct the development of our technologies devoted to the acquisition, storage, and manipulation of big data, supporting our efforts to constantly break new ground in this field.




What we look for

Reasoning ability. Given the necessary knowledge, you can solve complex problems. You think from first principles, and structure your ideas sharply. You resist the influence of biases. You identify and take care of the details that matter.
Drive. Youâ€™re extremely ambitious in everything you doâ€”and your initiative, effort, and tenacity match the intensity of your ambition. You feel deeply responsible for your work. You hold yourself to a highâ€”and risingâ€”bar.
Team spirit. You give generously and without the expectation of receiving in return. You support the best idea, not your idea. You're always happy to get your hands dirty to help your team. Youâ€™re reliable, honest, and transparent.
Proficiency in English. You read, write, and speak proficiently in English.




What we offer

Incredibly talented, entrepreneurial teams. Youâ€™ll work in small, result-oriented, autonomous teams alongside some of the brightest people in your field.
An exceptional opportunity for growth. We go to great lengths to hire individuals of outstanding potentialâ€”then, our priority is to put them in the ideal position to thrive. Spooners in their 20s lead products worth hundreds of millions of dollars. And if youâ€™ve got what it takes, youâ€™ll soon be playing an essential role in major projects, too.
Competitive pay and access to equity in the company. Typically, we offer an individual at the start of their career a salary of â‚¬52,246. Pay grows rapidly as you accumulate experience and translate it into greater impact. You can also receive some of your pay in company equity at a discounted price, thus participating in the value creation we achieve together. If relocating to Italy, you may enjoy a 50% tax cut.
All. These. Benefits. Flexible hours, remote working, unlimited backing for learning and training, top-of-the-market health insurance, a rich relocation package, generous parental support, and a yearly retreat to a stunning location. We help each Spooner set up the conditions to do their best work.




Commitment & contract

Permanent or fixed-term. Full-time.




Location

Milan (Italy) or fully remote.




Before you apply

Bending Spoons is a demanding environment: Weâ€™re extremely ambitious and we ask a lot of ourselves and one another. While this tends to lead to fantastic learning, achievements, and career growth, it also requires a significant commitment. So if you like the role and are ready to give your very best, donâ€™t hesitate to apply.




The selection process

We welcome applications in English and Italian. If you pass our screening, weâ€™ll ask you to take on a few tests that assess how you approach unfamiliar problems. If youâ€™re successful with those, weâ€™ll invite you to a series of interviews.




Bending Spoons is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. We consider for employment any applicant and we provide reasonable accommodations for an applicant with disabilities, which can be requested at accommodations-ext@bendingspoons.com.




Studies suggest that women tend not to apply for a job if their CV isnâ€™t a perfect fit. Here, talent takes precedence over experience. So if you like the role and think you could be awesome at it in time, go ahead and apply.

Title: Data Analyst - London Market Insurance
Place: City Of London, England, United Kingdom
Description:
A leading Insurance firm is looking to hire a Data Analyst to join their growing Analytics team.

Duties

Design, maintain and update the key information used at the point of sale for underwriters (ultimately the underwriting dashboard).
Working with the IT team and Data Engineer to make any required changes to the semantic/curated layers or data marts.
Working with IT to select the appropriate Artificial Intelligence tools to provide risk insight direct to the underwriter.
Design dashboards and visualisations bringing to life new analyses performed by the actuarial team and data scientists.
Data Analytics support to back office functions for decision-making (e.g. exposure management, finance, HR, claims).
Work with Data Scientists to research, identify, cleanse (in conjunction with the the IT team and Data Engineer), analyse, visualise and draw insights from external data sources.
Work with the IT team and Data Engineer to educate business on what information is available to encourage self service and idea generation for future analyses (i.e. gathering requirements/use cases).

Key Requirements:

Expert in data analysis/visualisation techniques
Programming skills (Python an advantage)
Working knowledge of some data science techniques
2+ years' data analysis/visualisation experience preferably in a Lloyd's environment
Highly proficient in required IT packages
Experience using Agile methodologies and proven ability to take complex requirements and break them down into epics and technical user stories an advantage
Experience working with Azure data technology stack such as Data Factory, SQL, Synapse Analytics, PowerBI an advantage




Desired Skills and Experience

* Expert in data analysis/visualisation techniques
* Programming skills (Python an advantage)
* Working knowledge of some data science techniques
* 2+ years' data analysis/visualisation experience preferably in a Lloyd's environment
* Highly proficient in required IT packages
* Experience using Agile methodologies and proven ability to take complex requirements and break them down into epics and technical user stories an advantage
* Experience working with Azure data technology stack such as Data Factory, SQL, Synapse Analytics, PowerBI an advantage

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Join a Scale-up Company With a Fantastic Culture.

Join a growing business who have multiple positions across various teams.

Expand your knowledge and skillset while working with DBT and Looker.

This role enables an experienced data analyst to further their career in a fast paced, exciting environment which is constantly growing. Theyâ€™ll enable you to work with DBT, Looker, SQL and Snowflake while working on various projects and specialising in a sector of the business.

What youâ€™ll be doingSitting within this modern data environment, in a growing team and industry, youâ€™ll be helping customers who struggle to get fair car insurance; people who have immigrated to the UK and struggle to drive here for the first time; and then youâ€™ll be helping the company to retain those customers.

Theyâ€™re hiring across three different teams and are considering candidates for different areas of the business; whether it be looking at customer and insurance fraud; customer segmentation and acquisitions; or insurance claims analysis; theyâ€™re hoping to grow in different areas.

This company have rapidly grown since their founding, having become profitable in the last few years and going from â€˜start-upâ€™ to â€˜scale-upâ€™, there is now no stopping them. Data has been important to them from the get-go, meaning they see the value of this â€“ and their data teams â€“ resulting in a modern data environment.

Please note there is a requirement of two days a week in the office in London and therefore we require someone within a commutable distance to commit to this.

What Experience Youâ€™ll Need To Apply


Several yearsâ€™ experience working as a Data Analyst
Experience within a start up is a must â€“ this role requires someone who has experience working in a start up or scale up environment to be considered for this role
Strong SQL experience
Bonus for DBT and/or Looker experience
Bonus for any experience working in claims, acquisitions or fraud
Previous experience managing and building relationships with stakeholders
Ideally working in an agile environment

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
DATA ANALYST

CENTRAL LONDON - HYBRID

Â£40,000 - Â£50,000




THE COMPANY

A subscription-based international provider of business information within the legal market, allowing law firms to make business-transforming decisions through data and analytics findings.




THE ROLE AND RESPONSIBILITIES

As a Data Analyst, your day to day will involve:

Data Mining - extract insights, organize information effectively, and apply statistical analysis to identify actionable trends in market and law firm performance.
Predictive Data Models - Develop predictive data models and collaborate with teams to address key business questions using data.
Dashboarding in Power BI - maintain and develop reports in Power BI for internal stakeholder use, which will be used to provide actionable insights to customers.
Data Pipelining - work with the central data team to ensure data is smoothly and effectively being collected, stored and processed throughout.




YOUR EXPERIENCE

To be successful in this Data Analyst role, you will require:

Strong dashboarding experience in Power BI, with an understanding of DAX measures and data modelling.
A strong understanding of data mining, ETL pipelines and processes.
Experience working as a sole contributor is preferred.




THE BENEFITS

A salary of up to Â£50,000 in your first year.
Flexible working.
Other benefits.




HOW TO APPLY

If interested in this role, please submit your CV via the Apply link on this page.

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
Job Summary:

As an AWF Business Intelligence Analyst on the Global Ads Marketing team, you will play a pivotal role in supporting the Q4 peak season planning. You will collaborate closely with the Business Intelligence Lead to analyze data trends, develop insightful reports, and contribute to the strategic execution of our advertising campaigns. Your expertise will help optimize our ad performance and ensure a successful peak season.

Key Responsibilities:

Collaborate with Marketing Managers to align data analysis with overall Ads product strategy.
Assist with the development and implementation of operational tools for peak season planning, becoming the go-to expert.
Work with cross-functional teams to support operational excellence and drive automation initiatives.
Engage with global stakeholders to provide data-driven insights and recommendations for Ads product enhancements.
Take charge of data collection, analysis, and reporting tasks to support decision-making during Q4 peak season.
Contribute to the design and execution of A/B testing to optimize campaign performance.
Synthesize complex data into actionable reports for the marketing team and senior management.
Assist in the management and quality assurance of campaign content and audience targeting.

Qualifications:

Bachelorâ€™s degree in Marketing, Business, Statistics, Economics, or equivalent experience.
Minimum of 1 year of experience in a data analysis role ideally within a marketing or ad-tech environment.
Proficient in data analysis tools (SQL, Excel, Tableau, etc.)
Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret data and generate meaningful insights.
Exceptional organizational and project management abilities, capable of handling multiple tasks with precision.
Excellent communication skills, with the aptitude to present data findings clearly to both technical and non-technical audiences.
A proactive mindset, with a willingness to take initiative and drive projects forward.
Adaptable and resilient, able to thrive in a fast-paced and dynamic work environment.

What We Offer:

A creative and collaborative workplace where your contributions are recognized.
A supportive team that values innovation and data-driven decision-making.

Join us and be a part of shaping the future of advertising during our most exciting time of the year!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We're hiring the very best data analysts to join our agile in-house team. You will be working on the fastest growing direct to consumer (e-commerce) brands and will have access to unlimited performance bonus.




What You'll Be Doing




Launch and optimize social, native and search advertising campaigns
Improve Conversion Rate across multiple funnels - multivariant and A/B testing
Design new funnels and analyse granular data using proprietary data warehouse
Manage unlimited budget while staying profitable. Compensation is directly correlated to your personal campaign performance and paid monthly

Results-driven and numbers-oriented personality

We're passionate about building life changing consumer products and delivering them with astonishing service. We are also one of the UK's fastest growing direct to consumer companies.

Salary above market
All the latest tech you need
Pension plan
